description.en:
Waiwhetū marae is located in Waiwhetū, Lower Hutt. It belongs to the Te Atiawa iwi.
The wharenui named Arohanui ki te Tangata. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and Tokomaru.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae a Waiwhetū ki Waiwhetū. He marae nō Te Ātiawa.
Ko Arohanui ki te Tangata te wharenui. Ko Aotea, ko Tokomaru ngā waka.

description.en:
Takapuwahia marae sits on the shores of Porirua Harbour. It falls beneath the mana of Ngāti Toa Rangātira iwi.
The wharenui, Toa Rangātira, was opened in 1982, replacing the previous wharenui, which had stood since 1901. The wharekai is called Parehounuku. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Whitireia, and the awa Porirua.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Takapuwāhia ki te wahapū o Porirua. Ko Ngāti Toa Rangatira te iwi.
I whakatuwheratia te whare tupuna a Toa Rangatira i te tau 1982, he whakahoutanga i te whare i tū tuatahi ai atu i te tau 1901. Ko Parehounuku te wharekai. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Whitireia te maunga, ko Porirua te awa.

description.en:
Hongoeka marae is located 9 km north of central Porirua, just outside Plimmerton. It belongs to the iwi Ngāti Toa Rangatira.
The whare tupuna is named Te Heke Mai Raro. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Whitireia, the awa Porirua and the moana Raukawa.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Hongoeka e 9 kiromita ki te raki o Porirua, kei te tahataha o Plimmerton. Nō Ngāti Toa Rangatira tēnei marae.
Ko Te Heke Mai Raro te whare tupuna. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Whitireia te maunga, ko Porirua te awa, ko Raukawa te moana.

description.en:
Katihiku is located about 7 km southwest of Otaki, off State Highway 1 and close to the coast. The principal hapū is Ngāti Huia of the Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga confederation. 
The whare tupuna is named Tamatehura. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Otaki. It is said that Katihiku was originally of the Muaūpoko confederation, but that around 1820 Te Rangihaeata and his warriors took it as a Ngāti Huia stronghold.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Katihiku e 7 kiromata ki te tonga o Ōtaki, ki tua i te Huarahi Matua 1, ā, e tata ana ki tai. Ko Ngāti Huia, ko Ngāti Tūwhakahewa ngā hapū. Ko Ngāti Raukawa te au ki te tonga te iwi.
Ko Tamatehura te whare tupuna. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Ōtaki te awa. E ai ki ētehi, nō Muaūpoko kē a Katihiku, engari nō ngā tau 1820 nā Te Rangihaeata me ana toa te whenua i riro mō Ngāti Huia.

description.en:
Raukawa marae is located in Otaki, off State Highway 1. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Korokī, Ngāti Maiotaki and Ngāti Pare of an iwi confederation made up of Ngāti Raukawa ki te tonga, Ngāti Toa Rangatira and Te Āti Awa. 
The whare tupuna is also named Raukawa. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Otaki.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Raukawa ki Ōtaki, ki tua i te Huarahi Matua 1. Ko Ngāti Korokī, ko Ngāti Maiotaki, ko Ngāti Pare ōna hapū. He marae nō te kotahitanga o Ngāti Raukawa ki te tonga, Ngāti Toa Rangatira, Te Āti Awa.
Ko Raukawa te whare tupuna. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Ōtaki te awa

description.en:
Wehiwehi marae is located about 11 km southwest of Levin, on State Highway 1. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Wehiwehi of the Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga confederation. 
The whare tupuna is also named Wehiwehi, and the wharekai is Patiharuru. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Manakau and Waikawa.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Wehiwehi, tekau mā tahi kiromita ki te tonga mā uru o Taitoko, ki runga i a Huarahi Matua 1. Ko Ngāti Wehiwehi te hapū. Ko Ngāti Raukawa ki te tonga te iwi.
Ko Wehiwehi hoki te whare tupuna, ko Pātiharuru te wharekai. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga. Ko Manakau, ko Waikawa ngā awa.

description.en:
Tūkorehe marae is located in Ōhau, about 8 km southwest of Levin, on State Highway 1. Its hapū are Te Rangitāwhia, Te Mateawa, Ngāti Manu and Ngāti Kapumanawawhiti of the iwi Ngāti Tūkorehe. 
The whare tupuna is also named Tūkorehe, and the wharekai is Ngaparetaihinu. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Ōhau.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Tūkorehe ki Ōhau, e 8 kiromita ki te tonga mā uru o Taitoko, ki runga i a Huarahi Matua 1. Ko Te Rangitāwhia, ko Te Mateawa, ko Ngāti Manu, ko Ngāti Kapumanawawhiti ngā hapū. Ko Ngāti Tūkorehe te iwi.
Ko Tūkorehe te whare tupuna. Ko Ngāparetaihinu te wharekai. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Ōhau te awa.

description.en:
Kawiu marae is located on the northern outskirts of Levin. Numerous hapū affiliate with this marae, including Ngāi Te Ao, Ngarue, Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Pariri, Ngāti Tamarangi, Ngāti Whanokirangi and Punahau of the Muaūpoko confederation. 
The whare tupuna is named Te Huia o Raukura, and the two wharekai are Rangimarie and Takeretanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Tararua, the awa Hokio and the roto Punahau.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Kawiu ki te taha raki o Taitoko. E hia kē nei ōna hapū; ko Ngāi Te Ao, ko Ngarue, ko Ngāti Hine, ko Ngāti Pariri, ko Ngāti Tamarangi, ko Ngāti Whanokirangi, ko Punahau. Ko Muaūpoko te iwi.
Ko Te Huia o Raukura te whare tupuna. Ko Rangimarie, ko Takeretanga ngā wharekai. Ko Kurahaupō te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Hokio te awa, ko Punahau te roto.

description.en:
Kohuturoa marae is located 4 km west of Levin, on the shores of Lake Horowhenua. its principal hapū include Ngāi Te Ao, Ngarue, Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Pariri, Ngāti Tamarangi, Ngāti Whanokirangi and Punahau. It belongs to the Muaūpoko confederation. 
The whare tupuna is named Pariri, and the wharekai is Te Aroha. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Tararua, the river Hokio and the moana Punahau.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Kohuturoa e 4 kiromita ki te taha uru o Taitoko, ki ngā wai o te roto o Horowhenua. Ko ōna hapū ko Ngāi Te Ao, ko Ngarue, ko Ngāti Hine, ko Ngāti Pariri, ko Ngāti Tamarangi, ko Ngāti Whanokirangi, ko Punahau. Ko Muaūpoko te iwi.
Ko Pariri te whare tupuna, ko Te Aroha te wharekai. Ko Kurahaupō te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Hokio te awa, ko Punahau te roto.

description.en:
Huia marae is located on the northern outskirts of Levin on State Highway 1. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Huia of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga iwi.
The whare tupuna is also named Huia. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Manawatū.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Huia ki te taha raki o Taitoko, ki runga i a te Huarahi Matua 1. Ko Ngāti Huia te hapū. Ko Ngāti Raukawa te au ki te tonga te iwi.
Ko Huia hoki te ingoa o te whare tupuna. Ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Manawatū te awa.

description.en:
Kerurū marae is located just off State Highway 57, about 10 km northeast of Levin and about 45 km southwest of Palmerston North. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Takihiku and Ngāti Ngārongo of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga.
The whare tupuna is named Mahinārangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Tararua, the awa Manawatū and the waka collective of Tainui.

Matau marae is located on the northern outskirts of Levin on State Highway 1. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Huia of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga.
The whare tupuna is also named Matau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui, the maunga Tararua and the awa Manawatū.
description.mi:
E tū ana te marae o Matau ki te taha raki o Taitoko, ki runga i a Huarahi Matua 1. Ko Ngāti Huia te hapū, ko Ngāti Raukawa te au ki te tonga te iwi.
Ko Matau hoki te ingoa o te whare tupuna. Ko Parekāwhai te wharekai, ko Tainui te waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Manawatū te awa.

description.en:
Motuiti marae is situated in Himatangi, on State Highway 1 about 4 km north of Foxton and 35 km southwest of Palmerston North. Motuiti belongs to the hapū Ngāti Rākau of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga.
The whare tupuna is named Rakau-Paewai, the wharekai is named Kuia Kūpapa and the marae connects ancestrally to the Manawatū river and the waka Tainui.
description.mi:
Kei Himatangi te marae o Motuiti, i te Huarahi Matua 1, āhua 4 kiromita ki te raki o Te Awahou, 35 kiromita whakatetonga-mā-uru o Papaioea. Nō Ngāti Rākau, hapū o te iwi o Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga tēnei marae.
Ko Rakau-Paewai te ingoa o te whare tipuna, ko Kuia Kūpapa te ingoa o te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Manawatū te awa, ko Tainui te waka.

description.en:
Paranui Pa is situated on SH1 2.2 Km south of the Palmerston North, Himatangi turn off. It belongs to the hapū Ngāti Tūranga of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga with affiliations also to Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The whare tupuna is named Tūranga. The wharekai is named Hinewaha and the wharepuni is named Te Kohera. The wider land around Paranui is known as Himatangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tararua Pae Maunga, the awa Manawatū and the waka collective of Tainui.
description.mi:
18 kiromita ki te tonga-mā-uru o Papaioea te marae o Paranui Pā. Nō Ngāti Te Au me Ngāti Tūranga o Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tongo te marae nei.
Ko Tūranga te whare tīpuna. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Ōtaki te awa, ko Tainui te waka.

description.en:
Whakawehi marae (also known as Poutu) is located northwest of Shannon on the Foxton Shannon Road, just off State Highway 57, about 35 km southwest of Palmerston North. It belongs to the hapū Ngāti Whakatere of Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga.
The whare tupuna of Whakawehi are named Mahi Tamariki and Poutu, and the whare karakia is Turongo. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Tararua, the awa Manawatū and the waka collective of Tainui.
description.mi:
Kei te raki-mā-uru o Te Maire i te Huarahi o Te Awahou ki Te Maire, āhua 35 kiromita ki te tonga-mā-uru o Papaioea te marae o Whakawehi. Nō Ngāti Whakatere o Ngāti Raukawa ki te Tonga te marae nei.
Ko ngā ingoa o ngā whare tīpuna o Whakawehi ko Mahi Tamariki me Poutū, ko Tūrongo te whare karakia. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Manawatū te awa, ko Tainui te waka.

description.en:
Te Ahu a Tūranga-i-Mua marae is located in Woodville, northeast of Palmerston North. The principal hapū for the marae are Ngā Hau E Whā of Ngāti Kahungunu, and Ngāti Te Koro and Ngāti Te Rangiwhakaewa of Rangitāne.
The whare tipuna is Te Huinga o Nga Waka. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Rangitumau and the awa Ruamahanga.
description.mi:
Kei Woodville te marae o Te Ahu a Tūranga-i-Mua, kei te raki-mā-rāwhiti o Papaioea. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngā Hau e Whā o Ngāti Kahungunu, ko Ngāti Te Koro me Ngāti Te Rangiwhakaewa o Rangitāne.
Ko Te Huinga o Ngā waka te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Kurahaupō te waka, ko Rangitūmau te maunga, ko Ruamahanga te awa.
 
Kei te huarahi o Tei i Woodville te marae o Te Ahu a Tūranga. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Te Koro me Ngāti Te Rangiwhakaewa o te iwi o Rangitāne.
Ko Te Huinga o Ngā waka te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Kurahaupo te waka, ko Manawatū te awa.

description.en:
Aorangi marae is located just south of Fielding. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Kauwhata of Ngāti Raukawa ki Te Tonga.
The wharenui is named Maniaihu. Aorangi marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Rangitīkei and the maunga Maungatautari.

Kauwhata (Kai Iwi Pā) is located just south of Feilding. Its iwi is Ngāti Kauwhata.
The wharenui is also named Kauwhata. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Oroua and Rangitīkei, and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Kauwhata (Kai Iwi Pā) is located just south of Feilding. Its iwi is Ngāti Kauwhata.
The wharenui is also named Kauwhata. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Oroua and Rangitīkei, and the maunga Maungatautari.

description.en:
Parewahawaha (Ōhinepuhiawe) marae is located in Bulls, Rangitikei and the land on which it sits is known as Ohinepuhiawe. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Parewahawaha of Ngāti Raukawa ki Te Tonga.
The wharenui is also named Parewahawaha and was opened by Dame Te Atairangikaahu on 15 April, 1967. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Rangitīkei and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Parewahawaha (Ōhinepuhiawe) marae is located in Bulls, Rangitikei and the land on which it sits is known as Ohinepuhiawe. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Parewahawaha of Ngāti Raukawa ki Te Tonga.

	 

	The wharenui is also named Parewahawaha and was opened by Dame Te Atairangikaahu on 15 April, 1967. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Rangitīkei and the maunga Maungatautari.

description.en:
Rātā (Te Hou Hou / Potaka) marae is located 10 km south of Hunterville on State Highway 1. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Tamateraka of Ngāti Hauiti. In the mid-1800s the main body of Ngāti Hauiti migrated to Te Hou Hou kāinga (settlement) at Rātā, and from that point on it became their stronghold.
The wharenui is named Hauiti and the marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka and the awa Rangitīkei.
description.mi:
Rātā (Te Hou Hou / Potaka) marae is located 10 km south of Hunterville on State Highway 1. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Tamateraka of Ngāti Hauiti. In the mid-1800s the main body of Ngāti Hauiti migrated to Te Hou Hou kāinga (settlement) at Rātā, and from that point on it became their stronghold.

	 

	The wharenui is named Hauiti and the marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka and the awa Rangitīkei.

description.en:
Poupatatē marae is located just outside Halcombe, about 40 km north of Palmerston North. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Pikiahuwaewae of Ngāti Raukawa ki Te Tonga.
The wharenui is also named Poupatatē. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Rangitīkei and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Poupatatē marae is located just outside Halcombe, about 40 kilometres north of Palmerston North. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Pikiahuwaewae of Ngāti Raukawa ki Te Tonga.

	 

	The wharenui is also named Poupatatē. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Rangitīkei and the maunga Maungatautari.

description.en:
Te Hiiri o Mahuta marae is located in Halcombe, between Feilding and Marton. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Matakore and Ngāti Rangatahi of Ngāti Maniapoto. 
The wharenui is name Te Hiiri o Mahuta; there is also a church on site, Hato Hohepa 1914. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui and the awa Rangitikei.
description.mi:
Te Hiiri o Mahuta marae is located in Halcombe, between Feilding and Marton. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Matakore and Ngāti Rangatahi of Ngāti Maniapoto. 
The wharenui is name Te Hiiri o Mahuta; there is also a church on site, Hato Hohepa 1914. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui and the awa Rangitikei.

description.en:
Rātā (Te Hou Hou / Potaka) marae is located 10 km south of Hunterville on State Highway 1. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Tamateraka of Ngāti Hauiti. In the mid-1800s the main body of Ngāti Hauiti migrated to Te Hou Hou kāinga (settlement) at Rātā, and from that point on it became their stronghold.
The wharenui is named Hauiti and the marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka and the awa Rangitīkei.
description.mi:
Rātā (Te Hou Hou / Potaka) marae is located 10 km south of Hunterville on State Highway 1. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Tamateraka of Ngāti Hauiti. In the mid-1800s the main body of Ngāti Hauiti migrated to Te Hou Hou kāinga (settlement) at Rātā, and from that point on it became their stronghold.

	 

	The wharenui is named Hauiti and the marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka and the awa Rangitīkei.

description.en:
Te Tikanga marae is located in Tokorangi, 60 km east of Whanganui. The primary hapū is Ngāti Wae Wae of Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The whare tipuna is also named Te Tikanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa and the awa Rangitikei.

Opaea marae is located just north of Taihape. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tamakopiri of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Tumakaurangi and the wharekai is Te Puawaitanga o Ngā Tumunako. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru, the maunga Tongariro and the moana Taupo Nui a Tia.

Tirorangi Pā marae is located in Karioi, 16 km southeast of Ohakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tongaiti of Ngāti Rangi iwi. 
The wharenui is called Rangiteauria.

Maungārongo marae is located in Ōhakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tui-o-Nuku of Ngāti Rangi iwi.
The whare are called Ko Te Kingi o Te Maungarongo and Tikaraina Ringapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru.
description.mi:
Maungārongo marae is located in Ōhakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tui-o-Nuku of Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi iwi.

	The whare are called Ko Te Kingi o Te Maungarongo and Tikaraina Ringapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru.

description.en:
Raketapauma marae is located about 24 km northwest of Taihape. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Rangituhia of Ngāti Rangi iwi.
The wharenui is called Rangituhia. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru and the maunga Ruapehu.

Hīrangi marae is located in Tūrangi. Its principal hapu is Ngāti Turangitukia of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Tūwharetoa i te Aupōuri. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro and the roto Taupo.
description.mi:
Hīrangi marae is located in Tūrangi. Its principal hapu is Ngāti Turangitukia of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.

	The wharenui is called Tūwharetoa i te Aupōuri. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro and the roto Taupo.

description.en:
Korohe marae is located about 7 km north of Tūrangi. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hine of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Rereao; it was constructed around 1909 and named after a grandson of Tūwharetoa. The whare ora is called Hinekura, and is named after a mokopuna of Rereao. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Matauhipo, the awa Waimarino and the roto Taupo.
The original kainga was known as Te Paetutu and was located at the mouth of the Waimarino River as it flows into Lake Taupo. Later the marae moved inland to an area known as Te Roringa. Around 1866 a church was erected in the area by a passing missionary and named Korohe; the name comes from the Bible and means 'Colossian'. Since this time the kainga and turangawaewae of Ngāti Hine has been known as Korohe.
Because the village of Ngāti Hine was built on a flood plain, and the Waimarino River threatened to flood the area, the kainga was relocated to its present site early in the 20th century.

Otūkou marae is located on Otukou Road in Rotoaira, 22 km southwest of Turangi. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hikairo of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Okahukura. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Te Arawa, the maunga Tongariro, the  awa Mangatipua and Wairehu, and the roto Rotoaira.
description.mi:
Otūkou marae is located on Otukou Road in Rotoaira, 22 km southwest of Turangi. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hikairo of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Okahukura. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Te Arawa, the maunga Tongariro, the  awa Mangatipua and Wairehu, and the roto Rotoaira.

description.en:
Tokaanu marae is located in Tokaanu, 3 km northwest of Turangi on Puanga Street. The primary hapū are Ngāti Kurauia, Ngāti Ngauru, Ngāti Ohomairangi and Ngāti Parehuia of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Puhaorangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Te Arawa, the maunga Pihanga, and the awa Tokaanu
description.mi:
Tokaanu marae is located in Tokaanu, 3 km northwest of Turangi on Puanga Street. The primary hapū are Ngāti Kurauia, Ngāti Ngauru, Ngāti Ohomairangi and Ngāti Parehuia of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Puhaorangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Te Arawa, the maunga Pihanga, and the awa Tokaanu

description.en:
Waihī marae is located about 4 km west of Tokaanu. Its principal hapu is Ngāti Turumakina of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Tapeka. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro and the roto Taupō.
description.mi:
Waihī marae is located about 4 km west of Tokaanu. Its principal hapu is Ngāti Turumakina of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Tapeka. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro and the roto Taupō.

description.en:
Waitetoko marae is located in Waitetoko, about 15 km north of Tūrangi on State Highway 1. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Te Rangiita of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Kapua Whakapipi. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro, the awa Tauranga Taupo and the roto Taupo.

Mōkai marae is located just off Tirohanga Road, in Mōkai, about 27 km northwest of Taupō. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hā, Ngāti Moekino, Ngāti Parekaawa, Ngāti Tarakaiahi, Ngāti Te Kohera and Ngāti Wairangi of the iwi Ngāti Raukawa and Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Pakake Taiari, after an ancestral chief, and the wharekai is named Parehingaawatea after his wife. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Tongariro and the awa Waikato.
On 15 August 2015 a fire destroyed the wharekai, Parehingaawatea. Efforts are currently underway to rebuild the wharekai.
description.mi:
Mōkai marae is located just off Tirohanga Road, in Mōkai, about 27 km northwest of Taupō. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hā, Ngāti Moekino, Ngāti Parekaawa, Ngāti Tarakaiahi, Ngāti Te Kohera and Ngāti Wairangi of the iwi Ngāti Raukawa and Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Pakake Taiari, after an ancestral chief, and the wharekai is named Parehingaawatea after his wife. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Tongariro and the awa Waikato.
On 15 August 2015 a fire destroyed the wharekai, Parehingaawatea. Efforts are currently underway to rebuild the wharekai.

description.en:
Nukuhau Pā, also known as Rauhoto marae, is located in Taupo, 200 m west of the mouth of the Waikato River on the corner of Piritoi Street and Morrison Street. The primary hapū are Ngāti Rauhoto and Ngāti Te Urunga of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Rauhoto and the wharekai is Te Urunga. The marae connects ancestrally to the the roto Taupo and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Nukuhau Pā, also known as Rauhoto marae, is located in Taupo, 200 m west of the mouth of the Waikato River on the corner of Piritoi Street and Morrison Street. The primary hapū are Ngāti Rauhoto and Ngāti Te Urunga of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Rauhoto and the wharekai is Te Urunga. The marae connects ancestrally to the the roto Taupo and the awa Waikato.

description.en:
Ōngāroto marae is located 45 km north of Taupō, on the banks of the Waikato River. The primary hapū is Ngāti Whaita of Ngāti Raukawa.
The whare tipuna is named Whaita. Ōngāroto connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pohaturoa and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko Ōngāroto marae kei tētehi 45 kirometa ki te raki o Taupō, i ngā tahatika o te tupuna awa Waikato. Ko tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Whaita o Ngāti Raukawa.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Whaita. Ō Ōngāroto herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga Pohaturoa me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Oruanui marae (otherwise known as Te Kapa o Te Rangiita ki Oruanui marae) is located near Oruanui, 15 km north of Taupo on Oruanui Road. The primary hapu are Ngati Kapawa and Ngati Te Rangiita of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Te Kapa o Te Rangiita and the waharoa is Rangimarie.
description.mi:
Oruanui marae (otherwise known as Te Kapa o Te Rangiita ki Oruanui marae) is located near Oruanui, 15 km north of Taupo on Oruanui Road. The primary hapu are Ngati Kapawa and Ngati Te Rangiita of the iwi Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Te Kapa o Te Rangiita and the waharoa is Rangimarie.

description.en:
Te Pākira marae is located in Whakarewarewa, Rotorua. The two primary iwi of this marae are Ngāti Wahiao and Tūhourangi, the latter comprised of the hapu Ngāti Puta, Ngāti Taoi and Ngāti Uruhina. Te Pākira is located in the geothermal village of Whakarewarewa.
Tūhourangi came to live beside their Ngāti Wahiao relations after the 1886 Tarawera eruption, which destroyed their Tarawera homes and killed over 150 of their people. They also resettled at nearby Ngapuna (Apumoana/Moerangi Marae) and down at Waitangi near Te Puke (Tuhourangi marae).
description.mi:
Te Pākira marae is located in Whakarewarewa, Rotorua. The two primary iwi of this marae are Ngāti Wahiao and Tūhourangi, the latter comprised of the hapu Ngāti Puta, Ngāti Taoi and Ngāti Uruhina. Te Pākira is located in the geothermal village of Whakarewarewa.
Tūhourangi came to live beside their Ngāti Wahiao relations after the 1886 Tarawera eruption, which destroyed their Tarawera homes and killed over 150 of their people. They also resettled at nearby Ngapuna (Apumoana/Moerangi Marae) and down at Waitangi near Te Puke (Tuhourangi marae).

description.en:
Waipahīhī marae is located in Waipahīhī, Taupo, just south of the Napier-Taupo Road turnoff. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hinerau and Ngāti Hineure of Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Kurapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tauhara, the awa Onekeneke and the roto Taupo.
description.mi:
Waipahīhī marae is located in Waipahīhī, Taupo, just south of the Napier-Taupo Road turnoff. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hinerau and Ngāti Hineure of Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Kurapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tauhara, the awa Onekeneke and the roto Taupo.

description.en:
Kauangāroa marae is located in Kauangāroa, alongside the Whangaehu River. Its hapū include Ngāti Huru Te Ra, Ngāti Houmahanga, Ngāti Hinga, Ngāti Mokahu, Ngāti Paenga, Ngāti Tukorero of the iwi Ngā Wairiki, with connections also to Ngāti Apa.
The wharenui, Kimihia te Maramatanga, was built in 1895. The wharekai is Te Puna Ora o Porini. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whangaehu.

Tini Waitara marae is located 5 km west of Turakina, on the banks of the Turakina River. Its hapū include Ngāti Hika Pirau, Ngāti Hinewai, Ngāti Ika, Ngāti Kiriwheke, Ngāti Rākeikauwhata, Ngāti Rangipuhi, Ngāti Rangitūmoana, Ngāti Ratua, Ngāti Riki, Ngāti Tamatea, Ngāti Tamawaina and Ngāti Tumoetere of the iwi Ngāti Apa. 
The wharenui is named Te Horo Taraipi, and the wharekai is Te Oranga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Paaraekaretu and Ruapehu, and a number of awa including Mangawhero, Rangitikei, Turakina, and Whanganui.

Tini Waitara marae is located 5 km west of Turakina, on the banks of the Turakina River. Its hapū include Ngāti Hika Pirau, Ngāti Hinewai, Ngāti Ika, Ngāti Kiriwheke, Ngāti Rākeikauwhata, Ngāti Rangipuhi, Ngāti Rangitūmoana, Ngāti Ratua, Ngāti Riki, Ngāti Tamatea, Ngāti Tamawaina and Ngāti Tumoetere of the iwi Ngāti Apa. 
The wharenui is named Te Horo Taraipi, and the wharekai is Te Oranga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Paaraekaretu and Ruapehu, and a number of awa including Mangawhero, Rangitikei, Turakina, and Whanganui.

Whangaehu marae is in Whangaehu, on the banks of the Whangaehu River. Its hapū include Ngāti Ika, Ngāti Kiriwheke, Ngāti Rangipakini, Ngāti Rangiwaho, Ngāti Rangiwhakaturia and Ngāti Ruahau of the iwi Ngāti Apa.
The wharenui is named Rangitahuahua, and the wharekai is Rakautaua. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō,  the maunga of Ruapehu and Paaraekaretu, and numerous awa including Mangawhero, Rangitikei, Turakina, and Whangaehu.

Ātene marae (also known as Kakata) is located roughly halfway between Whakaihuwaka and Koritini, on the Whanganui River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hineoneone of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui is named Te Rangi-i-heke-iho. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

Pungarehu marae is located roughly 20 km north of Whanganui, just off State Highway 4. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tuera of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui is named Maranganui Tuarua. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

Pūtiki Pā is located on the Whanganui River in Whanganui, at the junction of State Highways 3 and 4. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tupoho of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui are named Aotea, Kohanga Putiki and Te Paku o Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.
description.mi:
Pūtiki Pā is located on the Whanganui River in Whanganui, at the junction of State Highways 3 and 4. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tupoho of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui are named Aotea, Kohanga Putiki and Te Paku o Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

description.en:
Te Ao Hou marae is located on the outskirts of Whanganui city on the northern bank of the Whanganui River, just off State Highway 4. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tupoho of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi. 
The wharenui is named Te Puawaitanga and the wharekai is Te Ao Marama. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Taranaki and the awa Whanganui.

Matahiwi marae is located on Lawn Road in Clive. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hāwea and Ngāti Kautere of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Matau-a-Māui and the wharekai is Hina Taranga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki and the awa Tukituki.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Lawn i Waipūreku te marae o Matahiwi. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hāwea me Ngāti Kautere o te iwi Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Matau-a-Māui te wharenui, ko Hina Taranga te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Tukituki te awa.

description.en:
Hiruhārama marae (also known as Patiarero) is situated in Jerusalem, along the Whanganui River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hau of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui is named Whiri-Taunoka, and the wharekai is Morikaunui. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

Rānana marae (also known as Ruakā) is in Ranana, along the Whanganui River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Ruakā of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi. 
The wharenui is named Te Morehu, and the wharekai is Ruaka Hall 1954. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.
description.mi:
Rānana marae (also known as Ruakā) is in Ranana, along the Whanganui River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Ruakā of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi. 

	The wharenui is named Te Morehu, and the wharekai is Ruaka Hall 1954. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

description.en:
Tirorangi Pā marae is located in Karioi, 16 km southeast of Ohakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tongaiti of Ngāti Rangi iwi. 
The wharenui is called Rangiteauria.

Koriniti marae (also known as Otukopiri) is located roughly 40 km north of Whanganui, on the banks of the Whanganui River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Pāmoana of the iwi Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi.
The wharenui are named Hikurangi Wharerata, Poutama and Te Waiherehere, and the wharekai is Pamoana. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea, the maunga Ruapehu and the awa Whanganui.

Kauriki marae is located in Ngāpuke, about 14 km east of Taumarunui. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hinemihi of Ngāti Tūwharetoa iwi.
The whare tipuna is called Te Ōhāki. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tongariro, the awa Pungapunga and Whanganui, and the roto Taupo.

Wharauroa marae is located in Taumarunui on the banks of the Whanganui River. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Hinewai and Ngāti Rangatahi of Ngāti Maniapoto, as well as Hinemihi of Ngāti Tuwharetoa, Reremai and Poutama.
The wharenui is named Hikurangi. Wharauroa connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Whanganui and the maunga Hikurangi.
description.mi:
He marae a Wharauroa kei Taumarunui, i te tahatika o te awa Whanganui. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Hinewai, Ngāti Rangatahi o Ngāti Maniapoto, me Hinemihi o Ngāti Tuwharetoa, Reremai me Poutama.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Hikurangi. Ō Wharauroa herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te tupuna awa Whanganui me Hikurangi maunga.

description.en:
Kai Iwi marae is situated in Kai Iwi, a few km off State Highway 3. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Iti, Ngāti Pūkeko and Tamareheroto of the iwi Ngā Rauru.
The wharenui is named Awhakaueroa and the wharekai is Te Ririno-o-Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Kai Iwi te marae o Kai Iwi, e ruarua ngā kiromita i tua atu i te huarahi matua o SH3. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Iti, ko Ngāti Pūkeko me Tamareheroto o te iwi o Ngā Rauru.
Ko Awhakaueroa te ingoa o te wharenui, ā, ko Te Ririno-o-Te-Rangi te ingoa o te wharekai. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Kai Iwi marae is situated in Kai Iwi, a few km off State Highway 3. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Iti, Ngāti Pūkeko and Tamareheroto of the iwi Ngā Rauru.
The wharenui is named Awhakaueroa and the wharekai is Te Ririno-o-Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Kai Iwi te marae o Kai Iwi, e ruarua ngā kiromita i tua atu i te huarahi matua o SH3. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Iti, ko Ngāti Pūkeko me Tamareheroto o te iwi o Ngā Rauru.
Ko Awhakaueroa te ingoa o te wharenui, ā, ko Te Ririno-o-Te-Rangi te ingoa o te wharekai. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Tauranga Ika marae is located Nukumaru, on State Highway 3. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Ruaiti of the iwi Ngā Rauru. 
The wharenui is named Te Aputa ki Wairau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Nukumaru te marae o Tauranga Ika, i te huarahi matua o SH3. Ko tōna hapū matua, ko Ngāti Ruaiti o te iwi o Ngā Rauru.
Ko Te Aputa ki Wairau te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Pākaraka marae is located west of Maxwell. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Maika of the iwi Ngā Rauru.
The wharenui is named Te Whānau Pani (II and III), a name that has been applied to earlier whare also. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.

Takirau marae is located on the banks of the Waitōtara River, 30 km north of State Highway 3. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Pourua of the iwi Ngā Rauru.
The wharenui is named Ko Te Marunga Nui o Pourua. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei ngā tahataha o te awa o Waitōtara te marae o Takirau, e 30 kiromita ki te raki o te huarahi matua o SH3. Ko tōna hapū matua, ko Ngāti Pourua o te iwi o Ngā Rauru.
Ko Te Marunga nui o Pourua te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Te Ihupuku Pā marae is located on the outskirts of Waitōtara, on State Highway 3. Te Ihupuku Pā belongs to the hapū Ngāti Hinewaiata of the iwi Ngā Rauru Kitahi.
The wharenui is named Te Kawerau a Tāne, the wharekai is Kareponia. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei ngā pātū o Waitōtara tēnei pā o Te Ihupuku, i te huarahi matua o SH3. No te hapū i Ngāti Hinewaiata i te iwi o Ngā Rauru Kitahi te marae o te Ihupuku.
Ko Te Kawerau a Tāne te ingoa o te wharenui. Ko Kareponia te wharekai. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Whenuakura marae is located approximately 9 km east of Pātea, alongside the Whenuakura River. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hine of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui.
The wharenui is named Matangirei. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei 9 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Pātea te marae o Whenuakura, e kei ngā tahataha o te awa o Whenuakura. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hine o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Matangirei te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Taiporohēnui marae is located at the eastern end of Hawera. Its principal hapū are Hāmua and Hāpōtiki of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui.
The wharenui is named Koutu ki te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei te rāwhiti o Te Hāwera te marae o Taiporohēnui. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Hāmua me Hāpōtiki o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Kautu ki te Rangi te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Pukomoko Pa (Meremere) is located 11 km east of Hawera. Its primary hapū are Ngā Ariki and Ngāti Hine of Ngāti Ruanui. 
The wharenui is named Tataurangi and the marae connects ancestrally to the Aotea waka and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Te Hāwera te pā o Pukomoko (e kiia nei ko Meremere), e 11 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Te Hāwera. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngā Ariki me Ngāti hine o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Tataurangi te ingoa o te wharenui, ā, he whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Pariroa marae is located north of Pātea. Its principal hapū include Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Kōtuku, Ngāti Ringi, Ngāti Tūpoto and Tuatahi of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui. 
The whare are named Putoetoe and Taiporohēnui. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Pātea te marae o Pariroa. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hine, ko Ngāti Kōtuku, ko Ngāti Ringi, ko Ngāti Tūpoto me Tuatahi o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Putoetoe me Taiporohēnui ngā ingoa o ngā whare. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Wai o Turi marae is located in Pātea, near the mouth of the Pātea River. Its principal hapū is Rangitāwhi of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui. 
The wharenui is named Rangiharuru. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Pātea te marae o Wai o Turi, e tata ana ki te wahapū o te awa o Pātea. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Rangitāwhi o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Rangiharuru te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Manutahi marae (also known as Te Takere) is located in Manutahi. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tākou of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui. 
The whare are named Te Ao Tawhi (built in 1886) and Taumaha. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Manutahi te marae o Manutahi (e kiia nei ko Te Takere). Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Takou o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Te Ao Tāwhi (i hangaia i te tau 1886) me Taumaha ngā ingoa o ngā whare. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Kanihi (Māwhitiwhiti) marae is located in Ōkaiawa, 17 km north of Hawera. Its primary hapū are Kanihi and Umutahi of Ngāruahine.
The whare tipuna is also named Kanihi, and the marae connects ancestrally to the Aotea waka and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Ōkaiawa te marae o Kānihi (e kiia nei, ko Māwhitiwhiti), e 17 kiromita ki te raki o Te Hāwera. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Kānihi me Umutahi o te iwi o Ngāruahine Rangi.
Ko Kānihi te ingoa o te whare tipuna, he whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga, ki te awa o Waingōngōrō hoki.

description.en:
Ngārongo marae (also known as Ketemarae) is located north of Normanby, and east of the Waingongoro River. Its principal hapū is Araukūku of the iwi Ngāti Ruanui. 
The whare on site are named Kumea Mai te Waka and Te Manawanui. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Ko Ngārongo te marae (e kiia nei ko Ketemarae) kei te raki o Matariki, ā, kei te rāwhiti o te awa o Waingōngōrō. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Araukūkū o te iwi o Ngāti Ruanui.
Ko Kumea Mai te Waka me Te Manawanui ngā ingoa o ngā whare. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Ōeo marae is located on State Highway 45 near Otakeho. Its principal hapū include Ngāti Tamaahuroa and Tītahi of the iwi Ngāruahine Rangi. 
The wharenui are named Tipua Horonuku and Tipua Hororangi, the latter sharing this name with the whare mate. The wharekai is Rongorongo; it opened in 1984. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Ka tū te marae o Ōeo ki te ara matua o SH45 tata ki Ōtakeho. Ko tōnā hapū matua, ko Ngāti Tamaahuroa me Tītahi o te iwi o Ngāruahine Rangi.
Ko Tipua Horonuku me Tipua Hororangi ngā ingoa o ngā wharenui, ko Tipua Hororangi hoki te ingoa o te whare mate. Ko Rongorongo te wharekai; i huakina i te tau 1984.  He whakapapa tō te marae nei ki te waka o Aotea me Taranaki maunga.

description.en:
Waiokura marae is located in Manaia. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tū of the iwi Ngāruahine. 
The wharenui is named Parakau Tukau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotea and the maunga Taranaki.
description.mi:
Kei Manaia te marae o Waiokura. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Tū o te iwi o Ngāruahine.
Ko Parakau Tuakau te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Aotea, ki Taranaki maunga hoki.

description.en:
Parihaka Pa is located south of Kaikohe, off State Highway 12 along Te Irenga Road, in close proximity to Te Iringa marae. 
Its principal hapu are Ngāti Hinemutu and Ngāti Tautahi of the Ngapuhi confederation. The wharenui is also called Parihaka.

Pōtaka marae is located at Pōtaka in Hicks Bay, on Te Araroa Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Tāpaeururangi of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The whare is called Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Maungahiha and the awa Oweka.
description.mi:
Kei Pōtaka, Wharekahika, te marae o Pōtaka. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau o Tāpaeururangi o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te whare ko Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Maungahiha te maunga, ko Oweka te awa.

description.en:
Pūniho Pā (also known as Tarawainukiu) marae is located in Pūniho. Its principal hapū is Ngā Māhanga of the iwi Taranaki.
The wharenui is named Ko Pāuna te Tūpuna; it was built in 1937. The wharepuni is Kaimiromiro and the wharekai is Puna Te Aroha. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupo, the maunga Taranaki and the awa Hangātahua and Mate Nehunehu.
description.mi:
Kei Pūniho te Pā o Pūniho (e kiia nei ko Tarawainuku). Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngā Māhanga o te iwi o Taranaki.
Ko Pāuna te Tūpuna te ingoa o te wharenui; i hangaia i te tau 1937. Ko Kaimiromiro te ingoa o te wharepuni, ā, ko Puna Te Aroha te ingoa o te wharekai. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Kurahaupō, ki Taranaki maunga, ki ngā awa o Hangātahua me Mate Nehunehu anō hoki.

description.en:
Ōwae marae (also known as Manukorihi Pā) is located in Waitara. Its prinicipal hapū are Ngāti Te Whiti, Ngāti Rāhiri and Manukorihi of Te Atiawa iwi.
The first whare on site was opened in 1887 and named Te Whai-tara-nui-a-Ngārue. Additional houses are Tamatāne (opened in 1932) and Te Ikaroa-a-Māui (opened in 1936). The wharekai, opened in 1921, is named Tamawahine.
description.mi:
Kei Whaitara te marae o Ōwae (e kiia nei ko te pā o Manukōrihi). Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Te Whiti, ko Ngāti Rāhiri me Manukōrihi o te iwi o Te Āti Awa.
I tūwheratia te whare tuatahi o te marae nei i te tau 1887, ko Te Whai-tara-nui-a-Ngārue te ingoa i tapaina. Ko ētehi atu whare o te marae ko Tamatāne (i tūwheratia i te tau 1932) me Te Ikaroa-a-Māui (i tūwheratia i te tau 1936). I tūwheratia te wharekai i te tau 1921, ko tōna ingoa ko Tamawahine.

description.en:
Ōwae marae (also known as Manukorihi Pā) is located in Waitara. Its prinicipal hapū are Ngāti Te Whiti, Ngāti Rāhiri and Manukorihi of Te Atiawa iwi.
The first whare on site was opened in 1887 and named Te Whai-tara-nui-a-Ngārue. Additional houses are Tamatāne (opened in 1932) and Te Ikaroa-a-Māui (opened in 1936). The wharekai, opened in 1921, is named Tamawahine.
description.mi:
Kei Whaitara te marae o Ōwae (e kiia nei ko te pā o Manukōrihi). Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Te Whiti, ko Ngāti Rāhiri me Manukōrihi o te iwi o Te Āti Awa.
I tūwheratia te whare tuatahi o te marae nei i te tau 1887, ko Te Whai-tara-nui-a-Ngārue te ingoa i tapaina. Ko ētehi atu whare o te marae ko Tamatāne (i tūwheratia i te tau 1932) me Te Ikaroa-a-Māui (i tūwheratia i te tau 1936). I tūwheratia te wharekai i te tau 1921, ko tōna ingoa ko Tamawahine.

description.en:
Kairau marae is located just outside of Waitara. Its principal hapū is Pukerangiora of the iwi Te Atiawa.
The wharenui is named Te Hungaririki. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Tokomaru and the maunga Taranaki. Kawa (protocol) followed on Kairau is pāeke, meaning host speakers address first, followed by the visitors.
description.mi:
Kei Whaitara te marae o Kairau. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Pukerangiora o te iwi o Te Āti Awa.
Ko Te Hungaririki te ingoa o te wharenui. He whakapapa ōna ki te waka o Tokomaru, ki Taranaki maunga hoki. Ko pāeke te kawa o tēnei marae, arā, ko ngā tangata whenua ka tū i te tuatahi, kātahi ka whai mai ngā kaikōrero o te taha manuhiri.

description.en:
Mākirikiri marae is located to the south of Dannevirke. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Mutuahi and Ngāti Te Rangiwhakaewa of Rangitāne.
The wharenui is named Aotea Tuatoru. Mākirikiri marae connects ancestrally to the awa Manawatū and the Kurahaupō waka.
description.mi:
Kei te tonga o Tāmakinui-a-Rua te marae o Mākirikiri.  Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Mutuahi me Ngāti Te Rangiwhakaewa o Rangitāne.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Aotea Tuatoru.  Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Manawatū te awa, ko Kurahaupō te waka.

description.en:
Rākautātahi marae is located 27 km west of Waipukurau. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Mārau, Ngāti Rangitotohu and Ngāi Tahu of Ngāti Kahungunu.
The whare tipuna is named Te Poho o Te Whatuiāpiti. The marae connects ancestrally to the awa Manawatū and Mākāretu and the Takitimu waka.
description.mi:
Kei 27 kiromita ki te uru te tawhiti o te marae o Rākautātahi i Waipukurau. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Mārau, Ngāti Rangitotohu me Ngāi Tahu o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Te Poho o Te Whatuiapiti. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Manawatū me Mākāretu ngā awa, ko Takitimu te waka.

description.en:
Tapairu marae is located south of Waipawa just off Tapairu Road. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Parakiore and Ngāti Mārau of the iwi Ngāti Kahungunu.
The whare are Te Whaea o te Katoa and Te Rangatahi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Ruahine and the awa Waipawa.
description.mi:
Kei te tonga o Waipawa, kei raro atu i te rori o Tapairu, te marae o Tapairu. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Parakiore me Ngāti Mārau o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko ngā ingoa o ngā whare ko Te Whaea o te katoa rāua ko Te Rangitahi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Ruahine te maunga, ko Waipawa te awa.

description.en:
Houngarea marae is located in Pakipaki. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Ngarengare, Ngāti Papatuamāro, Ngāti Tamaterā and Ngāti Te Rehunga of Ngāti Kahungungu iwi. 
The wharenui is also called Houngarea. This marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Tukituki.
description.mi:
Kei Pakipaki te marae o Houngarea. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Ngarengare, ko Ngāti Papatuamāro, ko Ngāti Tamaterā me Ngāti Te Rehunga o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Houngarea hoki te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Tukituki te awa.

description.en:
Waimārama marae is located north of Waimārama settlement. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hikatoa, Ngāti Kurukuru, Ngāti Urakiterangi and Ngāti Whakaiti.
The wharenui is called Taupunga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Te Whanganui-a-Tara and the awa Waingongoro.
description.mi:
Kei te raki o te kāinga o Waimārama te marae o Waimārama. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hikatoa, ko Ngāti Kurukuru, ko Ngāti Urakiterangi me Ngāti Whakaiti.
Ko Taupunga te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Te Whanganui-a-Tara te maunga, ko Waingongoro te awa.

description.en:
Waiohiki marae is located in Waiohiki, south of Taradale. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Pārau of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Hikuranga and Otatara, and the awa Tutaekuri.
description.mi:
Kei Waiohiki te marae o Waiohiki, kei te tonga o Ōtātara. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Pārau o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Hikuranga me Ōtātara ngā maunga, ko Tūtaekurī te awa.

description.en:
Waipatu marae is located in Waipatu, Hastings. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hāwea, Ngāti Hinemoa and Ngāti Hori of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Heretaunga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahuranaki and the awa Ngaruroro.
description.mi:
Kei Waipatu i Heretaunga te marae o Waipatu. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hāwea, ko Ngāti Hinemoa me Ngāti Hori o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Heretaunga te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Ngaruroro te awa.

description.en:
Kahurānaki marae is located on State Highway 2 in Te Hauke, 20 km south of Hastings, and within the rohe of Heretaunga. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Te Rangikoianake and Ngāti Whatuiāpiti of Ngāti Kahungunu.
The wharenui is also named Kahurānaki, while the wharekai is named Te Whakaahu. The marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka, the maunga Kahurānaki and the moana Poukawa.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Matua 2 i Te Hauke te marae o Kahurānaki, 20 kiromita ki te tonga o Heretaunga, i te rohe o Heretaunga. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Te Rangikoianake me Ngāti Whatuiāpiti o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Kahurānaki hoki te ingoa o te wharenui, ā, ko Te Whakaahu te ingoa o te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Poukawa te moana.

description.en:
Korongatā marae is located on Maraekākaho Road in Bridge Pā. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Pōporo and Ngāti Whatuiāpiti of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Nukanoa. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki, and the awa Kārewarewa and Ngaruroro.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Maraekākaho i Korongatā te marae o Korongatā. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Pōporo me Ngāti Whatuiāpiti o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Nukanoa te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Kārewarewa me Ngaruroro ngā awa.

description.en:
Mangaroa marae is located on Raukawa Road in Bridge Pā. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Pōporo and Ngāti Rahunga of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Hikawera II. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki and the awa Ngaruroro
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Raukawa i Bridge Pā te marae o Mangaroa. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Pōporo me Ngāti Rahunga o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Hikawera II te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Ngaruroro te awa.

description.en:
Mihiroa marae is located in Pakipaki. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Mihiroa of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is also called Mihiroa and the wharekai is Pukepuke Tangiora. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki, and the awa Ngaruroro and Tukituki.
description.mi:
Kei Pakipaki te marae o Mihiroa. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Mihiroa o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Mihiroa hoki te wharenui, ko Pukepuke Tangiora te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Ngaruroro me Tukituki ngā awa.

description.en:
Ruahāpia marae is located on Ruahāpia Road in Waipatu, just north of Hastings. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hāwea and Ngāti Hori of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Karaitiana Takamoana. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki, and the awa Karamu and Ngaruroro.
description.mi:
Kei te huarahi o Ruahāpia i Waipatu, ki te raki o Heretaunga te marae o Ruahāpia. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hāwea me Ngāti Hori o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Karaitiana Takamoana te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Karamu me Ngaruroro ngā awa.

description.en:
Taraia marae is located on the Old Main Road, Pakipaki. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hōtoa and Ngāti Taraia.
The wharenui is also called Taraia. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki and the awa Ngaruroro and Tukituki.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Matua Tawhito i Pakipaki te marae o Taraia. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hōtoa me Ngāti Taraia.
Ko Taraia hoki te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Ngaruroro te awa.

description.en:
Tangoio marae is located in Tangoio. Its principal hapū are Marangatūhetaua (Ngāti Tū), Ngāi Tātara, Ngāi Te Ruruku ki Tangoio, Ngāti Kurumōkihi (Ngāi Tātara) and Ngāti Tū of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Pūnanga Te Wao. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, to Maungaharuru mountain, the awa Te Ngarue and the moana Tangitū.
description.mi:
Kei Tangoio te marae o Tangoio. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Marangatūhetaua (Ngāti Tū), Ngāi Tātara, Ngāi Te Ruruku ki Tangoio, Ngāti Kurumōkihi (Ngāi Tātara) me Ngāti Tū o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Pūnanga Te Wao te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Maungaharuru te maunga, ko Te Ngarue te awa, ko Tangitū te moana.

description.en:
Te Āwhina marae is located just outside of Motueka in the Tasman region. The marae belongs to Ngāti Tama, Ngāti Rārua and Te Ātiawa and lies in the shadow of two maunga, Pukeone and Tuao Wharepapa.
The whare tūpuna is named Turangāpeke, the wharekai is Te Āwhina (1958) and the whare karakia is named Te Ahurewa (1897). Te Āwhina connects ancestrally to the waka Tainui and the awa Motueka. The kawa for the marae is Tae Nga Kawa.
description.mi:
Kei waho atu o Motueka te marae o Te Āwhina i te rohe o Whakatū. Nō ngā iwi o Ngāti Tama, o Ngāti Rārua, o Te Ātiawa hoki te marae nei, ā, e tū ana kei raro i te maru o ōna maunga e rua, ko Pukeone me Tuao Wharepapa.
Ko Turangāpeke te ingoa o te whare tipuna, ko te wharekai ko Te Āwhina (1958), ā, ko Te Ahurewa te ingoa o te whare karakia (1897). Ko Tainui te waka, ā, ko Motueka te awa o te kāinga nei. Ko te kawa o te marae ko Tae Ngā Kawa.

description.en:
Te Hāroto marae is located 61 km from Napier, on the Napier-Taupo Road (SH5) in Te Hāroto. It belongs to the iwi of Ngāti Hineuru.
The whare tipuna is called Te Rongopai and the wharekai is Piriwiritua. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Titiokura and the awa Mohaka.
description.mi:
Kei Te Hāroto i te Huarahi o Ahuriri ki Taupō (SH5) te marae o Te Hāroto, 61 kiromita te tawhiti i Ahuriri. Ko te iwi matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Hineuru.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Te Rongopai. Ko te wharekai ko Piriwiritua. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Titiokura te maunga, ko Mōhaka te awa.

description.en:
Timikara marae is located in Moteo, west of Napier. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hinepare and Ngāti Māhu of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Whānau Pani. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Tūtaekurī.
description.mi:
Kei Moteo ki te uru o Ahuriri te marae o Timikara. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hinepare me Ngāti Māhu o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko te Whānau Pani te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Tūtaekurī te awa.

description.en:
Kohupātiki marae is located on Kohupātiki Road, Clive. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hori and Ngāti Toaharapaki of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Tānenuiarangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Ngaruroro.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Kohupātiki i Waipūreku te marae o Kohupātiki. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hori me Ngāti Toaharapaki o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Tānenuiarangi te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Waipapa-a-Iwi Mōhaka marae is located in Mōhaka. Its principal hapū are Kurahikakawa and Ngāti Pāhuawera of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Kahu O Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Mōhaka.
description.mi:
Kei Mōhaka te marae o Waipapa-a-Iwi Mōhaka. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Kurahikakawa me Ngāti Pāhauwera o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Kahu O Te Rangi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Mōhaka te awa.

description.en:
Hamuera marae, also known as Moteo, is located near Puketapu. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hinepare and Ngāti Māhu, of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Rangimarie. Hamuera connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki and the awa Tutaekuri.
description.mi:
Kei Puketapu te marae o Hamuera, ko Moteo anō tōna ingoa. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hinepare me Ngāti Māhu o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Rangimarie te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Kahurānaki te maunga, ko Tūtaekurī te awa.

description.en:
Omāhu marae is located in Fernhill (Puketapu), Hastings. It belongs to Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Kahukuranui and the wharekai is Ruatapuwahine. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Puketapu and the awa Ngaruroro.
description.mi:
Kei Puketapu i Heretaunga te marae o Omāhu, nō Ngāti Kahungunu tēnei marae.
Ko Kahukuranui te wharenui, ko Ruatapuwahine te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Puketapu te maunga, ko Ngaruroro te awa.

description.en:
Rūnanga marae is located in Ohiti, off the Taihape Road and north of Rūnanga Lake. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Te Ūpokoiri, Ngāti Hinemanu and Ngāti Mahuika.
The wharenui is called Te Aroha, the wharekai is Puanani. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Kahurānaki, the awa Ngaruroro and the roto Rūnanga.
description.mi:
Kei Ohiti heke i te Huarahi o Taihape ki te raki o te roto o Rūnanga ko te marae o Rūnanga. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Te Ūpokokiri, ko Ngāti Hinemanu me Ngāti Mahuika.
Ko Te Aroha te wharenui, ko Puanani te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Kurahaupō me Takitimu ngā waka, ko Tararua te maunga, ko Ngaruroro te awa, ko Rūnanga te roto.

description.en:
Rangiāhua marae is located in Rangiāhua, west of Frasertown on the road to Lake Waikaremoana. Its principal hapū is Ngāi Tamaterangi of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Tamaterangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Waiau.
description.mi:
Kei te uru o Frasertown i te huarahi ki te roto o Waikaremoana te marae o Rangiāhua. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Tamaterangi o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Poho o Tamaterangi te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Waiau te awa.

description.en:
Ruataniwha marae is located west of the A&P Showgrounds outside Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Kapuamātotoru.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Riria. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Wairoa.
description.mi:
Kei te uru o te Papa A&P i waho o Wairoa te marae o Ruataniwha. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Kapuamātotoru.
Ko Te Poho o Riria te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Takitimu marae is located on the eastern banks of the Waipaoa River, north of Pātūtahi on the Poverty Bay flats, some 20 km inland from Gisborne. The marae belongs to the hapū Te Whānau a Kai of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The whare tupuna is named Te Poho o Whakarau Oratanga a Tamure. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei te taha rāwhiti o te awa o Waipaoa ki te raki o Pātūtahi i ngā pārae o Tūranganui ā-Kiwa, āhua 20 kiromita tuawhenua o Tūranga te marae o Takitimu. Nō te hapū o Te Whānau a Kai o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Te Poho o Whakarau Oratanga a Tūtāmure te whare tipuna. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Taihoa marae is located on the north side of the Wairoa River in Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Kurupakiaka (Te Kāwiti).
The wharenui is called Te Ōtāne. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Wairoa.
description.mi:
Kei te raki o te awa o Wairoa i Wairoa te marae o Taihoa. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Kurupakiaka (Te Kāwiti).
Ko Te Ōtāne te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Raupunga Te Huki marae is located just off State Highway 2 in Raupunga, 35 km west of Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Pāhauwera of Ngāti Kahungunu.
The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Haruru, the awa Mohaka and the waka Takitimu. The image here is of the whare tupuna Hineringa and Te Huki that existed on the site until they were destroyed by fire in April 2007.
description.mi:
Kei Raupunga te marae o Raupunga Te Huki, āhua tata ki te Huarahi Matua, 35 kiromita whakateuru atu o Wairoa. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Pāhauwera o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Haruru te maunga, ko Mōhaka te awa, ko Takitimu te waka. Ko te whakaahua tēnei o ngā whare tīpuna, o Hineringa rāua ko Te Huki, i tū ki tēnei wāhi i mua, engari nō te marama o Apereira 2007 i tahuna ngā whare nei e te ahi.

description.en:
Waipapa-a-Iwi Mōhaka marae is located in Mōhaka. Its principal hapū are Kurahikakawa and Ngāti Pāhuawera of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Kahu O Te Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Mōhaka.
description.mi:
Kei Mōhaka te marae o Waipapa-a-Iwi Mōhaka. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Kurahikakawa me Ngāti Pāhauwera o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Kahu O Te Rangi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Mōhaka te awa.

description.en:
Kihitu marae is located on Rauhina Roadway, Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Kahu.
The wharenui is called Te Rauhina. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Wairoa.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Rauhina i Wairoa te marae o Kihitu. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Kahu.
Ko Te Rauhina te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Whakakī marae is located in Whakakī, approximately 18 km east of Wairoa, close to Whakakī Lagoon. Its principal hapū is Ngāi Te Ipu of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the awa Wairoa and the moana Whakakī.
description.mi:
Kei Whakakī te marae o Whakakī, āhua 18 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Wairoa, tata ki te Hāpua o Whakakī. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Te Ipu o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa, ko Whakakī te moana.

description.en:
Hinemihi marae is located in Ruataniwha Road, Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hinemihi
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Hinemihi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Wairoa.
description.mi:
Kei te huarahi o Ruataniwha i Wairoa te marae o Hinemihi. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hinemihi.
Ko Te Poho o Hinemihi te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Iwitea marae is located in Wairoa. Its principal hapū is Ngāi Tahu Matawhāiti of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi. 
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Tahu. Iwitea connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the awa Wairoa, and the moana Ōhuia, Te Paeroa, Wairau and Whakakī.
description.mi:
Kei Wairoa te marae o Iwitea. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Tahu Matawhāiti o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Poho o Tahu te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa, ko Ōhuia, ko Te Paeroa, ko Wairau, ko Whakakī ngā moana.

description.en:
Kahungunu marae, also known as Te Tahinga, is located in Nūhaka. Its principal hapū is Rakaipaaka of Ngāti Kahungungu iwi. 
The wharenui is also called Kahungunu. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Nūhaka.
description.mi:
Kei Nūhaka te marae o Kahungunu, ko Te Tahinga anō tōna ingoa. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Rākaipaaka o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Kahungunu hoki te ingoa o te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Nūhaka te awa.

description.en:
Pākōwhai marae is located between Pātūtahi and Waituhi, 20 km inland from Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Te Whānau a Kai of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi. It was once known as Pākōhai in the local dialect.
description.mi:
Kei waenganui i Pātūtahi me Waituhi 20 kiromita whakatuawhenua atu o Tūranga te marae o Pākōwhai. Nō te hapū o Te Whānau a Kai o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga. Ko Pākōhai tōna ingoa i mua ki tō te reo o te iwi kāinga.

description.en:
Pūtahi marae is located south of Frasertown. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Hinepehinga of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Hinepehinga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Wairoa.
description.mi:
He marae kei te raki o Te Kapu ko Pūtahi te ingoa. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hinepehinga o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Poho o Hinepehinga te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Wairoa te awa.

description.en:
Kaiuku marae, also known as Oku-ra-renga, is located on Māhia East Coast Road in Māhia. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tū ki Kaiuku of Rongomaiwahine. Kaiuku also shares connections  to Rongowhakata, Ngāti Kahungungu, Ngāpuhi and Ngāi Tamanuhiri.
The wharekai is called Kiwi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Maungaroa and the awa Waihakeke.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o te Rāwhiti i Māhia te marae o Kaiuku, ko tētahi ingoa anō ōna ko Okurarenga. Ko ōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Tū me Ngāti Tama o te iwi o Rongomaiwahine. He hononga anō ki te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Kiwi te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Maungaroa te maunga, ko Ōraka me Whangawehi ngā awa.

description.en:
Tuahuru marae is located in Māhia. Its principal hapū is Ngāi Tū of Rongomaiwahine.
The wharenui is called Hine te Rongo. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō, the maunga Tairea and the awa Whangawehi.
description.mi:
Kei Māhia te marae o Tuahuru. Ko te hapu matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tū o Rongamaiwahine.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Hine te Rongo. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Kurahaupō te waka, ko Tairea te maunga, ko Whangawehi te awa.

description.en:
Māhanga marae, also known as Rongomaiwahine, is located in Māhia. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tū of the iwi Rongomaiwahine. Māhanga also has connections to the iwi Ngāti Kahungunu.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Rongomaiwahine. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Rākauwhakatangitangi, the awa Kōpuawhara and the roto Rotopounamu.
description.mi:
Kei Māhia te marae o Māhanga, ko Rongomaiwahine rānei. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Tū o te iwi o Rongamaiwahine. He hononga anō ki te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Poho o Rongomaiwahine te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Rākauwhakatangitangi te maunga, ko Kōpuawhara te awa, ko Rotopounamu te roto.

description.en:
Te Manutai marae is located in Tahaenui, west of Nūhaka. Its principal hapū is Rakaipaaka of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is also called Te Manutai. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Tahaenui.
description.mi:
Kei Tāhaenui ki te uru o Nūhaka te marae o Te Manutai. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Rākaipaaka o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Manutai hoki te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Tāhaenui te awa.

description.en:
Ruawharo marae is located in Ōpoutama, Māhia. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tama of Rongomaiwahine iwi.
The wharenui is also called Ruawharo. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Kurahaupō.
description.mi:
Kei Ōpoutama i Māhia te marae o Ruawharo. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Tama, o te iwi Rongomaiwahine.
Ko Ruawharo hoki te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Kurahaupō te waka, ko Taupiri te maunga, ko Waipiata te awa.

description.en:
Tāne-nui-a-Rangi marae is located in Nūhaka. Its principal hapū is Rakaipaaka of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is also called Tāne-nui-a-Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Nūhaka.
description.mi:
Kei Nūhaka te marae o Tāne-nui-a-Rangi. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Rākaipaaka o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Tāne-nui-a-Rangi hoki te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Nūhaka te awa.

description.en:
Mokonuiārangi marae is located in Maraeroa, on the western end of Horeke Road in the Hokianga. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tawake ki te Moana, Te Ngahengahe and Ngāti Toro, linking Mokonuiarangi marae to the wider confederation of Ngāpuhi. 
The wharenui is also called Mokonuiārangi.
description.mi:
Mokonuiārangi marae is located in Maraeroa, on the western end of Horeke Road in the Hokianga. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tawake ki te Moana, Te Ngahengahe and Ngāti Toro, linking Mokonuiarangi marae to the wider confederation of Ngāpuhi. 
The wharenui is also called Mokonuiārangi.

description.en:
Muriwai Pā (Tāmanuhiri) is located about 25 km south of Gisborne, in the township of Muriwai. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tahupo, Ngāti Kahutia, Ngāti Paea, Ngāti Rangitauwhiwhia and Ngāti Tawehi of Ngāi Tāmanuhiri. 
The whare tupuna is named Te Poho o Tāmanuhiri. The marae connects ancestrally with the waka Horouta, the maunga Te Kuri a Paoa and the awa Maraetaha.
description.mi:
Kei te taone o Muriwai te Pā o Muriwai, āhua 25 kiromita ki te tonga o Tūranganui ā-Kiwa. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tahupō, ko Ngāti Kahutia, ko Ngāti Pāea, ko Ngāti Rangitauwhiwhia me Ngāti Tawehi o Ngāi Tāmanuhiri.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Te Poho o Tāmanuhiri.  Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Te Kuri a Paoa te maunga, ko Maraetaha te awa.

description.en:
Ngātapa marae is located about 20 km northwest of Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Te Whānau a Kai of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The marae is ancestrally defined by the awa Waipaoa, the two maunga of Ngātapa and Maungahaumi, and connects to the greater waka collective of Horouta.
description.mi:
20 kiromita ki te raki-mā-uru o Tūranga te marae o Ngātapa. Nō te hapū o Te Whānau a Kai o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Ngātapa me Maungahaumi ngā maunga, ko Horouta te waka.

description.en:
Ohako marae is located 13 km east of Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Ngāi Tawhiri, Ngāi Te Kete and Ngāti Ruapani of Rongowhakaata.
The whare tupuna is named Te Kiko o te Rangi and the wharekai is Ohako. The complex includes an urupa, Turakina. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Te Arai and the maunga Papatu.
description.mi:
Kei Tūranganui a Kiwa te marae o Ohako, 13 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o te taone. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tāwhiri, ko Ngāi Te Kete me Ngāti Ruapani o Rongowhakaata.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Te Kiko o te Rangi. Ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Ohako. Ko Turakina te ingoa o te urupā. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Te Ārai te awa, ko Papatu te maunga.

description.en:
Pāhou marae is located 14 km east of Gisborne, in the township of Manutuke. It identifies primarily with the hapū Ngāti Maru of Rongowhakaata. 
The wharepuni is named Te Poho o Taharakau and the wharekai is Mokai. There is also an urupa, Tamahene. The marae connects ancestrally with the waka Horouta and Takitimu, the maunga Puketapu, and the awa Waipaoa and Karaua.
description.mi:
Kei te tāone o Manutuke, 14 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Tūranga, te marae o Pāhou. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Maru o Rongowhakaata.
Ko Te Poho o Taharākau te wharepuni, ko Mōkai te wharekai, ko Tamahene te urupa. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta me Takitimu ngā waka, ko Puketapu te maunga, ko Waipaoa me Karaua ngā awa.

description.en:
Pākōwhai marae is located on Pākōwhai Road, Frasertown. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Mihi of Ngāti Kahungunu iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Huinga o Te Aroha. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu and the awa Waiau and Wairoa.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Pākōwhai i Te Kapu te marae o Pākōwhai. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Mihi o te iwi o Ngāti Kahungunu.
Ko Te Huinga o Te Aroha te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Takitimu te waka, ko Waiau me Wairoa ngā awa.

description.en:
Rongopai marae is located 20 km northwest of Gisborne, at Waituhi. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Kai of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The wharenui of Rongopai is a uniquely painted house that was created in honour of the prophet Te Kooti. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga of Ngātapa and Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
20 kiromita ki te raki-mā-rawhiti o Tūranga i Waituhi te marae o Rongopai. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Kai o Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
Ko Rongopai te wharenui, i peitahia te whare nei hei whakanui i te poropiti, i a Te Kooti. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Ngātapa me Maungahaumi ngā maunga.

description.en:
Takitimu marae is located on the eastern banks of the Waipaoa River, north of Pātūtahi on the Poverty Bay flats, some 20 km inland from Gisborne. The marae belongs to the hapū Te Whānau a Kai of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The whare tupuna is named Te Poho o Whakarau Oratanga a Tamure. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei te taha rāwhiti o te awa o Waipaoa ki te raki o Pātūtahi i ngā pārae o Tūranganui ā-Kiwa, āhua 20 kiromita tuawhenua o Tūranga te marae o Takitimu. Nō te hapū o Te Whānau a Kai o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Te Poho o Whakarau Oratanga a Tūtāmure te whare tipuna. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Mangatū marae is located in Whatatutu, 50 km inland from Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Ngariki, Ngāti Wahia, and Te Whānau a Taupara of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The wharenui is called Te Ngāwari. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Mangatū and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei Whatatutu āhua 50 kiromita whakatuawhenua atu o Tūranga te marae o Mangatū. Nō ngā hapū o Ngāriki, o Ngāti Wahia me Te Whānau a Taupara o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Te Ngāwari te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Mangatū te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Rangatira marae is located just west of Te Karaka, across the Waipaoa River. It belongs to the hapū Ngāti Wahia of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The wharenui is called Whakahau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei te uru o Te Karaka, kei tarawāhi o te awa o Waipaoa te marae o Rangatira. Nō te hapū o Ngāti Wāhia o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Whakahau te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Takipu marae is located just south of Te Karaka, some 30 km inland from Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Te Whānau a Taupara of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The whare tupuna is named Te Poho o Pikihoro. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei te tonga o Te Karaka, āhua 30 kiromita whakatuawhenua atu o Tūranga te marae o Takipū.  Nō te hapū o Te Whānau a Taupara o Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
Ko Te Poho o Pikihoro te whare tīpuna. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Tapuihikitia marae is located between Te Karaka and Whatatutu, 40 km inland from Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Ngā Pōtiki and Te Whānau a Taupara of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki.
The wharenui is called Te Aroha, and the wharekai is Te Tumanako Tuarua. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei waenganui i ngā tāone o Te Karaka me Whatatutu, āhua 40 kiromita whakatuawhenua atu o Tūranga te marae o Tapuihikitia. Nō ngā hapū o Ngā Pōtiki me Te Whānau a Taupara o Te Aitanga ā Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Te Aroha te wharenui, ko Te Tūmanako Tuarua te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Parihimanihi marae is located north of Gisborne, close to the Waipaoa River. It belongs to the hapū Ngāi Tūketenui and Ngāti Wahia of Te Aitanga ā Māhaki. 
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Mahaki, and the wharekai is Te Kura o Mahaki. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Waipaoa and the maunga Maungahaumi.
description.mi:
Kei te raki o Tūranga, pātata atu ki te awa o Waipaoa te marae o Parihimanihi. Nō te hapū o Ngāi Tūtekenui me Ngāti Wāhia o Te Aitanga a Māhaki te marae nei.
Ko Te Poho o Māhaki te wharenui, ko Te Kura o Māhaki te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Waipaoa te awa, ko Maungahaumi te maunga.

description.en:
Te Kurī a Tuatai marae (also known as Awapuni Pā) is located in Awapuni, Gisborne. It belongs to the hapū Ngāi Tāwhiri, Ruapani and Te Whānau a Iwi of the Rongowhakaata iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Materoa. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta and Takitimu, the awa Waikanae and the maunga Titirangi.
description.mi:
Kei Awapuni i Tūranga te marae o Te Kurī a Tuatai, he ingoa anō tōna ko Awapuni Pā. Nō ngā hapū o Ngāi Tāwhiri, Ruapani me te Te Whānau a Iwi o te iwi o Rongowhakaata te marae nei.
Ko Te Poho o Materoa te Wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta me Takitimu ngā waka, ko Waikanae te awa, ko Titirangi te maunga.

description.en:
Te Poho o Rāwiri marae is in the Gisborne suburb of Kaiti. It belongs to the hapu Ngāti Konohi and Ngāti Oneone of Ngāti Porou.
Built under the guidance of revered Ngāti Porou leader Sir Āpirana Ngata (1874–1950), the marae was opened in March 1930. The present marae stands where the first house of Te Poho o Rāwiri was built in 1852. The wharenui is also named Te Poho o Rawiri. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Turanga nui, and the maunga Titirangi.
description.mi:
Kei te rohe taone o Kaiti i Tūranganui a Kiwa te marae o Te Poho o Rāwiri. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Konohi me Ngāti Oneone o Rongowhaata.
I hangaia tēnei marae i raro i ngā whakaritenga o Tā Apirana Ngata (1874-1950), kaiarataki o Ngāti Porou, ā, i whakatuwheratia i te marama o Māehe 1930.  Ka tū te marae o ināianei ki te wāhi i hangaia ai te whare tuatahi o Te Poho o Rāwiri i te tau 1852.  Ko Te Poho o Rāwiri hoki te ingoa o te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Tūranganui te awa, ko Titirangi te maunga.

description.en:
Whāngārā is located between Gisborne and Tolaga Bay, 5 km southwest of Gable End Foreland and 2 km east of State Highway 35. The primary hapū to affiliate with this marae is Ngāti Konohi, Whāngārā features prominently in the early history of Ngāti Porou iwi, and is also well known as the location for the movie The Whale Rider.
