The marae has two wharenui: Whitireia (with a carving of the ancestor Paikea atop) and Waho te Rangi; the wharekai is Te Hokowhitu a Tū. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta and Tereānini and the maunga Pukehapopo.
description.mi:
Kei waenganui i Tūranganui ā-Kiwa me Uawa te marae o Whāngārā. E 5 kiromita whakatetonga-mā-uru te tawhiti mai i Parinuiterā me te 2 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o te Huarahi Matua 35. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Konohi. He kāinga nui a Whāngārā i roto i ngā kōrero o Ngāti Porou, ā, i rongonuitia hoki mō te kiriata o Te Kaieke Tohorā.
E rua ngā whare tīpuna o Whāngārā; ko Whitireia (te whare me te tekoteko o Paikea), me Wahoterangi. Ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Te Hokowhitu a Tū. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta me Tereānini ngā waka, ko Waiomoko te awa, ko Pukehāpopo te maunga.

description.en:
Hinetamatea marae, also known as Anaura, is located in Anaura Bay. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hau and Ngāti Wakarara of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is also called Hinetamatea. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the moana Anaura.
description.mi:
Kei Anaura te marae o Hinetamatea. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Hau me Ngāti Wakarara o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Hinetamatea. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Nūhiti te maunga, ko Hāwai te awa.

description.en:
Hauiti marae is located on Hauiti Road in Tolaga Bay, south of the Uawa River. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tutekohi and Ngāti Kahukuranui of Te Aitanga a Hauiti iwi.
The wharenui is called Ruakapanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the four waka Horouta, Nukutaimemeha, Takitimu and Tereanini, the maunga Titirangi, and the awa Uawanui-a-Ruamatua.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Hauiti te marae o Hauiti, kei te taha tonga o te awa o Uawa. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tūtekohi me Ngāti Kahukuranui o te iwi o Te Aitanga a Hauiti.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Ruakapanga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta, ko Nukutaimemeha, ko Takitimu me Tereanini ngā waka, ko Titirangi te maunga, ko Uawanui a Ruamatua te awa.

description.en:
Puketāwai Marae is situated approximately 8 km north-east of Uawa (Tolaga Bay). Its name derives from the eponymous ancestor Te Amowhiu (the first), mother of Te Rangipureora, whose name the people of this area identify with by calling themselves Te Whanau o Te Rangipureora.
The name of the whare is Te Amowhiu. Ngāti Kuranui is the other hapu associated with the area. The name Puketawai originates from the tawai tree, which in former times grew profusely on the hills surrounding the Papakāinga.
description.mi:
E 8 kiromita ki te raki o Uawa te marae o Puketāwai. Ko te ingoa o te whare ko Te Amowhiu (te tuatahi), tipuna nui o tēnei wāhi, kōkā o Te Rangipureora, nōna anō te ingoa o te hapū matua, arā, o Te Whānau a Te Rangipureora.  Ko Ngāti Kuranui hoki tētahi o ngā hapū o tēnei wāhi.
I takea mai te ingoa o Puketāwai i te matomato o te tipu o ngā rākau tāwai i ngā puke o te papakāinga nei

description.en:
Te Rāwheoro marae is located on Tauwhareparae Road, Tolaga Bay, towards the mouth of the Uawa River. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Patu Whare and Te Aitanga a Hauiti of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Whare Wananga o Te Rawheoro. The marae connects ancestrally to the four waka Horouta, Nukutaimemeha, Takitimu and Tereanini, the maunga Hikurangi and Titirangi, and the awa Uawa.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Tauwharepārae i Uawa te marae o Te Rāwheoro. Ko te hapū matua ko Ngāti Patuwhare o Te Aitanga a Hauiti.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Whare Wananga o Te Rawheoro. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta, ko Nukutaimemeha, ko Tereanini ngā waka, ko Titirangi te maunga, ko Uawanui a Ruamatua te awa.

description.en:
Kiekie marae is located just north of Waipiro Bay. Its principal hapū include Te Whānau a Rākairoa and Te Whānau a Te Haemata of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Hau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the awa Kiekie and the moana Tokomaru.
description.mi:
Kei te raki o Waipiro te marae o Kiekie. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Rākairoa me Te Whānau a Te Haemata o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Hau. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Tokatea te maunga, ko Kiekie te awa.

description.en:
Pākirikiri marae is located in Tokomaru Bay. Its principal hapū are Te Whānau a Ruataupare and Te Whānau a Te Aotawarirangi of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Hono ki Rarotonga and the wharekai Hinematekotai. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Marotiri and Hikurangi, and the awa Mangahauini.
description.mi:
Kei Tokomaru te marae o Pākirikiri. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Ruataupare me Te Whānau a Te Aotāwarirangi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Hono ki Rarotonga. Ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Hinemātikotai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Marotiri me Hikurangi ngā maunga, ko Mangahauini te awa.

description.en:
Te Ariuru marae is located in Tokomaru Bay. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Te Aotawarirangi of the iwi Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Te Aotawarirangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the four waka Horouta, Nukutaimemeha, Takitimu and Tereanini, the awa Waitakeo and the moana Tokomaru.
description.mi:
Kei Tokomaru te marae o Te Ariuru. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Te Aotāwarirangi o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Poho o Te Aotāwarirangi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta me ko Nukutaimemeha ngā waka, ko Waitakeo te awa, ko Tokomaru te moana.

description.en:
Waiparapara marae is located on Pewhairangi Street in Tokomaru Bay. The principal hapū is Te Whānau a Ruataupare ki Tokomaru of the iwi Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Te Tikanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and Matawhaura, the awa Mangahauini and the moana Tokomaru.
description.mi:
Kei te Tiriti o Pēwhairangi i Tokomaru te marae o Waiparapara. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Ruataupare ki Tokomaru o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Poho o Te Tikanga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi me Marotiri ngā maunga, ko Mangahauini te awa.

description.en:
Whareponga marae is located 20 km east of Ruatōria and 45 km north of Tokomaru Bay, on the East Cape. Its primary hapū are Ngāi Tangihaere and Te Aitanga a Mate of Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is named Materoa, the wharekai is Ngā Rongo Toa and the whare karakia is Mikaere. There are two urupā: Ngā Koiwi and Taiporutu. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the awa Whareponga and the maunga Kokai.
description.mi:
Kei te rāwhiti o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea) te marae o Whareponga, 20 kiromita te tawhiti, 45 kiromita ki te raki o Tokomaru. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tangihaere me Te Aitanga a Mate o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Materoa, ko Ngā Rongo Toa te wharekai, ko Mikaere te whare karakia. E rua ngā urupā: ko Ngā Koiwi me Taiporutu. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Whareponga te awa, ko Kōkai te maunga.

description.en:
Hiruhārama marae is located about 8 km southwest of Ruatōria on Waiapu Road. Its principal hapū are Te Aitanga a Mate and Te Aowera of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Kapohanga a Rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Waiapu te marae o Hiruhārama, āhua 8 kiromita whakatetonga-mā-uru o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko ngā hapū matua ko Te Aitanga a Mate me Te Aowera o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Kapohanga a Rangi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Pōtaka marae is located at Pōtaka in Hicks Bay, on Te Araroa Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Tāpaeururangi of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The whare is called Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Maungahiha and the awa Oweka.
description.mi:
Kei Pōtaka, Wharekahika, te marae o Pōtaka. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau o Tāpaeururangi o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te whare ko Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Maungahiha te maunga, ko Oweka te awa.

description.en:
Reporua marae is located in Mahora, Ruatōria. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Rangi of the iwi Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Tū Auau. The wharekai is called Whakamaumahara, and the whare karakia is Anaru. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Pukemaire and the awa Reporua.
description.mi:
Kei Mahora i Ruatōria (Ruatōrea) te marae o Reporua. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Rangi o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Tū Auau. Ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Whakamaumahara, ā, ko te ingoa o te whare karakia ko Anaru. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Pukemaire te maunga, ko Reporua te awa.

description.en:
Rauru marae is located immediately west of Ruatōria township on Bridge Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Hinekehu of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Rauru Nui a Toi. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Piriti te marae o Rauru, kei te uru tata ki te taone o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Hinekehu o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko Rauru Nui a Toi te ingoa o te wharenui. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Te Horo marae is located south of the Waiapu River in Te Horo, Ruatōria. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Horowai, Te Whānau a Mahaki and Te Whānau a Uruhonea of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Rākaitemania. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei Te Horo te marae o Te Horo, kei te tonga o te awa o Waiapu i Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Horowai, ko Te Whānau a Māhaki me Te Whānau a Uruhonea o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rākaitemania. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Waiomatatini marae is located on the banks of the Waiapu River, south of Tikitiki. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Karuai of the iwi Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Porourangi after the eponymous Ngāti Porou ancestor. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te taha o te awa o Waiapu te marae o Waiomatatini, kei te tonga o Tikitiki. Ko te hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Karuwai o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Porourangi. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Hinepare marae is located near the Waiapu and Maraehara rivers. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tāne, Ngāti Hokopū, Ngāti Nua, Te Whānau a Hinepare and Te Whānau a Rerewa of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Tairawhiti. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te taha o ngā awa o Waiapu me Maraehara te marae o Hinepare. Ko ngā hapū matua o tenei marae ko Ngāi Tāne, ko Ngāti Hokopū, ko Ngāti Nua, ko Te Whānau a Hinepare me Te Whānau a Rerewa o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Tairāwhiti. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Mātahi o Te Tau marae is located in Horoera on the East Cape, on Te Araroa-East Cape Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Hunaara of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is also called Mātahi o Te Tau. The wharekai is named Tokararangi War Memorial Hall. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Maungakaka and the awa Ōrutua.
description.mi:
Kei Horoera te marae o Mātahi o Te Tau, i te Huarahi o Te Araroa ki Pito o Te Rāwhiti. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Hunaara o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko Mātahi o Te Tau hoki te ingoa o te wharenui. Ko Tokararangi War Memorial Hall te wharekai Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Maungakaka te maunga, ko Ōrutua te awa.

description.en:
Kākāriki marae is located about 9 km northeast of Ruatōria on Waiomatatini Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Rākaihoea of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Rākaihoea. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Waiomatatini te marae o Kākāriki, e 9 kiromita whakateraki-mā-rāwhiti o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko te hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Rākaihoea o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rākaihoea. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko HIkurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Kariaka marae is located immediately southwest of Ruatōria township on Waiapu Road. Its principal hapū are Ngāi Tangihaere and Te Whānau a Hinekehu of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Matua te marae o Kariaka, kei te taha tonga-mā-uru tata ki te taone o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāi Tangihaere me Te Whānau a Hinekehu o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Penu marae is located about 10 km southwest of Ruatōria on Waiapu Road. Its principal hapū are Te Aitanga a Mate and Te Whanau a Rakairoa of Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Rongo i Te Kai. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka and the maunga Hikurangi.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Waiapu te marae o Penu, āhua 10 kiromita whakatetonga-mā-uru o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea).  Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Aitanga a Mate me Te Whānau a Rākairoa o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rongoitekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa, ko Horouta te waka.

description.en:
Mangahānea Marae is located in Ruatoria about 130 km north of Gisborne city. Its hapū are Ngāti Uepōhatu and Te Whānau a Hinetapora of Ngāti Porou.
The whare tipuna, Hinetapora, was opened in 1896 after more than a decade of building, carving and preparation by Hone Ngātoto, Hone Taahu, Wi Tahata, Wi Haereroa and Hone Te Wehi of Ngāti Uepohatu. The wharekai, Rutu Tawhiorangi was built and opened in the late 1930s.
The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei Ruatōria (Ruatōrea) te marae o Mangahānea, āhua 130 kiromita ki te raki o Tūranganui a Kiwa. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Hinetāpora o Ngāti Uepōhatu, me Ngāti Porou.
I whakatūwheratia te whare tipuna a Hinetāpora i te tau 1896, tekau tau te roa e hangaia ana, i whakairohia ana, i whakaritea ana e Hone Ngātoto rātou ko Hone Taahu, ko Wī Tahata, ko Wi Haereroa, ko Hone Te Wehi o Ngāti Uepōhatu, ka oti. I hangaia, i whakatūwheratia hoki te wharekai, a Rutu Tawhiorangi, i ngā taumuri o 1930.
Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Penu marae is located about 10 km southwest of Ruatōria on Waiapu Road. Its principal hapū are Te Aitanga a Mate and Te Whanau a Rakairoa of Ngāti Porou.
The wharenui is called Rongo i Te Kai. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka and the maunga Hikurangi.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Waiapu te marae o Penu, āhua 10 kiromita whakatetonga-mā-uru o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea).  Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Aitanga a Mate me Te Whānau a Rākairoa o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rongoitekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa, ko Horouta te waka.

description.en:
Maungaroa marae is located in Maungaroa, about 4 km east of Te Kaha on State Highway 35. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Kaiaio of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Kaiaio. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Maungaroa and Whanokao, and the awa Kereu and Mouriuri.
description.mi:
Kei Maungaroa te marae o Maungaroa, āhua 4 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Te Kaha. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Kaiāio o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Kaiāio. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Maungaroa me Whanokao ngā maunga, ko Kereu me Mōuriuri ngā awa.

description.en:
Whangaparāōa marae is located at Cape Runaway. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Kauaetangohia of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.

	The whare are called Kauaetangohia and Te Putahou. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tihirau and the awa Whangaparāōa.
description.mi:
Kei Tihirau (Tikirau) te marae o Whangaparāōa. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Kauaetangohia o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o ngā whare ko Kauaetangohia me Te Putahou. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Tihirau te maunga, ko Whangaparāoa te awa.

description.en:
Whitianga marae is located in Whitianga Bay, about 19 km south of Te Kaha. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Tutawake of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Tutawake. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Oariki, the moana Whitianga, and four awa: Motu, Okawhiti, Waihapokopoko and Waipapa.
description.mi:
Kei te ākau o Whitianga te marae o Whitianga, āhua 19 kiromita ki te tonga o Te Kaha. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Tūtawake o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Tūtawake. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Oariki te maunga, ko Whitianga te moana, ko Motu, ko Okawhiti, ko Waipokopoko, ko Waipapa ngā awa.

description.en:
Te Maru o Hinemakahō marae is located in Raukokore, near the East Cape. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Pararaki of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Pararaki. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tawhitinui and the awa Tauranga.
description.mi:
Kei Raukokore te marae o Te Maru o Hinemakahō. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Pararaki o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Pararaki.  Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Tawhitinui te maunga, ko Tauranga te awa.

description.en:
Ōtūwhare marae is located in Ōtūwhare, about 12 km southwest of Te Kaha. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Rutaia of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Poho o Rutaia. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Rangipoua, the awa Haparapara and Paerata, and the moana Omāio.
description.mi:
Kei Ōtūwhare te marae o Ōtūwhare, āhua 12 kiromita ki te tonga-mā-uru o Te Kaha.  Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Rutaia o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Poho o Rutaia. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Rangipoua te maunga, ko Hāparapara me Paerata ngā awa, ko Omāio te moana.

description.en:
Pāhāōa marae is located in Pāhāōa, about 7 km west of Te Kaha on State Highway 35. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Kahurautao of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Kahurautao and the wharekai is Kiritapu. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Tauira waka, the maunga Whanokao and the awa Kereu and Mangatakauare.
description.mi:
Kei Pāhāōa te marae o Pāhāōa, āhua 7 kiromita ki te uru o Te Kaha. Ko te hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Kahurautao o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Kahurautao, ā, ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Kiritapu. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua me Tauira ngā waka, ko Whanokao te maunga, ko Kereu me Mangatakauare ngā awa.

description.en:
Pōtaka marae is located at Pōtaka in Hicks Bay, on Te Araroa Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Tāpaeururangi of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The whare is called Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Maungahiha and the awa Oweka.
description.mi:
Kei Pōtaka, Wharekahika, te marae o Pōtaka. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau o Tāpaeururangi o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te whare ko Te Pae o Ngā Pakanga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Maungahiha te maunga, ko Oweka te awa.

description.en:
Waiōrore marae is located in Waiōrore, about 4 km south of Te Kaha. Its principal hapū are Hinetekahu and Te Whānau a Toihau of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The wharenui is called Toihau. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Moaha and the awa Haparapara, Maraetea and Waiōrore.
description.mi:
Kei Waiōrore te marae o Waiōrore, āhua 4 kiromita ki te tonga o Te Kaha. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Hinetekahu me Te Whānau a Toihau o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Toihau. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Moaha te maunga, ko Hāparapara, ko Maraetea me Waiōrore ngā awa.

description.en:
Wairūrū marae is located on State Highway 35 in Waihau Bay. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Maruhaeremuri of Te Whānau a Apanui iwi.
The whare are called Hinemahuru and Mihi Kotukutuku, and the wharekai is Maruhaeremuri. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Kirieke and the awa Raukokore, Waiongatiawa and Wairūrū.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Matua 35 i Waihau te marae o Wairūrū.  Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Whānau a Maruhaeremuri o te iwi o Te Whānau a Apanui.
Ko te ingoa o ngā whare ko Hinemahuru me Mihi Kōtukutuku. Ko te ingoa o te wharekai ko Maruhaeremuri. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Kirieke te maunga, ko Raukōkore, ko Waiongatiawa me Wairūrū ngā awa.

description.en:
Kutarere marae is located in Kutarere, about 18 km west of Ōpōtiki. Its principal hapū is Te Ūpokorehe of Whakatōhea iwi.

	The wharenui is called Te Poho o Tamaterangi and the wharekai is Ani-i-waho. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Nukutere waka, the maunga Tirotirowhitu and the awa Kutarere.
description.mi:
Kei Kutarere te marae o Kutarere, āhua 18 kiromita ki te uru o Ōpōtiki. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Te Ūpokorehe o te iwi o Whakatōhea.
Ko Te Poho o Tamaterangi te wharenui, ko Ani-i-waho te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Mātaatua me Nukutere ngā waka, ko Tirotirowhetu te maunga, ko Kutarere te awa.

description.en:
Roimata marae is located on the shores of Ohiwa Harbour, and is the westernmost marae in the rohe of Whakatōhea. The primary hapu is Te Ūpokorehe.
The whare tipuna is called Te Ao Marama and the whare kai is Te Umutao Noa a Tairongo. Roimata marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Hiwarau, the awa Te Karaka and the moana Tairongo.
description.mi:
Roimata marae is located on the shores of the Ohiwa harbour, and is the western most marae in the rohe of Whakatōhea. The primary hapu is Te Ūpokorehe.

	 

	The whare tipuna is called Te Ao Marama and the whare kai is Te umutao Noa a Tairongo. Roimata marae ancestrally connects to the maunga Hiwarau, the awa Te Karaka and the moana Tairongo.

description.en:
Terere marae is located just south of Ōpōtiki. The primary hapu is Ngāti Ngāhere of Whakatōhea.
The wharenui is called Te Iringa and the wharekai Whiripare. Te Rere marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Nukutere waka, the maunga Maungarangi and the awa Otara and Waioeka.
description.mi:
Te Rere marae is located just south of Ōpōtiki. The primary hapu is Ngāti Ngāhere of Whakatōhea.

	 

	The wharenui is called Te Iringa and the wharekai Whiripare. Te Rere marae ancestrally connects to the maunga Maungarangi and the Otara & Waioeka Rivers.

description.en:
Ōmarumutu is located on the eastern boundaries of Whakatōhea at Ōmarumutu. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Ruatākena (also known as  Ngāti Rua) of Whakatōhea iwi.
The wharenui is called Tūtāmure and the wharekai is Hine-i-Kauia. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Nukutere waka, the maunga Mākeo and the awa Waiaua. It is home to one of Whakatōhea's prominent tipuna, Tutāmure.
description.mi:
Kei Ōmarumutu te marae o Ōmarumutu i te rawhiti o te rohe o Whakatōhea. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Ruatākena o te iwi o Whakatōhea.
Ko Tūtāmure te wharenui, ko Hine-i-kauia te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Mātaatua me Nukutere ngā waka, ko Mākeo te maunga, ko Waiaua te awa. Ko te kāinga tēnei o Tūtāmure, tipuna nui o Whakatōhea.

description.en:
Ōpeke marae is located south of Ōpōtiki at the entrance to the Waioeka Gorge. It belongs to the hapū Ngāti Īrapuaia (also known as Ngāti Ira) of Whakatōhea iwi.
The whare tipuna is Irapuaia, and the wharekai is Te Kurapare. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua waka, the maunga Mātiti and Ruahema, and the awa Waioweka. Ōpeke is also known as Ōpekerau, Waioeka or Waioweka.
description.mi:

description.en:
Opape marae is located on the eastern boundary of Whakatōhea at Opape, about 15 km east of Ōpōtiki. The primary hapu is Ngāi Tamahaua (Ngāi Tama) of Whakatōhea iwi.
The wharenui is called Muriwai and the wharekai is Tapairu. Opape marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Nukutere waka, the maunga Tarakeha and the awa Opepe.
description.mi:
Kei Opape te marae o Opape ki te rāwhiti o te rohe o Whakatōhea, āhua 15 kiromita ki te rāwhiti o Ōpōtiki. Ko tōna hapū matua ko Ngāi Tamahaua (Ngāi Tama) o te iwi o Whakatōhea.
Ko Muriwai te wharenui, ko Tapairu te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Mātaatua me Nukutere ngā waka, ko Tarakeha te maunga, ko Opepe te awa.

description.en:
Originally located at Paerata, Ngāti Patumoana and Waiaua marae were relocated to the base of the Pakihi valley after the Whakatōhea land confiscations. The hapū derives its name from an event where their ancestor, Hineiahua was pursued and killed by a Ngāpuhi war party at the mouth of the Waiotahe River mouth - hence the name Ngāti Patumoana.
The wharenui is called Ruamoko and was opened in 1899; the wharekai is Te Puritanga. The marae connects ancestrally to Mātaatua and Nukutere waka, the maunga Mākeo and the awa Waiaua.
description.mi:
I tū ngā marae o Ngāti Patumoana me Waiaua i Paerata, heoi nō muri mai i te raupatu whenua o Te Whakatōhea ka neke ki te pūtake o te riu o Pakihi. I takea mai te ingoa o te hapū i tētahi āhuatanga i pā ki tō rātou tipuna, ki a Hineiahua, arā, i whāia, i patua hoki e te ope taua o Ngāpuhi i te ngutu awa o Waiotahe, nā reira i toko ake ai te ingoa o Ngāti Patumoana.
Ko Ruaumoko te wharenui, i whakatūwheratia i te tau 1899; ko Te Puritanga te wharekai. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Mātaatua me Nukuterengā waka, ko Mākeo te maunga, ko Waiaua te awa.

description.en:

The whare tipuna is named Te Huinga ō te kura, built in 1925. Matahī connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Maungapōhatu and the awa Waimana.

The wharenui is called Te Ohaki; it was built in 1934. There is currently no wharekai. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua.

	The wharenui is also called Moewhare and it was built in 1929. Moewhare marae ancestrally connects to the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki.

description.en:
Murumurunga marae is located on the edge of Te Urewera, 20 km outside Murupara. The primary hapū are Ngāti Hamua ki Te Whaiti, Ngāti Kohiwi, Ngāti Mahanga, Ngāti Te Au, Ngāti Te Karaha, Ngāti Tuahiwi, Ngāti Whare ki Ngā Potiki and Warahoe ki Te Whaiti of Ngāti Whare.
The whare tipuna is named Wharepakau-tao-tao-ki-te-Kapua. Murumurunga connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tuwatawata and the awa Whirinaki.
description.mi:

The whare tipuna is named Wharepakau-tao-tao-ki-te-Kapua. Murumurunga connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tuwatawata and the awa Whirinaki.

description.en:
Rangitahi marae is located in Murupara. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hui of Ngāti Manawa.
The wharenui is called Apa-Hapai-Taketake and the wharekai is Kuranui. Rangitahi marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki.
description.mi:
Rangitahi marae is located in Murupara. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hui of Ngāti Manawa.
The wharenui is called Apa-Hapai-Taketake and the wharekai is Kuranui. Rangitahi marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki.

description.en:
Tīpapa marae is located in Murupara. The primary hapu is Ngāi Tokowaru of Ngāti Manawa.
The wharenui is Tangiharuru and the wharekai is Takuate. Rangatahi marae connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki.
description.mi:

The wharenui is Tangiharuru and the wharekai is Takuate. Rangatahi marae connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki.

description.en:
Waikotikoti marae is located on the edge of Te Urewera, 20 km outside Murupara. The primary hapū are Ngāti Hamua ki Te Whaiti, Ngāti Te Karaha and Warahoe ki Te Whaiti of Ngāti Whare.
The whare tipuna is named Hinenuitepo. Waikotikoti connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tuwatawata and the awa Whirinaki.
description.mi:

The whare tipuna is named Hinenuitepo. Waikotikoti connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Tuwatawata and the awa Whirinaki.

description.en:
Kokohinau (Tuhimata) marae is located north of Te Teko on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu is Te Pahipoto of Ngāti Awa.
The whare is called O Ruatapare or Oruatapere and the wharekai is Waipunarangi. The marae connects ancetrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.
 
Ngati Pahipoto has been described as "Te iwi tirare kai pahao kai nei' or 'The tribe that collects food and gathers it by the net full'.
description.mi:
Kokohinau (Tuhimata) marae is located north of Te Teko on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu is Te Pahipoto of Ngāti Awa.

	 

	The whare is called O’Ruatapare or Oruatapere and the wharekai is named Waipunarangi. The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki. Ngati Pahipoto has been described as "Te Iwi tirare kai pahao kai nei" or "The tribe that collects food and gathers it by the netfull".

description.en:
Uiraroa marae is located in Te Teko, on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tamawera, Ngāti Nuku and Ngāti Ahi of Ngāti Awa.
The whare tipuna is also called Uiraroa, the wharekai is named Tauwhitu and the urupa is Taikaawa. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.
Uiraroa marae rests on the ancestral papakainga Hekerangi. Uiraroa is considered to be one of the oldest marae in the Whakatāne region: the original whare tipuna was built in 1800.
description.mi:
Uiraroa marae is located in Te Teko on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu is Ngāi Tamawera of Ngāti Awa. The whare tipuna is also called Uiraroa , the wharekai is named Tauwhitu and the urupa is Taikaawa.

	 

	The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki. Uiraroa marae rests on the ancestral papakainga Hekerangi. The original whare tipuna was built in 1800 and Uiraroa is considered to be one of the oldest marae in the Whakatāne region.

description.en:
Kaiwaka marae is located in Poroporo Valley, outside of Tikitiki settlement. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Putaanga and Te Whānau a Hinerupe of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Te Kapenga. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Poroporo and Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te riu o Poroporo te marae o Kaiwaka, i waho o Tikitiki. Ko ngā hapū matua ko Ngāti Putaanga me Te Whānau a Hinerupe o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Te Kapenga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Poroporo me Waiapu ngā awa.

description.en:
Puawairua marae is located just north of Whakatāne. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hikakino of Ngāti Awa.
The whare tipuna is also called Puawairua and the whare kai is Te Rerehu. Puawairua marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua and the awa Te Awa o te Atua and Whakatāne.

Ruaihona marae is located in Te Teko, on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tamaoki and Ngāti Tarāwhai. Ruaihona marae rests close to Ōtipa Pā. The site was occupied at different times by the hapū Ngā Maihi and Warahoe as well.

	The whare tipuna is also called Ruaihona and the wharekai is Mahanga-i-te-rangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.

	Ruaihona marae rests on the ancestral papakainga Hekerangi with two other marae, Tuteao and Uiraroa. The original whare tipuna was opened on 1 Juoy 1910, and all the carvings were completed by the famed Ngāti Tarāwhai master carver Eramiha Neke Kapua.
description.mi:
Ruaihona marae is located in Te Teko on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tamaoki and Ngāti Tarāwhai. The whare tipuna is also called Ruaihona and the wharekai is named Mahanga-i-te-rangi. The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.

	 

	Ruaihona marae rests on the ancestral papakainga Hekerangi with two other marae, Tuteao and Uiraroa. The original whare tipuna was built between 1908 - 1910, and all the carvings were completed by the famed Ngāti Tarāwhai master carver Eramiha Neke Kapua. The original whare was opened on July 1st, 1910. The current whare, opened on March 6th, 1993 was built and carved by Ahirau Kaka Niao Ngaheu.

description.en:
Taiwhakaea (Te Paroa) marae is located north of Whakatāne, close to the Oriini Stream. The primary hapu is Ngāi Taiwhakaea II of Ngāti Awa.

	The whare tipuna is called Taiwhakaea II and the wharekai Toanatini. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Kaputerangi and Pūtauaki, and the awa Ōhinemataroa and Oriini.
description.mi:
Taiwhakaea (Te Paroa) marae is located north of Whakatāne, close to the Oriini Stream. The primary hapu is Ngāi Taiwhakaea II of Ngāti Awa.

	 

	The whare is called Taiwhakaea II and the wharekai Toanatini. The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki me Kaputerangi and the awa Ohinemataroa me Oriini.

description.en:
Te Māpou marae is located in Te Teko, on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hāmua of Ngāti Awa.
The whare tipuna is called Rongotangiawa and the wharekai is named Te Kiriwera. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.
description.mi:
Te Māpou marae is located in Te Teko on the banks of the Rangitaiki River. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hāmua of Ngāti Awa. The whare tipuna is called Rongotangiawa and the wharekai is named Te Kiriwera. 

	 

	The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Rangitaiki.Ruaihona marae rests close to Ōtipa Pā. The site was occupied at different times by the hapū Ngā Maihi and Warahoe as well.

description.en:
Te Rangihouhiri II marae is located just north of Whakatāne. The primary hapu is Ngāi Te Rangihouhiri II of Ngāti Awa.
The whare tipuna is also called Te Rangihouhiri II. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Pūtauaki and the awa Te Awa a Te Atua.
description.mi:
Te Rangihouhiri II marae is located just north of Whakatāne. The primary hapu is Ngāi Te Rangihouhiri II of Ngāti Awa.

	 

	The whare is also called Te Rangihouhiri II. The marae ancestrally connects to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Putauaki and the awa Te Awa a Te Atua.

description.en:
Ōniao marae is located in Matatā, 24 km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapū that affiliate to this marae are Ngāi Tamarangi, Ngāti Manuwhare and Ngāti Umutahi of Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Kawerau.
The whare is named Tūwharetoa. Ōniao marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and the awa Te Awa o Te Atua.
description.mi:
Ōniao marae is located in Matatā, 24 km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapū that affiliate to this marae are Ngāi Tamarangi, Ngāti Manuwhare and Ngāti Umutahi of Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Kawerau.

description.en:
Ngāti Umutahi marae is located 3km inland from Matatā. The hapū that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Iramoko, Te Tāwera and Ngāti Umutahi (Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Pūtauaki) of Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Kawerau.
The whare is named Umutahi and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Pūtauaki and the awa Tarawera.
description.mi:
Ngāti Umutahi marae is located 3km inland from Matatā. The hapū that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Iramoko, Te Tāwera and Ngāti Umutahi (Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Pūtauaki) of Ngāti Tūwharetoa ki Kawerau.
The whare is named Umutahi and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Pūtauaki and the awa Tarawera.

description.en:
Rangitihi marae is located in Matatā, 24km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapu that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Mahi, Ngāti Rangitihi and Ngāti Tionga of the iwi Ngāti Rangitihi.
The whare is named Rangiaohia. Rangitihi connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and Te Awa o Te Atua.
description.mi:
Rangitihi marae is located in Matatā, 24km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapu that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Mahi, Ngāti Rangitihi and Ngāti Tionga of the iwi Ngāti Rangitihi.
The whare is named Rangiaohia. Rangitihi connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and Te Awa o Te Atua.

description.en:
Pukehina marae is located 20 km south east of Te Puke on State Highway 2. The principal hapū that affiliates to this marae is Ngāti Whakahemo of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare is named Tawakemoetahanga. Pukehina marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Matawhaura and the awa Waitahanui.

Waiatuhi marae is located in Mourea on the eastern shores of Lake Rotorua. The primary hapū are Ngāti Kahumatamomoe, Ngāti Paruaharanui and Ngāti Te Takinga of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is called Kahumatamomoe. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Matawhaura and the awa Ohau.

Te Takinga marae is located in Mourea on the eastern shores of Lake Rotorua. The primary hapū is Ngāti Te Takinga of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is called Te Takinga. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Matawhaura and the awa Ohau.

Pounamunui (Houmaitawhiti) marae is located at Okere Falls, just east of Rotora. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāti Hinekura of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tupuna is Houmaitawhiti, named after the father of Tamatekapua (the captain of Te Arawa waka). The whare kai is named after one of his wives, Hinekukutirangi. 
This whare tupuna was built at Maketū before being brought to its current site at Ōtaramarae Bay.

Rangitihi marae is located in Matatā, 24km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapu that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Mahi, Ngāti Rangitihi and Ngāti Tionga of the iwi Ngāti Rangitihi.
The whare is named Rangiaohia. Rangitihi connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and Te Awa o Te Atua.

Rangitihi marae is located in Matatā, 24km northeast of Whakatane. The principal hapu that affiliate to this marae are Ngāti Mahi, Ngāti Rangitihi and Ngāti Tionga of the iwi Ngāti Rangitihi.
The whare is named Rangiaohia. Rangitihi connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and Te Awa o Te Atua.

description.en:
Tokerau marae is on the northern shores of Lake Rotoiti east of Lake Rotorua. The primary hapū is Ngāti Pikiao of the iwi Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is named Pikiao. Tokerau marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

wikipedia.en: Lake Rotoma is the fourth largest lake of the 11 lakes in the Rotorua Lakes district, or the Hot Lakes district as it was known in the early decades of the 20th century. The Rotorua lakes are located in New Zealand's North Island in the Bay of Plenty Region. Lake Rotoma is the easternmost in the chain of three lakes to the northeast of Lake Rotorua The other two are Lake Rotoiti and Lake Rotoehu. Rotoma is located halfway between the city of Rotorua and town of Whakatane.

description.en:
Tapuaekura a Hatupatu marae is on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti east of Lake Rotorua. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rongomai of the iwi Ngāti Rongomai.
The whare tipuna is named Rakeiao. Tapuaekura a Hatupatu marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

Ruato marae is also known as Ngā Pūmanawa, and is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti east of Lake Rotorua just at the turn off to Lake Okataina. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rongomai of the iwi Ngāti Rongomaio.
The whare tipuna is named Ngā Pūmanawa e Waru. Ruato (Ngā Pūmanawa) marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.
description.mi:
Ruato marae is also known as Ngā Pūmanawa, and is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti east of Lake Rotorua just at the turn off to Lake Okataina. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rongomai of the iwi Ngāti Rongomaio.

	 

	The whare tipuna is named Ngā Pūmanawa e Waru. Ruato (Ngā Pūmanawa) marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

description.en:
Waikōhatu marae is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Ruato Bay, just at the turn off to Lake Okataina. The primary hapū is Ngāti Tarāwhai of the iwi Ngāti Tarāwhai.
The whare tipuna is named Tarāwhai and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.
description.mi:
Waikōhatu marae is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Ruato Bay, just at the turn off to Lake Okataina. The primary hapū is Ngāti Tarāwhai of the iwi Ngāti Tarāwhai.
The whare tipuna is named Tarāwhai and the marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

description.en:
Taurua marae is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Taurua. The primary hapū is Ngāti Te Rangiunuora of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is named Te Rangiunuora, and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

Te Waiiti marae is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Tawhakarere Bay. The primary hapū is Ngāti Hinekura of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is named Hinekura, and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the awa Te Waiiti and the maunga Matawhaura.

Tapuaeharuru marae is located on the eastern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Tapuaeharuru Bay. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Kawiti and Ngāti Tamateatutahi of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is named Uruika, and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

Punawhakareia marae is located on the southern shores of Lake Rotoiti at Punawhakareia Bay. The primary hapū is Ngāti Te Rangiunuora of Ngāti Pikiao.
The whare tipuna is named Uenuku mai Rarotonga, and the marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the maunga Matawhaura.

wikipedia.en: Lake Okataina is the northernmost and largest of four smaller lakes lying between Lake Rotorua and Lake Tarawera in the Bay of Plenty region of New Zealand's North Island. The others are Lake Rotokakahi, Lake Tikitapu, and Lake Okareka. All lie within the Okataina caldera, along its western edge.

description.en:
Ruamatā marae is located just outside Rotorua, at Tikitere. The primary hapu is Ngati Te Kanawa of Ngāti Uenukukopako.
The whare tipuna is called Uenukukōpako. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe.
description.mi:
Ruamatā marae is located just outside Rotorua, at Tikitere. The primary hapu is Ngati Te Kanawa of Ngāti Uenukukopako.
The whare tipuna is called Uenukukōpako. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka and Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe.

description.en:
Pikirangi marae is located just outside Rotorua, at Tikitere. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hauora of Ngāti Uenukukopako.
The whare tipuna is called Ohomairangi. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe.
description.mi:
Pikirangi marae is located just outside Rotorua, at Tikitere. The primary hapu is Ngāti Hauora of Ngāti Uenukukopako.
The whare tipuna is called Ohomairangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka and the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe.

description.en:
Mataarae marae is located just 2 km west of Reporoa. The primary hapū is Ngāti Mataarae of Ngāti Tahu / Ngāti Whaoa.
The whare tipuna is named Mataarae and the marae ancestrally connects to the waka Te-Manu nui arangi, the maunga Paeroa and the wai Mangahoanga.

Rongomaipapa marae is located at Horohoro, just outside Rotorua. The primary hapu are Ngāti Kea and Ngāti Tuarā.
The whare tipuna is called Maruahangaroa. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the awa Pokaitu and the maunga Te Horohoroinga o nga ringa o Kahumatamomoe, or Horohoro as it is known colloquially. Rongomaipapa marae affiliates to both Tuhourangi and Ngāti Kahungunu.

Kearoa marae is located at Horohoro just outside Rotorua. The primary hapū is Ngāti Kea Ngāti Tuarā.
The whare is also called Kearoa. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the awa Pokaitu and the maunga Te Horohoroinga o nga ringa o Kahumatamomoe, or Horohoro as it is known colloquially.
description.mi:
Kearoa marae is located at Horohoro just outside Rotorua. The primary hapu is Ngāti Kea Ngāti Tuarā.
The whare is also called Kearoa. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the awa Pokaitu and the maunga Te Horohoroinga o nga ringa o Kahumatamomoe, or Horohoro as it is known colloquially.

description.en:
Te Pākira marae is located in Whakarewarewa, Rotorua. The two primary iwi of this marae are Ngāti Wahiao and Tūhourangi, the latter comprised of the hapu Ngāti Puta, Ngāti Taoi and Ngāti Uruhina. Te Pākira is located in the geothermal village of Whakarewarewa.
Tūhourangi came to live beside their Ngāti Wahiao relations after the 1886 Tarawera eruption, which destroyed their Tarawera homes and killed over 150 of their people. They also resettled at nearby Ngapuna (Apumoana/Moerangi Marae) and down at Waitangi near Te Puke (Tuhourangi marae).
description.mi:
Te Pākira marae is located in Whakarewarewa, Rotorua. The two primary iwi of this marae are Ngāti Wahiao and Tūhourangi, the latter comprised of the hapu Ngāti Puta, Ngāti Taoi and Ngāti Uruhina. Te Pākira is located in the geothermal village of Whakarewarewa.
Tūhourangi came to live beside their Ngāti Wahiao relations after the 1886 Tarawera eruption, which destroyed their Tarawera homes and killed over 150 of their people. They also resettled at nearby Ngapuna (Apumoana/Moerangi Marae) and down at Waitangi near Te Puke (Tuhourangi marae).

description.en:
Hinemihi marae (also known as Te Paparere-a-Rātōrua) is located in Ngapuna, at the southern end of Lake Rotorua. It's primary hapū is Ngāti Hinemihi of the iwi Ngāti Tarawhai, with connections also to Tuhourangi.
The wharenui is also named Hinemihi, the wharekai is name Hinewai and the gateway is named Te Marumaru o Tuhoto. Hinemihi ancestrally connects to Te Arawa waka.

Mātaatua marae is located 4.5 km from Ruatāhuna in Te Urewera. The primary hapū is Te Urewera of Ngāi Tūhoe.
The whare tipuna is named Te Whaia-Te-Motu. Mātaatua marae connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka, the maunga Maungapōhatu and the moana Waikaremoana.
description.mi:
Kei Te Urewera te marae o Mātaatua, 4.5 kiromita te tawhiti i Ruatāhuna. Ko te hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Te Urewera o Ngāi Tūhoe.
Ko te ingoa o te whare tipuna ko Te Whai-a-Te Motu. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ko Mātaatua te waka, ko Maungapōhatu te maunga, ko Waikaremoana te moana.

description.en:
Moerangi (Apumoana) marae is located in Rotorua. It's primary hapu are Ngāti Kahu (Kahu-poko) of Ngāti Whakaue, and Ngāti Tumatawera and Ngāti Wahiao of Tuhourangi.
The main wharenui is called Apumoana o te Ao Kohatu. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the maunga Tarawera.
description.mi:
Moerangi (Apumoana) marae is located in Rotorua. It's primary hapu are Ngāti Kahu (Kahu-poko) of Ngāti Whakaue, and Ngāti Tumatawera and Ngāti Wahiao of Tuhourangi.
The main wharenui is called Apumoana o te Ao Kohatu. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the maunga Tarawera.

description.en:
Hinemihi marae (also known as Te Paparere-a-Rātōrua) is located in Ngapuna, at the southern end of Lake Rotorua. It's primary hapū is Ngāti Hinemihi of the iwi Ngāti Tarawhai, with connections also to Tuhourangi.
The wharenui is also named Hinemihi, the wharekai is name Hinewai and the gateway is named Te Marumaru o Tuhoto. Hinemihi ancestrally connects to Te Arawa waka.

Hurungaterangi marae is located in Ngāpuna, Rotorua. The primary hapu are Ngāti Hurungaterangi, Ngāti Taeotu and Ngāti Kahu of Ngāti Whakaue.
The whare tipuna is also called Hurunga o te Rangi and the wharekai is Whaingarangi. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka.
description.mi:
Hurungaterangi marae is located in Ngāpuna, Rotorua. The primary hapu are Ngāti Hurungaterangi, Ngāti Taeotu and Ngāti Kahu of Ngāti Whakaue.


		The whare tipuna is also called Hurunga o te Rangi and the wharekai is Whaingarangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka.

description.en:
Koutu (Karenga) marae is located in Koutu, Rotorua. The primary hapu is Ngāti Karenga of Te Ure o Uenukukōpako.
The whare tipuna is called Tumahaurangi. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka and the awa Utuhina.
description.mi:
Koutu (Karenga) marae is located in Koutu, Rotorua. The primary hapu is Ngāti Karenga of Te Ure o Uenukukōpako.
The whare tipuna is called Tumahaurangi. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka and the awa Utuhina.

description.en:
Tārukenga marae is just outside Rotorua. Its primary hapu are Ngāti Te Ngākau and Ngāti Tura.
The wharenui is called Te Ngākau. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the awa and maunga Ngongotaha.
description.mi:
Tārukenga marae is just outside Rotorua. Its primary hapu are Ngāti Te Ngākau and Ngāti Tura.

	The wharenui is called Te Ngākau. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the awa and maunga Ngongotaha.

description.en:
Tarimano marae is located just outside Rotorua, in Ngongotahā. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rangiwewehi ki Uta. 
The whare tupuna is called Tawakeheimoa. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe, the awa Te Awahou and the maunga Tiheia.
description.mi:
Tarimano marae is located just outside Rotorua, in Ngongotaha. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rangiwewehi ki Uta. 

	 

	The whare tupuna is called Tawakeheimoa and the marae ancestrally connects to the Arawa waka, Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe, the awa Te Awahou and the maunga Tiheia.

description.en:
Waiteti marae is located just outside Rotorua, in Ngongotahā. The primary hapū is Ngāraranui. 
The whare tipuna is called Ngararanui. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the maunga Ngongotahā.
description.mi:
Waiteti marae is located just outside Rotorua, in Ngongotahā. The primary hapū is Ngāraranui. 

	The whare tipuna is called Ngararanui. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe and the maunga Ngongotahā.

Tarimano marae is located just outside Rotorua, in Ngongotahā. The primary hapū is Ngāti Rangiwewehi ki Uta. 
The whare tupuna is called Tawakeheimoa. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the roto Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe, the awa Te Awahou and the maunga Tiheia.

	The whare tupuna is called Tawakeheimoa and the marae ancestrally connects to the Arawa waka, Te Rotorua-nui-a-Kahumatamomoe, the awa Te Awahou and the maunga Tiheia.

description.en:
Maketū Pa is located on the low hill-top immediately overlooking Maketū village. The last surviving wharenui on Maketū Pa is named Te Awhe o Te Rangi (Te Awhe). Te Awhe was opened in 1904, replacing the original meeting house built by Mita Te Rangituakoha in 1872. Maketu pā formerly hosted other wharenui named Houmaitawhiti, Kawatapuarangi and Uenuku-Mai-Rarotonga. The wharekai is named Te Rokiroki Whaka-o-ti-rangi.

Te Awhe belongs to the hapū Ngāti Mākino, Ngāti Whakahemo and Te Patuwai of Ngāti Pikiao. Te Awhe connects ancestrally to the maunga Matawhaura, the moana of Maketu, the awa Kaituna
description.mi:
Maketū Pa is located on the low hill-top immediately overlooking Maketū village. The last surviving wharenui on Maketū Pa is named Te Awhe o Te Rangi (Te Awhe). Te Awhe was opened in 1904, replacing the original meeting house built by Mita Te Rangituakoha in 1872. Maketu pā formerly hosted other wharenui named Houmaitawhiti, Kawatapuarangi and Uenuku-Mai-Rarotonga. The wharekai is named Te Rokiroki Whaka-o-ti-rangi.

Te Awhe belongs to the hapū Ngāti Mākino, Ngāti Whakahemo and Te Patuwai of Ngāti Pikiao. Te Awhe connects ancestrally to the maunga Matawhaura, the moana of Maketu, the awa Kaituna

description.en:
Hei marae is located in Te Puke. The marae belongs to Waitaha of the Te Arawa confederation.
The whare tipuna is named Hei. The name Manoeka (1000 acres) alludes to the history of land confiscations and raupatu, and the subsequent granting to Waitaha of 1000 acres at Motungarara (now known as Manoeka). Hei marae is Waitaha's only marae.

Moko marae is located 3 km east of Te Puke on State Highway 2. The primary hapū is Ngāti Moko of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Te Arawa confederation.
 
The whare tipuna is named Mokotangatakotahi and the wharekai is Te Rauwharangi. The marae connects ancestrally to Te Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and the awa Kaituna.
description.mi:
Moko  marae is located 3km to the east of Te Puke on State Highway 2. The primary hapū is Ngāti Moko of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Te Arawa confederation.
 
The whare tipuna is named Mokotangatakotahi and the wharekai iss Te Rauwharangi. The marae connectss ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and the awa Kaituna.

description.en:
Te Paamu marae is located 5 km southeast of Te Puke just beyond the village of Waitangi on the Kaituna River. The primary hapū is Ngāti Marukukere of Tapuika, which affiliates to Te Arawa confederation.
The whare tipuna is named Tia after one of the twin elders, the other being Hei, who voyaged from Taputapuatea to Maketu on the Arawa waka.
description.mi:
Te Paamu marae is located 5 km southeast of Te Puke just beyond the village of Waitangi on the Kaituna River. The primary hapū is Ngāti Marukukere of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Arawa confederation.
The whare tipuna is named Tia after one of the twin elders, the other being Hei, who voyaged from Taputapuatea to Maketu on the Arawa waka.

description.en:
Te Matai marae is located 6 km southeast of Te Puke. The primary hapū is Ngāti Kurī of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Te Arawa confederation.
 
The whare tipuna is named Tapuika and the wharekai is Matahoe. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and the awa Kaituna.
description.mi:
Te Matai marae is located 6km southeast of Te Puke. The primary hapū is Ngāti Kurī of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Te Arawa confederation.
 
The whare tipuna is named Tapuika and the wharekai is Matahoe. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Tarawera and the awa Kaituna.

description.en:
Makahae marae is located just outside Te Puke and is also known by the name of Te Kahika. The primary hapū is Ngāti Tuheke of Tapuika, which affiliates to the Te Arawa confederation.
 
The whare tipuna is also named Makahae. The marae connects ancestrally to the Arawa waka, the maunga Rangiuru and the awa Kaituna.

locale.en: Te Hiinga o te Rā meeting house
locale.mi: Te Hiinga o te Rā whare rūnanga

mi.ascii: Te Hiinga o te Ra whare runanga
mi.double: Te Hiinga o te Raa whare ruunanga

description.en:
Te Hihitaua marae is located at the northern end of Mōtītī Island.
The whare tipuna is called Te Hinga o Te Ra after the son of Ruaihona and grandson of Toroa. Te Hihitaua marae connects ancestrally to the Mātaatua waka and to Te Hapu, the eponymous ancestor of the hapū of Te Patuwai and Ngāti Maumoana and the ancient hapū Ngāi Te Hapu, Ngāti Takahanga, Ngāti Kauwaewera, Ngāti Pau, Ngāti Ruaroa, Ngāti Te Ahoaho and Ngāti Te Urumahora.
Near the marae stands the whare karakia named Taumata Ataahua, which was built in 1885 on the land named Karioi.

Te Rereatukahia marae is located in Katikati, north of Tauranga, and its principal hapu is Ngāi Tamawhariua. 
The marae consists of the wharenui Tamawhariua, and Te Rereatukahia is of the Ngāi Te Rangi tribal collective. The two pou and tekoteko of the wharenui were carved from slabs of totara donated by Doug Baker to the marae over 20 years ago, and were completed in late 2010.
description.mi:
Te Rereatukahia marae is located in Katikati, north of Tauranga, and its principal hapu is Ngāi Tamawhariua. 
The marae consists of the wharenui Tamawhariua, and Te Rereatukahia is of the Ngāi Te Rangi tribal collective. The two pou and tekoteko of the wharenui were carved from slabs of totara donated by Doug Baker to the marae over 20 years ago, and were completed in late 2010.

description.en:
Opopoti (Maungatapu) marae is located in Maungatapu, Tauranga. Its principal hapu is Ngāti He. 
The marae consists of the wharenui, Wairakewa, the wharekai, Te Ao Takawhaaki, and is part of the Ngāi Te Rangi tribal collective. The Kohanga Reo for Opopoti sits adjacent to the marae, and both complexes are located on the beachfront.

Whareroa marae is located just across the harbour from Tauranga in Mount Maunganui. The primary hapu for the marae are Ngāi Tukairangi and Ngāti Kuku of Ngāi Te Rangi.
The whare tipuna is named Rauru ki Tahi. Whareroa connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Mauao and the moana Tauranga.

Huria (Judea) marae is located in Brookfield, Tauranga. The primary hapū is Ngāi Tamarawaho of Ngāti Ranginui.
The whare tipuna is named Tamatea Pokaiwhenua and the wharekai are Ihuparapara and Iwipupu. Huria marae connects ancestrally to Takitimu waka, the maunga Mauao and the awa Kopurererua and Waikareao.

Hairini marae is located in Tauranga. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāi Te Ahi of Ngāti Ranginui.
The whare tipuna is named Ranginui and the wharekai is Urutomo. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Mauao and the moana Te Awanui.

Tuapiro marae is located in Katikati, 43 km north of Tauranga. The primary hapū is Ngāti Te Wae of Ngāti Ranginui.
The whare tipuna is named  Ngā Kurī a Wharei. Tuapiro marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka, the maunga Mauao and the awa Waimapu and Tuapiro.
description.mi:
Tuapiro marae is located in Katikati, 43 km north of Tauranga. The primary hapū is Ngāti Te Wae of Ngāti Ranginui.
The whare tipuna is named  Ngā Kurī a Wharei. Tuapiro marae connects ancestrally to the Takitimu waka, the maunga Mauao and the awa Waimapu and Tuapiro.

description.en:
Hangarau Marae (also know as Peterehema) is located in Bethlehem, outside of Tauranga. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāti Hangarau of Ngāti Ranginui.
The whare tipuna is also named Hangarau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Mauao and the moana Te Awanui.
description.mi:
Hangarau Marae (also know as Peterehema) is located in Bethlehem, outside of Tauranga. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāti Hangarau of Ngāti Ranginui.

	The whare tipuna is also named Hangarau. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Takitimu, the maunga Mauao and the moana Te Awanui.

description.en:
Te Rangihouhiri (Oruarahi) marae is located on Matakana Island, just across the harbour from Tauranga. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāi Tamawhariua of Ngāi Te Rangi.

	The whare tipuna is also named Te Rangihouhiri and the marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Mauao and the moana Tauranga.
description.mi:
Te Rangihouhiri (Oruarahi) marae is located on Matakana Island, just across the harbour from Tauranga. The primary hapu for this marae is Ngāi Tamawhariua of Ngāi Te Rangi.

	The whare tipuna is also named Te Rangihouhiri and the marae connects ancestrally to the waka Mātaatua, the maunga Mauao and the moana Tauranga.

wikipedia.en: The Mercury Islands are a group of seven islands off the northeast coast of New Zealand's North Island. They are located 8 kilometres (5 mi) off the coast of the Coromandel Peninsula, and 35 kilometres (22 mi) northeast of the town of Whitianga.

Moturoa / Rabbit Island is a small island that lies across the southernmost part of Tasman Bay, on the northern coast of New Zealand's South Island. The long narrow island runs east-west for 8 kilometres (5 mi), and covers 15 km2 (5.8 sq mi).

description.en:
Matai Whetū marae is located in Kopu, and approximately 7 km south of Thames. There are many hapū associated with the marae including Ngāti Hape, Ngāti Hauauru, Ngāti Hikairo, Ngāti Whanga, and Te Uringahau. 
The marae complex is named Matai Whetū, and the wharenui is Te Rama o Hauraki. The marae connects ancestrally to the tribal collective of Ngāti Maru.
description.mi:
He marae a Matai Whetū kei Kopu, tata ki te 7 kirometa a-tonga o Thames. He maha ngā hapū e hono ana ki te marae nei, ara ko Ngāti Hape, Ngāti Hauāuru, Ngāti Hikairo, Ngāti Whanga, me Te Uringahau.
Ko te ingoa ake o te marae tuturu ko Matai Whetū, te wharenui ko Te Rama o Hauraki. Ōna herenga korero ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maru.

description.en:
Ngahutoitoi marae is located 3 km south of Paeroa, in the Hauraki region. Its wharenui is named Te Awapu. 
The marae connects ancestrally to the tribal collective of Ngāti Tara Tokanui.
description.mi:
Ko tenei marae a Ngahutoitoi kei tētehi 3 kirometa ki te tonga o Paeroa, i te rohe o Hauraki. Ko tōna tupuna whare ko Te Awapu.
Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Tara Tokanui.

description.en:
Mangatangi marae is located near Mangatawhiri, off State Highway 2 on Mangatangi Valley Road. The primary hapū are Ngāti Tamaoho, Ngai Tai, and Ngāti Koheriki, of the Waikato-Tainui confederation.
The wharenui is Marae Kirikiri, the wharekai is Kirihaehae and the guest shelter is Tamaoho. Mangatangi connects to the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Kei tua i te pekanga o te ara matua 2 me te Huarahi Mangatangi Valley koni atu i Mangatāwhiri, te marae o Mangatangi.
Ko Ngāti Tamaoho te hapū matua o Waikato-Tainui iwi.

Ko Kirikiri te wharenui, ko Kirihaehae te wharekai, ko Tamaoho te Wharau Manuhiri. Ko Taupiri te maunga, ko Waikato te awa.

description.en:
Wharekawa (Kaiaua) marae is located in Whakatiwai, two minutes drive north of Kaiaua on the corner of Rata and East Coast roads. The primary hapu are Te Uri Karaka, Ngāti Hura, Kauahi and Ngāti Kapu of the Hauraki-Tainui iwi Ngāti Paoa and also Ngāti Whanaunga.
The marae consists of the wharenui Paoa–Whanaunga, the wharekai Whakatutuki, the whare karakia Paoa, and Whare Akonga, which houses Te Kohanga Reo O Wharekawa. Wharekawa marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Kohukohunui, to Tikapa moana and to the awa Whakatiwai.
description.mi:
Kei Whakatīwai e rua mīneti te tawhiti raro mai i Kaiaua, kei te pekanga o ngā Huarahi Rata me East Coast, te marae o Wharekawa.

Nō Te Uri Karaka, Ngāti Hura, Kauahi me Ngāti Kapu hapū o Hauraki-Tainui iwi o Ngāti Pāoa me Ngāti Whanaunga.

Ko Pāoa-Whanaunga te wharenui, ko Whakatutuki te wharekai, ko Pāoa te whare karakia me Whare Akonga mō Te Kohanga Reo O Wharekawa.Ko maunga Kohukohunui te maunga, ko Tīkapa te moana, ā, ko Whakatīwai te awa.

description.en:
Napinapi marae is located in Te Mapara, Piopio, approximately 20 km southwest of Te Kuiti. The wharenui is named Parekahuki and the wharekai is named Turongonui. 
The principal hapū associated with Napinapi marae are Paretekawa and Rahurahu, and the marae links to the maunga of Kahuwera and the awa of Mokau. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Napinapi marae kei Te Mapara, Piopio, āhua 20 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Te Kuiti. Tōna tupuna whare ko Parekahuki, te wharekai ko Turongonui.
Ō Napinapi ake hapū ko Paretekawa rāua ko Rahurahu, ōna herenga kōrero ki te maunga o Kahuwera, me Mokau awa. Ko tōna waka ko Tainui, ko Ngāti Maniapoto iwi.

description.en:
Rereamanu marae is located approximately 6 km south of Ōtorohanga, in the Waikato region. Its hapū are Huiao and Te Kanawa. The wharenui is named Te Kawaumaaro Tuatahi and Tuarua and the wharekai is Tuirirangi.  
Rereamanu links to the awa Mangapu and the two maunga of Pirongia and Kakepuku. The marae celebrates Taniora Turingenge as a prominent tupuna of Rereamanu and connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Rereamanu e tu ana ki tētehi 6 kirometa ki te tonga o Otorohanga, i te rohe o Waikato. Ōna ake hapū ko Huiao me Te Kanawa. Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kawau Kakī Mārō I & II, ko tō te wharekai ko Tuirirangi.
Ō Rereamanu herenga kōrero ki te awa o Mangapu, ngā maunga o Pirongia rāua ko Kakepuku. Kua whakahonoretia e Rereamanu tērā tupuna rongonui a Taniora Turingenge, me ō rātou hononga ki a Tainui waka, ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Te Paemate marae is located in Aria, 37 km south of Te Kūiti. The principal hapū associated with the marae is Paemate. 
The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Aorangi, the awa Mokau and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Te Paemate marae kei Aria, tētehi 37 kirometa ki te tonga o Te Kuiti. Tōna ake hapū ko Paemate.
Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Aorangi, Mokau awa me Maniapoto whānui.

description.en:
Maniaroa marae is located in the coastal settlement of Awakino, 75 km south west of Te Kūiti on State Highway 3. The principal hapū associated with Maniaroa marae include Ngāti Rākei, Rungaterangi and Waiora. 
The wharenui is named Te Kohaarua. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
During its great voyage to Aotearoa, some aboard the Tainui waka disembarked just north of Maniaroa marae at Mōkau. The anchor stone of the waka now rests in the concrete foundations of Maniaroa marae. The marae complex has been built, extended, and relocated a number of times from the 1800s to the mid-1900s. The third wharenui was formally opened in 1987.
description.mi:
Ko Maniaroa marae kei te takutai moana o Awakino, 75 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Te Kuiti i te Huarahi Matua 3. Ō Maniaroa ake hapū ko Ngāti Rākei, Rungaterangi me Waiora.
Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kohaarua. Ko ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, me Maniapoto whānui.
I tōna whakawhitinga mai ki Aotearoa, ka heke iho ngētehi o te waka Tainui, i te raki o Maniaroa marae, ki Mōkau. Kei reira te punga kowhatu o te waka e takoto ana inaianei – kua noho mai i ngā tuāpapa mārō o Maniaroa marae. Ka hangaia te marae, whakanuihia ake, kātahi ka nekehia mō ngā wa maha, mai ngā tau 1800s ki waenganui 1900s. I whakatuwheratia te tupuna whare tuatoru i te tau 1987.

description.en:
Te Hape marae is located in Benneydale, 46 km southwest of Te Kuiti. The primary hapū is Tuwhakahekeao of the iwi Rereahu.
The wharenui is named Kaha-tua-tini. Te Hape marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pureora and the awa Waimiha.
description.mi:
Ko Te Hape marae kei Benneydale, tētehi 46 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Te Kuiti. Tōna ake hapū ko Tuwhakahekeao o te iwi o Rereahu.
Ko Kaha-tua-tini te tupuna whare. Ō Te Hape herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Pureore me te awa o Waimiha.

description.en:
Mangapeehi marae is located in Kopaki, 30 km southwest of Te Kuiti. Its primary hapū are Matakore, Ngutu, Pare, Raukawa, Rereahu and Te Ihingarangi of Ngāti Maniapoto.
The wharenui is named Rereahu. Mangapeehi marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Mangapu and the maunga Tokipuhuki. The builder of the whare was Mahuri Tawhana, whilst Wehi Te Ringitanga and his kuia Te Huinga Waikohika were instrumental in establishing the marae itself.
description.mi:
Ko Mangapeehi marae kei Kopaki, 30 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Te Kuiti. Ōna ake hapū ko Matakore, Ngutu, Pare, Raukawa, Rerahu me Te Ihingarangi o Ngāti Maniapoto.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Rereahu. Ō Mangapeehi herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te awa o Mangapu, me te maunga o Tokipuhuki. Na Mahuri Tawhana te whare i hanga, ko Wehi Te Ringitanga me tōna kuia a Te Huinga Waikohika ngā tāngata i whakapau kaha kia tū ai te marae.

description.en:
Waimiha (Te Ihingarangi) marae is located at the southern end of the small settlement of Waimiha between Benneydale and Ongarue, 36 km south of Te Kuiti. Its primary hapū is Te Ihingarangi of Ngāti Maniapoto.
The wharenui is named Te Ihingarangi and the marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Ongarue and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Ko Waimiha marae (Te Ihingarangi) kei te tonga o Waimiha papakāinga, waenganui o Benneydale me Ongarue, tētehi 36 kirometa ki raro atu o Te Kuiti. Tōna ake hapū ko Te Ihingarangi o Ngāti Maniapoto.
Ko te ingoa o te tupuna whare ko Te Ihingarangi. Ō te marae herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te awa Ongarue me te maunga o Maungatautari.

description.en:
Te Tokanganui a Noho marae (also known as Te Kūiti Pā) is located on State Highway 3 in the township of Te Kūiti. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Apakura and Ngāti Rora, both descendants of Ngāti Maniapoto.
Te Tokanganui a Noho was built in 1873 under the guidance and direction of Te Kooti Arikirangi. Te Kooti then gifted the wharenui to Ngāti Maniapoto as a gesture of thanks for their hospitality, shortly before he was pardoned by the New Zealand government in 1883.
The whare tipuna is also named Te Tokanganui a Noho. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Motakiora and the awa Mangaokewa river.
description.mi:
Ko Te Tokanganui a Noho marae (ko Te Kūiti Pā ano) e tū mai ana i te Huarahi Matua 3 ki te taone o Te Kuiti. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Apakura, me Ngāti Rora, he whakahekenga no Ngāti Maniapoto.
I hangaia a Te Tokanganui a Noho i te tau 1873, e Te Kooti Arikirangi. Ka mutu ka kohaina te tupuna whare nei ki a Ngāti Maniapoto, hei whakanui i tā rātou āwhina, i mua tata a te Kāwanatanga tangohanga tohu whakaiti i te tau 1883.
Ko tō Te Tokanganui a Noho tupuna whare ko tērā ingoa anō hoki. Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Motakiora, me Mangaokewa awa.

description.en:
Otewa marae (also referred to as Ko Te Hokingamai ki te Nehenehenui marae) is located 10 km to the east of Ōtorohanga. Its hapu are Matakore, Ngutu, Parewaeono, Rereahu and Urunumia. 
The wharenui is named Ko Te Hokingamai ki te Nehenehenui and the wharekai is Aroha Nui. Otewa connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Waipa, the maunga Pirongia and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Otewa marae (he ingoa anō hoki Ko Te Hokingamai ki te Nehenehenui marae) kei te 10 kirometa ki te rāwhiti o Otorohanga. Ōna ake hapū ko Matakore, Ngutu, Parewaeono, Rereahu me Urunumia.
Tō te tupuna whare ingoa Ko Te Hokingai ki te Nehenehenui, te wharekai ko Aroha Nui. Ō Otewa herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te awa o Waipa, Pirongia maunga me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Te Korapatu marae is located 5 km north of Te Kuiti, close to the airfield. The hapū associated with Te Korapatu are Ngāti Peehi and Ngāti Te Kanawa. 
The wharenui is named Te Korapatu and the wharekai is Ngarauwharawhara Tua Rua. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Kakepuku, the awa Mangaokewa and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Te Korapatu e tū mai ana i tētehi 5 kirometa ki te raki o Te Kuiti, tata ki te taunga manurere. Ō Te Korapatu hapū ko Ngāti Peehi me Ngāti Te Kanawa.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Korapatu, te wharekai ko Ngarauwharawhara Tua Rua. Ko ōna o te marae herenga kōrero, ki a Tanui waka, te maunga o Kakepuku, Mangaokewa awa me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Te Ahoroa marae is located 9 km east of Te Kuiti. Its primary hapū are Pare and Rereahu of Ngāti Maniapoto.
The wharenui is named Tapairu. Te Ahoroa marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Waipa and Mangarapa and the maunga Rangitoto.
description.mi:
He marae a Te Ahoroa kei tētehi 9 kirometa ki te rāwhiti o Te Kuiti. Ōna ake hapū ko Pare me Rereahu o Ngāti Maniapoto.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Tapairu. Ō Te Ahoroa marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, ngā awa of Waipā raua ko Mangarapa, me te maunga o Rangitoto.

description.en:
Tomotuki marae (also known as Parekaitini) is located 8 km west of Te Kūiti. The hapū associated with Tomotuki marae are Ngāti Apakura, Ngāti Parekaitini and Ngāti Rōrā. 
The wharenui is named Parekaitini and the wharekai is Te Whare o Te Ora. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Tomotuki marae , e mōhiotia ana hoki ko Parekaitini, kei tētehi 8 kirometai ki te hauāuru o Te Kuiti. Ōna hapū ko Ngāti Apakura, Ngāti Parekaitini me Ngāti Rōrā.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Parekaitini, te wharekai ko Te Whare o Te Ora. Ō te marae herenga kōrero, ki a Tainui waka, me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Mōtiti marae is located 7 km south-west of Te Kūiti, on Mangatea Road. The principal hapū associated with Mōtiti marae are Ngāti Te Puta-i-te-muri, Ngāti Tauhunu, Ngāti Urunumia and Ngāti Kinohaku.
The wharepuni are named Ko Te Hunga-iti and Te Hāpainga. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Kakepuku and Pirongia, the awa Mangapū and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Mōtīti he marae kei tētehi 7 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Te Kuiti, I te Huarahi o Mangatea. Ō Mōtītī hapū ko Ngāti Te Puta-i-te-muri, Ngāti Tauhunu, Ngāti Urunumia me Ngāti Kinohaku.
Ko ngā ingoa wharepuni ko Te Hunga-iti me Te Hāpainga. Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Kakepuku rāua ko Pirongia, te awa o Mangapū, me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Mangarama marae is located 8 km south of Te Kūiti, on State Highway 3. The principal hapū associated with Mangarama marae is Ngāti Apakura. 
The wharenui is named after Rongorongo. The marae connects ancestrally to the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto, the maunga Horohoro and the awa Mangarama.
description.mi:
Ko te marae o Mangarama kei tētehi 8 kiroeta ki te raki o Te Kuiti, I te Huarahi Matua 3. Tō Mangarama marae hapū ko Ngāti Apakura.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Rongorongo. Ō te marae herenga kōrero, ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto, te maunga o Horohoro me Mangarama awa.

description.en:
Rereamanu marae is located approximately 6 km south of Ōtorohanga, in the Waikato region. Its hapū are Huiao and Te Kanawa. The wharenui is named Te Kawaumaaro Tuatahi and Tuarua and the wharekai is Tuirirangi.  
Rereamanu links to the awa Mangapu and the two maunga of Pirongia and Kakepuku. The marae celebrates Taniora Turingenge as a prominent tupuna of Rereamanu and connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Rereamanu e tu ana ki tētehi 6 kirometa ki te tonga o Otorohanga, i te rohe o Waikato. Ōna ake hapū ko Huiao me Te Kanawa. Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kawau Kakī Mārō I & II, ko tō te wharekai ko Tuirirangi.
Ō Rereamanu herenga kōrero ki te awa o Mangapu, ngā maunga o Pirongia rāua ko Kakepuku. Kua whakahonoretia e Rereamanu tērā tupuna rongonui a Taniora Turingenge, me ō rātou hononga ki a Tainui waka, ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Oparure marae, also known as Te Waipatoto, is located in 7 km north-west of Te Kūiti. The principal hapū associated with the marae is Ngāti Kinohaku.
The wharenui are Te Waipatoto and Waipatoto Tuarua and the wharekai is named Te Tuhi-o-te-ao-marama. Oparure connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the two maunga Pukehokio and Te Tuhi o Te Ao Marama, the awa Mangapu and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Oparure marae, e mōhiotia ana hoki ko Te Waipatoto kei tētehi 7 kirometa ki te raki-a-uru o Te Kuiti. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Kinohaku.
E rua ngā tupuna whare ko Te Waipatoto me Waipatoto Tuarua, te wharekai ko Te Tuhi-o-te-ao-marama. Ō Oparure herenga kōrero, ki a Tainui waka, ngā maunga Pukehokio rāua ko Te Tuhi o Te Ao Mārama, ki a Mangapū awa, me Ngāti Maniapoto iwi.

description.en:
Kaputuhi Pā is located 11 km north of Te Kuiti, at the junction of State Highway 3 and Waitomo Caves Road. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Kaputuhi.
The wharenui is named Kaputuhi and the wharekai is Muri-Aroha. The wharenui was originally situated at Waikeria; it then moved to Te Kawa before relocating to its present site at Hangātiki in the late 1940s. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Mangapū and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Kaputuhi Pā he marae kei tētehi 11 kirometa ki te raki o Te Kuiti, i te tūtakitanga o Huarahi Matua 3 me tērā huarahi o Waitomo Caves. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Kaputuhi.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Kaputuhi, te wharekai ko Muri-Aroha. I tū te tupuna whare i Waikeria i mua, kātahi ka nekehia ki Te Kawa i mua o te haringa atu ki tōna tūranga inaianei arā i Hangatiki, i ngā rerenga tau 1940s. O te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te awa o Mangapū me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Kahotea marae is located 6 km north of Ōtorohanga, in the Waikato region. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Apakura, Hinetū, Matakore and Pare te Kawa. 
The wharenui is Whatihua and the wharekai is Puna o Te Aroha. Kahotea connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto.
description.mi:
Ko Kahotea marae e tū mai ana i tētehi 6 kirometa ki te raki o Otorohanga, i te rohe o Waikato. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Apakura, Hinetū, Matakore me Pare te Kāwai.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Whatihua, te wharekai ko Puna o Te Aroha. Ō Kahotea herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, me te iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Te Keeti marae is located on the eastern edge of Ōtorohanga, in the Waikato region. Its principal hapū are Ngutu, Parewaeono and Urunumia. 
The wharenui is named Parewaeono. Te Keeti connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka and the tribal collective of Ngāti Maniapoto. Te Keeti also links to the maunga Pirongia. In 1937 Te Keeti was gazetted and set aside for the common use and benefit of the tribes of Maniapoto as a marae and papakainga. The original Te Keeti wharenui was replaced in 1983 with a new steel-framed building.
description.mi:
Ko Te Keeti mara kei te rāwhiti o Otorohanga, i te rohe o Waikato. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngutu, Parewaeono, me Urunumia.
Ko Parewaeono te tupuna whare. Ō te marae herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, me Ngāti Maniapoto whānui. He here hoki o Te Keeti ki a Pirongia maunga. I te tau 1937 i tohua turetia a Te Keeti, ka whakawāteahia mo ngā iwi o Maniapoto, hei marae me te papakāinga. I whakatūhia anō tētehi whare tupuna, i te tau 1938, ko ngā pou whakaū he rino, hei whakakī i te ngaronga o Te Keeti tupuna whare tuatahi.

description.en:
Maketū marae is located on the northern shores of the Kawhia Harbour, in Kawhia township. The hapū is Ngāti Mahuta. The whare tipuna is named Auau ki te Rangi in honour of Hoturoa, and was opened in 1962. Auau ki te Rangi was the father of Hoturoa (the navigator of the Tainui waka), who is said to have been buried on the small puke behind the marae when the waka landed at Maketu.
The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the moana Kawhia and the maunga Pirongia and Karioi.
description.mi:
