Ko Maketū marae kei Kawhia moana tonu, i tua tonu atu o te taone. Ko Ngāti Mahuta te hapū. Tōna tupuna whare, Auau ki te Rangi he ingoa whakanui i a Hoturoa, na i whakatuwharetia i te tau 1962. He matua a Auau ki te Rangi no Hoturoa (te kaihautū o Tainui waka), nā e kiia ana kei te puke i muri tonu atu o te marae ia e takoto ana, i te wā ka ū te waka ki uta.
Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki aTainui waka, Kawhia moana, huri atu ki a Pirongia me Karioi maunga.

description.en:
Ōkapu marae is located on the inner reaches of the Aotea Harbour, 8 km north of Kawhia township and close to Matakowhai Bay. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Te Wehi and Ngāti Mahuta.
The whare tupuna is called Te Kotahitanga o Ngāti Te Wehi. Ōkapu marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Karioi, the moana Aotea and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko Ōkapu marae kei roto mai o Aotea whanga, tētehi 8 kiirometa ki te raki o Kawhia taone, tata hoki ki te Whanga o Matakowhai. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Te Wehi me Ngāti Mahuta.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Te Kotahitanga o Ngāti Te Wehi. Ō Ōkapu herenga korero ki te waka o Tainui, te maunga Karioi, te moana Aotea me te awa Waikato.

description.en:
Mōkai Kāinga marae is located just 5 km north of Kawhia township, on the west coast of the North Island (Te Ika a Maui). The primary hapū for this marae Ngāti Pare and Ngāti Te Mihinga hapū of Ngāti Hikairo. Mōkai Kāinga is also connected to Waikato-Tainui tribal confederation.
The whare tipuna is Ko Te Mōkai. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the moana Kawhia, the maunga Pirongia and the awa Waipa.
Click here for Mōkai Kāinga land block details.
description.mi:
Ko Mōkai Kāinga he marae e tū mai ana i tētehi 5 kirometa ki te raki o Kawhia taone, i te hauāuru o Te Ika a Maui. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Pare me Ngāti Te Mihinga o Ngāti Hikairo, o Waikato-Tainui iwi.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Te Mōkai. Ko ō Mokai Kāinga herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te moana o Kawhia, Pirongia maunga me te awa o Waipa.
Hono mai i konei ki ngā panui whānui o ngā whenua papatupu.

description.en:
Hīona marae is located in Puketotara, Ngutunui, in the Waikato region, about 20 km north-west of Ōtorohanga. Hīona's principal hapū is Ngāti Pourahui and it connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka. The marae is part of the Ngāti Maniapoto tribal collective. 
Hīona consists of the wharenui Te Awananui and the wharekai Puna Aroha Puna Kai - and the name 'Hīona' is an English transliteration of Zion, which means ‘the righteous heart’.
description.mi:
He marae a Hīona e tu mai ana i Puketotara, Ngutunui, tētehi 20 kirometa ki te raki-a-uru o Otorohanga. Ko tōna ake hapū ko Pourahui, ōna herenga korero ki a Tainui waka. He iwi tēnei nō ngā kārangaranga o Maniapoto.
Ko tō Hiona tupuna whare ko Te Awananui, te wharekai ko Puna Aroha, Puna Kai – te ingoa Hīona he whakapākehā i a Zion, tōna tikanga ko te ‘manawa tū tika’.

description.en:
Te Kōraha is located south of the Kāwhia harbour, 68 km west of Otorohanga, just north of Lake Taharoa and close to the coast. The primary hapū for Te Kōraha are Ngāti Rangitaka me Ngāti Mahuta of Waikato.
The whare tipuna is Te Ōhākī and the wharekai is Te Arohanui. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Mitiwai, the moana Kāwhia and the maunga Orangiwhao.
description.mi:
Ko Te Kōraha marae kei te tonga o Kāwhia moana, tētehi 68 kirometa ki te uru o Otorohanga, raki nei o Taharoa Roto, tata ki te moana. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Rangitaka me Ngāti Mahuta o Waikato.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Te Ohākī, te wharekai ko Te Arohanui. Ō Te Kōraha herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te awa o Mitiwai, Kāwhia moana, me te maunga Orangiwhao.

description.en:
Waipapa marae is located just to the north of Kawhia township, on the west coast. Waipapa marae belong to the Ngāti Hikairo hapū of Ngāti Te Mihinga, Ngāti Rāhui and Ngāti Pōkaia. The whare tupuna is called Ngā Tai Whakarongorua and the wharenui is named Takuhiahia.
Ngā Tai Whakarongorua is over 100 years old. The original names for the whare were Te Whānau  Pani and then Te Mihinga. Takuhiahia wharenui can sleep up to 300 and is used for wānanga, hui and tribal gatherings.
description.mi:
Ko Waipapa marae e tū mai ana i te raki o Kawhia taone-iti, ara i te taha moana hauāuru. Ko nga hapū  o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Te Mihinga, Ngāti Rāhui and Ngāti Pōkaia no Ngāti Hikairo. Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Ngā Tai Whakarongorua, he wharenui anō ko Takuhiahia.
Neke atu i te 100 tau te kaumātua o Ngā Tai Whakarongorua. Ko ngā ingoa tuatahi mo te whare ko Te Whānau Pani, ka huri ki a Te Mihinga. Ka taea te 300 tangata te moe i roto i a Takuhiahia, e whakamahia ana hoki mō ngā wānanga me ngā hui-a-iwi.

description.en:
Rākaunui marae is located, 30 km from Kawhia township on the inner edges of the Kawhia harbour, and to the 63 km to the west of Te Awamutu. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Ngutu and Ngāti Paretekawa of the Waikato-Tainui tribal confederation, and Kerapa, Takiari and Te Waha of Ngāti Maniopoto. 
The whare tupuna is known as Moanakahakore. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the moana Kawhia, and the maunga  Pirongia and Hikuranga.
description.mi:
Ko Rakanui he marae kei tētehi 30 kirometa mai te taone o Kawhia, i roto mai o te whanga, 63 kirometa hoki ki te hauāururu o Te Awamutu. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Ngutu, ko Ngāti Paretekawa o Waikato-Tainui iwi, me Kerapa, Takiari, Te Waha o Ngāti Maniapoto.
Tōna tipuna whare ko Moanakahakore. Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te moana o Kawhia, Pirongia me Hikuranga maunga.

description.en:
Waingaro marae is located 7 km south of Waingaro and 25 kilometres northeast of Raglan, on the northern shores of the Whaingāroa (Raglan) Harbour. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Maahanga and Ngāti Tamainupo. 
The whare tupuna is Ngā Tokotoru. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Waikato and the maunga Taupiri.
description.mi:
Ko Waingaro marae kei tētehi 7 kirometa ki te tonga o Waingaro, me te 25 anō ki te raki—a-rāwhiti o Whaingaroa, i te raki hoki o Whaingaroa Wahapū. Ō Waingaro ake hapū ko Ngāti Māhanga me Ngāti Tamainupo.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Ngā Tokotoru. Ko ō te marae herenga kōrero ki te waka o Tainui, te awa o Waikato me Taupiri maunga.

description.en:
Poihākena marae is located in Raglan (Whaingāroa), about 50 km due west of Hamilton. The primary hapū for this marae is Ngāti Tahinga of Tainui.
The whare tupuna is Tainui a Whiro. The marae connects to the Tainui waka, the moana Whaingāroa, the awa Wainui and the maunga Karioi.
description.mi:
Ko te marae o Poihākena kei Whaingaaroa, āhua 50 kirometa ki te hauāuru o Kirikiriroa. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Tahinga o Tainui.
Ko Tainui a Whiro te ingoa o te tupuna whare. Ō te marae nei herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te moana o Whaingāroa, te awa o Wainui me Karioi maunga.

description.en:
Te Papa o Rotu (Te Oneparepare) marae is located 15 km to the west of Hamilton in Whatawhata. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Maahanga and Ngāti Tamainupo of Waikato-Tainui. 
The main whare tipuna is Papa o Rotu. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka.
description.mi:
Ko Te Papa o Rotu (Te Oneparepare) marae kei tētehi 15 kirometa ki te hauāuru o Kirikiriroa i Whatawhata. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Maahanga me Ngātu Tamainupō o Waikato-Tainui.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Papa o Rotu. Ōna herenga korero ki a Tainui waka.

description.en:
Aramiro marae, also known as Te Kaharoa, is located 25 km southeast of Raglan in the Waitetuna Valley. Its  hapū are Ngāti Ruateatea and Ngāti Tonganui, with hapū connections also to Ngāti Paratai and Ngāti Maahanga.
The whare tipuna is Te Kaharoa. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pirongia.
description.mi:
Ko Aramiro, ara e mōhiotia ana hoki ko Te Kaharoa, kei te 25 kirometa ki te tonga-a-rāwhiti o Whaingaroa i te koawa o Waitetuna. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngaati Ruateatea me Ngaati Tonganui. He hononga ano ki nga hapū o Ngaati Paratai me Ngaati Maahanga.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Te Kaharoa. Ō tēnei marae herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Pirongia.

description.en:
Te Tihi o Moerangi marae is located on the edge of Aotea Harbour at Makomako, 21 km north of Kawhia township. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Te Weehi and Ngāti Mahuta.
The whare tipuna is named Te Puke Okiokinga and the wharekai is Te Aumihi. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Karioi and the moana Aotea.
description.mi:
Ko Te Tihi o Moerangi he marae kei te taha o Aotea wahapū i Makomako, tētehi 21 kirometa raki o Kawhia taone. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Te Weehi me Ngāti Mahuta.
Ko Te Puke Okiokinga te ingoa o te tupuna whare, ko Te Aumihi te ingoa o te wharekai. Ō te marae herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga Karioi me Aotea moana.

description.en:
Papa o te Aroha marae is located in Tokoroa. The primary hapu for this marae is He marae a Hāpori, of the Ngāti Raukawa tribal collective. 
The whare tupuna is Matapihi o te Rangi, and the wharekai is called Te Mataora o te Whenua. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Waikato and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Ko Papa o te Aroha marae kei Tokoroa e tū mai ana. Ko te hapū ake mō tēnei marae nō Ngāti Raukawa iwi.
He tupuna whare kei konei, tōna ingoa ko Matapihi o te Rangi, te wharekai ko Te Mataora o te Whenua. Ōna herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te tupuna awa o Waikato me Maungatautari maunga.

description.en:
Ōngāroto marae is located 45 km north of Taupō, on the banks of the Waikato River. The primary hapū is Ngāti Whaita of Ngāti Raukawa.
The whare tipuna is named Whaita. Ōngāroto connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pohaturoa and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko Ōngāroto marae kei tētehi 45 kirometa ki te raki o Taupō, i ngā tahatika o te tupuna awa Waikato. Ko tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Whaita o Ngāti Raukawa.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Whaita. Ō Ōngāroto herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga Pohaturoa me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Mōkai marae is located just off Tirohanga Road, in Mōkai, about 27 km northwest of Taupō. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hā, Ngāti Moekino, Ngāti Parekaawa, Ngāti Tarakaiahi, Ngāti Te Kohera and Ngāti Wairangi of the iwi Ngāti Raukawa and Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Pakake Taiari, after an ancestral chief, and the wharekai is named Parehingaawatea after his wife. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Tongariro and the awa Waikato.
On 15 August 2015 a fire destroyed the wharekai, Parehingaawatea. Efforts are currently underway to rebuild the wharekai.
description.mi:
Mōkai marae is located just off Tirohanga Road, in Mōkai, about 27 km northwest of Taupō. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Hā, Ngāti Moekino, Ngāti Parekaawa, Ngāti Tarakaiahi, Ngāti Te Kohera and Ngāti Wairangi of the iwi Ngāti Raukawa and Ngāti Tūwharetoa.
The wharenui is called Pakake Taiari, after an ancestral chief, and the wharekai is named Parehingaawatea after his wife. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Tongariro and the awa Waikato.
On 15 August 2015 a fire destroyed the wharekai, Parehingaawatea. Efforts are currently underway to rebuild the wharekai.

description.en:
Whakaaratamaiti marae is located just 2.5 km to the south of Putāruru town centre. The primary hapū of the marae are Ngāti Ahuru and Ngāti Mahana of Ngāti Raukawa.
The whare is named Korōria. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Orakanui and Waikato and the maunga Hautere and Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Ko Whakaaratamaiti marae e tū mai ana i tētehi 2.5 kirometa ki te tonga o Putāruru taone. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Ahuru, Ngāti Mahana o Ngāti Raukawa iwi.
He tupuna whare ko Kororia te ingoa. Ko ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, ngā tupuna awa o Orakanui rāua ko Waikato, me ngā maunga o Hautere rāua ko Maungatautari.

description.en:
Mangakaretu marae is located 5 km west of Putāruru, on the road to Arapuni. The primary hapū for this marae is Ngāti Ahuru of Ngāti Raukawa.
The wharenui is Ngā Hau E Maha. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the awa Waikato and the maunga Maungatautari.
description.mi:
Ko Mangakaretu marae e tū mai ana i tētehi 5 kirometa ki te hauāuru o Putāruru, i te huarahi ki Arapuni. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Ahuru o Ngāti Raukawa.
Ko Ngā Hau E Maha te tupuna whare. Ko ō te marae herenga kōrero ki aTainui waka, te awa o Waikato me Maungatautari maunga.

description.en:
Pikitū marae is located in Waotu, just to the east of Lake Arapuni and 19 km  west of Tokoroa. The primary hapū for this marae is Ngāti Huri of Ngāti Raukawa.
The whare is named Huri and the marae connects to the Tainui waka, the awa Waikato and the maunga Wharepuhunga. The whare, Huri, was built circa 1870, and a hangi pit was installed adjacent to the whare, which is still in use today. 
The marae complex is designed to cater for up to 250 people, with extensive facilities in place that have been well maintained over the decades.
description.mi:
Ko Pikitū marae kei Waotu, ki te rāwhiti o Arapuni Roto, tētehi 19 kirometa hoki ki te hauāuru o Tokoroa. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Huri o Ngāti Raukawa.
He tupuna whare ko Huri, ko ō te marae herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, te tupuna awa o Waikato me Wharepūhunga maunga. I whakatūhia te whare nei a Huri i te tau 1870, na ka keria tētehi rua hāngi tata atu ki te marae, e whakamahia tonutia ana i ēnei rā. I whakaritea te marae kia tata ai te 250 tāngata te whāngai. I tua atu he nui ngā wāhi hei manaaki tangata, pai ana hoki te tiaki o aua wāhi nei mai noa atu.

description.en:
Te Ūkaipō marae is located 13 km southeast of Matamata, at Te Poi. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae are Ngāti Kirihika and Ngāti Wehiwehi. 
The marae belongs to the tribal collective of Ngāti Raukawa. The wharenui is named Wehiwehi.
description.mi:
Te Ūkaipō marae is located 13 km southeast of Matamata, at Te Poi. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae are Ngāti Kirihika and Ngāti Wehiwehi. 
The marae belongs to the tribal collective of Ngāti Raukawa. The wharenui is named Wehiwehi.

description.en:
Raungaiti marae is located on State Highway 27 in Tamihana. The principal hapū that affiliates with this marae is Ngāti Haua.
The wharenui is named Te Oro. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka collective of Tainui and a kohanga reo sits adjacent to the marae.
description.mi:
Ko Raungaiti marae kei te Huarahi 27 i Tamihana. Tōna ake hapū mo tēnei marae ko Ngāti Haua.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Te Oro. He herenga tō tēnei marae ki a Tainui waka. Kua tū hoki he kohanga reo kei tua tonu atu o te marae.

description.en:
Te Iti o Hauā marae (also known as Tauwhare) is located 15 km to the east of Hamilton, near Matangi. The primary hapū for this marae are Te Rangitaupi and Te Iti o Hauaa of the iwi Ngāti Hauaa.
The whare tipuna is named Hauā. Wharekai Tamangaarangi. The wharemoe (back) Tumataura and Hinekune.The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Maungatautari and the awa Waikato. The marae complex was refurbished in 2009
description.mi:
Ko Te Iti o Hauā marae (e mōhiotia ana hoki ko Tauwhare) e tū mai ana i tētehi 15 kirometa ki te rāwhiti o Kirikiriroa, e tata nei ki Matangi. Ōna ake hapū ko Te Rangitaupi me Te Iti o Hauaa o te iwi o Ngāti Hauaa.
Tō te marae tupuna whare ko Hauā, te wharekai ko Tamangaarangi. Ko Tumataura and Hinekune ngā wharemoe. Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, Maungatautari maunga me te tupuna awa o Waikato. I whakahoutia te marae i te tau 2009.

description.en:
Maungatautari marae is located 18 km southeast of Cambridge and just north of Maungatautari maunga. The primary hapū for this marae include Ngāti Haua, Ngāti Korokī and Ngāti Wairere. 
The whare tupuna is Te Manawanui and the wharekai is Tirohia. The original whare, also called Te Manawanui, was opened on 21 October 1918. This was built by Te Ruatahapari who also constructed the wharenui at Whareroa marae in Tauranga. The second and current Te Manawanui was completed in 1979 and opened by Te Arikinui Te Atairangikaahu.
The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Maungatautari and the awa Waikato. Speaking protocol for both tangi (funeral rituals) and hui (general meetings) are guided by the kawai of tū mai, tū atu.
description.mi:
Ko Maungatautari he marae 18 kirometa ki te tonga-a-uru o Kemureti, kei te raki atu o Maungatauari maunga. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Haua, Ngāati Koroki me Ngāti Wairere.
Te tupuna whare ko Te Manawanui, te wharekai ko Tirohia. Ko te tupuna whare tuatahi, tōna ingoa ko Manawanui anō, i tuwhera mai i te 21 o Oketopa 1918. I hangaia tēnei whare e Te Ruatahapari, nāna hoki tō Whareroa tupuna whare i Tauranga i hanga. I oti te tupuna whare tuarua e tū mai ana inaianei a Te Manawanui i te tau 1979, nā Te Arikinui Te Atairangikaahu i whakatuwhera.
Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, Maungatautari maunga me te tupuna awa o Waikato. Ko te kawa mo ngā hui tangi me ngētehi atu, ko te tū mai, tū atu.

description.en:
Pōhara marae is located 34 km southeast of Cambridge, across the river from Arapuni. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Korokī and Ngāti Mahuta.
The wharenui is Rangiātea and Pōhara marae ancestrally links to the Tainui waka.
description.mi:
Ko Pōhara marae e tū mai ana i tētehi 34 kirometa ki te tonga-a-rāwhiti o Kemureti, rahaki atu o te awa i Arapuni. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Korokī me Ngāti Mahuta.
Ko Rangiātea te tupuna whare, ō Pōhara herenga korero ki a Tainui waka.

description.en:
Aotearoa marae is located in Ōkaiawa, near the Waingongoro River. Its principal hapū is Ōkahu-Inuāwai of the iwi Ngāruahine. 
The whare are named Aotearoa and Ngākaunui. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Aotearoa, the maunga Taranaki and the awa Waingongoro.

Pūrekireki marae is located 6km to the south of Pirongia township. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Taramatau (with affiliations also to Ngāti Apakura) of Ngāti Hikairo, sharing links also with Waikato and Ngāti Maniapoto iwi.
The whare tupuna is Marutehiakina. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pirongia and the awa Waipā.
Click here for Purekireki marae land block details.
description.mi:
Pūrekireki marae is located 6km to the south of Pirongia township. Its primary hapū is Ngāti Taramatau of Ngāti Hikairo, sharing links also with Waikato and Ngāti Maniapoto iwi.
The whare tupuna is Marutehiakina. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Pirongia and the awa Waipā.
Click here for Purekireki marae land block details.

description.en:
Taupiri marae is located just under Taupiri mountain, 9 km to the south of Huntly and just north of Hopuhopu. The primary hapū for this marae include Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai and Ngāti Whaawhaakia. 
The wharenui is named Pani Ora. The marae connects to the Tainui waka, the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko Taupiri he marae kei raro tonu mai o Taupiri maunga, tētehi 9 kirometa nei ki te tonga o Rāhuipōkeka, me te raki o Hopuhopu. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai me Ngāti Whaawhaakia.
He tupuna whare ko Pani Ora tōna ingoa. Ō te marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, Taupiri maunga me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

wikipedia.en: Tūrangawaewae Marae is located in the town of Ngāruawāhia in the Waikato region of the North Island of New Zealand. A very significant marae, it is the headquarters for the Māori King Movement and the official residence and reception centre of the head of the Kīngitanga - currently the Māori King, Tuheitia Paki.

description.en:
Tūrangawaewae marae is located on River Road in Ngāruawāhia, on the banks of the Waikato River. The primary hapū for this marae are Ngāti Mahuta and Ngāti Te Weehi of Waikato-Tainui. The main whare tupuna are Mahinaarangi (1929) and Turongo (1938), which is the Māori monarch’s official residence.
The marae was built on land purchased in 1921 by Te Puea Herangi. Tūrangawaewae is the headquarters for the Māori King Movement (Te Kīngitanga). Until her death in 2006, the marae was the official residence of the sixth Māori monarch, Te Arikinui Dame Te Atairangikaahu.
description.mi:
Ko Tūrangawaewae e tū mai ana i Te Huarahi Awa (River Road) ki Ngāruawāhia, kei te tahatika tonu mai o tupuna awa Waikato. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Mahuta, me Ngāti Te Weehi o Waikato-Tainui. ngā tūpuna whare ko Mahinaarangi (1929) me Tūrongo (1938) ka waiho te marae, me ēnei hei Whare Ariki mō Te Ariki.
I whakatūhia te marae ki te whenua nā Te Puea Herangi i hoko i te tau 1921. Koinei ko Tūrangawaewae te marae o te Kingitanga. Mai te tau 2006 ki tōna matenga koinei ake te marae matua o te Arikinui Te Atairangikaahu, te tuaono o ngā Ariki.

description.en:
Waahi marae is located on the banks of the Waikato River, adjacent to the Huntly Power Station. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai and Ngāti Whaawhaakia. The marae sits upon a section of the Parish of Pepepe Lot 42 and 42 x 1 Block Order File 711/W, and in 1955 this area was designated as an area for community buildings.
The wharenui is named Tāne i te Pupuke. Waahi marae connects to the Tainui waka, the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
E takoto ana i te tahatika tonu o te tupuna awa Waikato a Waahi marae, tata atu hoki ki te Teihana Hiko o Rāhuipōkeka. Ōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai me Ngāti Whaawhaakia. E takoto ana te marae nei i tētehi wehenga whenua o te Pārihi o Pepepe Wāhanga 42, te Tohu Rārangi Pepa 711/W. I te tau 1955 ka hurihia tēnei whenua hei tūnga mo ngā whare-a-hāpori.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ko Tāne i te Pupuke. Ōna herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, Taupiri maunga me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Te Kauri marae is located 5 km west of Huntly township, across the river. The hapū that affiliate with Te Kauri marae are Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai, Ngāti Whaawhaakia and Te Ngaungau.
The wharenui is named Karaka. The marae connects ancestrally to the Tainui waka, the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko Te Kauri he marae kei tētehi 5 kirometa ki te hauāuru o te taone o Rāhuipōkeka, i tērā tahatika o te awa. Ōna ake hapū e here ana ki a Te Kauri ko Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai, Ngāti Whaawhaakia me Te Ngaungau.
Tōna tupuna whare ko Karaka. Ko ōna herenga korero ki a Tainui waka, Taupiri maunga, me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Te Ōhākī is located approximately 10 km east of Matamata. The marae belongs to the iwi Ngāti Hinerangi and its principal hapū is Ngāti Tokotoko.
The wharenui is named Te Ōhākī. In early 2012, Ngāti Hinerangi celebrated the opening of their new wharekai, Te Puna Aroha.
description.mi:
Te Ōhākī is located approximately 10 km east of Matamata. The marae belongs to the iwi Ngāti Hinerangi and its principal hapū is Ngāti Tokotoko.
The wharenui is named Te Ōhākī. In early 2012, Ngāti Hinerangi celebrated the opening of their new wharekai, Te Puna Aroha.

description.en:
Kaitumutumu marae is located on a hectare of land in Huntly. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae include Ngāti Whaawhaakia as well as Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta and Ngāti Tai. The wharenui is named Ruateatea, the wharekai is Whaawhaakia and the kitchen complex (or kauta) is named Nga Mangamanga.
The marae ancestrally links to the Tainui waka, the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato. Speaking protocols on Kaitumutumu marae are guided by the kawa of tauutuutu. The name ‘Kaitumutumu’ refers to the cows in the area constantly chewing their cud.
description.mi:
Ko te marae o Kaitumutumu e noho ana i runga i te heketea kotahi i Rāhuipōkeka. Ōna hapū matua ko ērā o Ngāti Whaawhaakia, Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta me Ngāti Tai. He tupuna whare kei konei, ko Ruateatea tōna ingoa, te wharekai ko Whaawhaakia. Tō te kāuta (tunu kai) ingoa ko ngā Mangamanga.
Ōna herenga korero ki te waka o Tainui, Taupiri maunga me te tupuna awa o Waikato. Ko ngā whakahaere tikanga mo Kaitumutumu marae kei raro i te kawa tau utuutu. Te ingoa nei a Kaitumutumu he tohu ki te ngaungautanga a ngā kau o tēnei papakāinga i a rātou kai.

description.en:
Taniwhamarae is about 1 km east of Taniwha township. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae include Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai and Ngāti Whaawhaakia.
The wharenui is named Me Whakatupu ki te Hua o te Rengarenga. The marae connects ancestrally to the greater waka collective of Tainui and the maunga Taupiri.
description.mi:
Kei tētehi 1 kirometa te marae o Taniwha ki te rāwhiti o Taniwha taone-iti ake. Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko ērā o Ngāti Kuiaarangi, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Tai me Ngāti Whaawhaakia.
Ko tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Me Whakatupu ki te Hua o te Rengarenga. Ō te marae herenga korero ki te waka o Tainui, me te maunga o Taupiri.

description.en:
Rangiriri Pa is located just off State Highway One, 3 km south of Te Kauwhata. The Pa and associated fortifications, is the site of a famous battle that occurred during the land wars. A greatly outnumbered Māori force was attacked by 1500 British troops in one of the crucial battles of the Waikato campaign on 20 November 1863, with both sides suffering heavy casualties.
Part of the central redoubt has been preserved and the grassed over ditches and banks give an impression of the formidable task the British undertook in attempting to drive the Maori from their defences. A Tohu Maumahara (symbol of remembrance) stands at Rangiriri to commemorate those who fought in the Battle of Rangiriri.
description.mi:
Ko te Pa o Rangiriri kei tua mai o te Huarahi Matua 1, tētehi 3 kirometa ki te tonga o Te Kauwhata. He tohu ōna pātuwatawata mo tētehi wāhi pakanga i te wā o ngā whawhai mō te whenua. I whawhaitia te tauā Māori iti e ngā hoia 1500 o Ingarangi, i tēnei tino pakanga ki a Waikato i te 20 o Noema 1863. Te mutunga mai tokomaha ana o ngā taha e rua i hinga.
Kua tohua tērā whenua i reira te pakanga nei, nā ka kitea, i ngā awakeri me ngā tahataha, te toimaha mā ngā hoia o Ingarangi te pana i ngā Māori mai o rātou wāhi tiaki. He Tohu Maumahara kei Rangiriri e whakahonore ana i a rātou i whawhai i te Pakanga o Rangiriri. (Ko ngā korero nā te Historic Places Trust)

description.en:
Horahora marae is located in Rangiriri West, north of Huntly. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae include Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Naho, and Ngāti Pou.
The wharemoe (sleeping house) is named Te Whare i Whakaarohia, and the wharekai is Te Whare Pereue. Horahora marae links ancestrally to the waka collective of Tainui, the maunga Taupiri and the awa Waikato.
description.mi:
Ko te marae o Horahora kei Rangiriri ki te uru, piki raki atu o Rāhuipokeka. Ōna ake hapū ko ērā o Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Naho me Ngāti Pou.
Tōna wharemoe ko Te Whare i Whakaarohia, te wharekai ko Te Whare Pereue. Ō Horahora marae herenga korero ki te waka o Tainui, ki a Taupiri maunga, me te tupuna awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Waikare marae is located on Waikare Road in the Bay of Island locality of Waikare. Its principal hapū is Te Kapotai of the Ngāpuhi confederation, who trace descent from the waka named Ngātokimatawhaorua. 
The whare tupuna is Ko Te Aranga o te paa and the wharenui is Te Huihuinga. Waikare marae connects to the maunga Kapowai and to the Waikare River.
description.mi: Kei te Huarahi Waikare kei te Pēowhairangi i te papakāinga o Waikare te marae o Waikare. Nō Te Kapotai hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae, ko Ngātokimatawhāorua te waka. Ko Te Aranga o Te Pā te wharenui. Ko Kapowai te maunga, ko Waikare te awa.

description.en:
Te Kotahitanga marae is on Rangihamama Road on the western outskirts of Kaikohe. 
Its wharenui, also named Te Kotahitanga (literally ‘The Unity’) was established in 1883. 
The marae links to the hapū of Ngāti Whakaeke within the Ngāpuhi confederation.
description.mi:
Ko Te Kotahitanga marae kei tētehi 1 kirometa noa ki te tonga o Ōtorohanga. Ōna ake hapū ko Pourahi, Te Kanawa me Urunumia.
Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kotahitanga, te wharekia ko Te Rourouiti Haere. Ō Te Kotahitanga herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Rangitoto, Waipa awa me ngā iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Ōraeroa marae is located on Stack Road in Port Waikato. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tāhinga of the Waikato-Tainui confederation.
The wharenui is Whareroa, and its wharekai is Oruarangi. Ōraeroa marae also has a kohanga reo on site. It connects to the maunga Putataka te maunga Kōrero and Taupiri, and to the Waikato River.
The land upon which the marae stands, a total of 16 acres, was provided for under the Native Land Act in 1883. From the early 1950s to the 1990s work on the marae has continued, resulting in the construction of the general marae complex, and eventually also an urupa.
description.mi:
Ko te marae o Oraeroa kei te Huarahi o Stack i te Puaha o Waikato. Tōna ake hapū ko Ngāti Tāhinga o Waikato-Tainui.
Ko te tupuna whare ko Whareroa, te wharekai ko Oruarangi. He kohanga reo to Oraeroa. Ko ōna herenga korero ki te maunga Putataka, ki a Taupiri, me te awa o Waikato.
Tekau mā ono eka te whenua e tu nei te marae, mai i te Ture Whenua-a-Iwi 1883. I ngā tau 1950s ki ngā 1990s ka haere tonu te mahinga o te marae, te mutunga mai ko te marae whānui, me te urupā.

description.en:
Tauranganui marae is located on the Waikato River, 10 km east of Port Waikato on the Tuakau Bridge–Port Waikato Road. Hapū affiliated to Tauranganui include Ngāti Kaiaua, Ngāti Rangiwahitu and Ngāti Tiipa of Waikato iwi
The wharenui is Rangiwahitu, the wharekai is Tu-kotahi and the wharepuni/ruruhau is Ngāti Kaiaua. The marae connects ancestrally to the awa Waikato, and the Tainui waka.
description.mi:
Tauranganui marae is located on the Waikato River, 10 km east of Port Waikato on the Tuakau Bridge–Port Waikato Road. Hapū affiliated to Tauranganui include Ngāti Kaiaua, Ngāti Rangiwahitu and Ngāti Tiipa of Waikato iwi
The wharenui is Rangiwahitu, the wharekai is Tu-kotahi and the wharepuni/ruruhau is Ngāti Kaiaua. The marae connects ancestrally to the awa Waikato, and the Tainui waka.

description.en:
Ngā Tai e Rua marae is located near the centre of Tuakau township.Its two principal hapū are Ngāti Tiipa and Ngāti Āmaru of the Waikato-Tainui confederation.
The wharenui is also named Ngā Tai e Rua, and thewharekai is Reitu. Ngā Tai e Rua marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River.
description.mi:
Ko Ngā Tai e Rua he marae tata tonu ki te taone of Tuakau. E rua ōna ake hapū, ara ko Ngāti Tīpa me Ngāti Amaru he iwi no Waikato/Tainui.
Koira anō hoki te ingoa o te tupuna whare ko Ngā Tai e Rua, tōna wharekai ko Reitu. Ōna pounga korero ki a Taupiri maunga me te awa o Waikato.

description.en:
Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is located on the northern outskirts of Pukekohe. The hapū is Ngāti Tamaoho of the Waikato-Tainui confederation. The wharenui is named Nga Hau e Wha and the wharekai is Te Tari O Te Ora.
There are also a workshop, sports fields, kaumatua flats, a training centre and a kohanga reo. Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River.
description.mi:
Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is located on the northern outskirts of Pukekohe. The hapū is Ngāti Tamaoho of the Waikato-Tainui confederation. The wharenui is named Nga Hau e Wha and the wharekai is Te Tari O Te Ora.
There are also a workshop, sports fields, kaumatua flats, a training centre and a kohanga reo. Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River.

description.en:
Tāhuna marae is located on Tāhuna Pa Road, in the Waiuku area. Tāhuna marae affiliates with Ngāti Te Ata, Waiōhua and Waikato iwi. 
The wharenui is named Teuwira, the wharekai is Te Atai Rehia, the orators’ shelter is Te Hononga and the health and fitness centre is Whareoranga, which promotes individual and group exercise. Tāhuna marae connects ancestrally to the maunga of Maungawhau, Matukutureia, Puketapu and Taupiri, and to the awa Waikato and Awaroa.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Tāhuna Pa, i te rohe o Waiuku te marae o Tahuna. Ko ngērā here ki ngā iwi o Ngāti Te Ata, Waiōhua me Waikato.
Ko Teuwira te tupuna whare o Tāhuna, te wharekai ko Te Atai Rehia, he whare hauora, te pīruru kaikōrero ko Te Hononga, te whakapakari tinana hoki ko Whareoranga. Hei whakaū I te taha hauora-a-tangata, rōpū, iwi hoki te mahi a Whareoranga. Ko ōna herenga kōrero ki ngā maunga o Maungawhau, Matukutureia, Puketapu, Taupiri, me ngā awa hoki o Waikato rāua ko Awaroa.

description.en:
Reretēwhioi marae is located in Waiuku on Taurangatira Road (off Awhitu Road), and is home to the hapu of Ngāti Paretauaa of Waikato iwi.
The wharenui is named Arohanui, the wharekai is Te Iti o Waikato and the orator’s shelter is called Wihere. Reretēwhioi marae has connections to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River. Belonging to the greater waka collective of Tainui, Reretēwhioi marae is guided by the speaking protocol of tu atu, tu mai.
description.mi:
He marae a Reretēwhioi kei Waiuku, i te Huarahi o Taurangatira (huri atu ki Awhitu), ā koinei te papakāinga o ō Ngāti Paretauaa o Waikato iwi.
Ko Arohanui te tupuna whare, te wharekai ko Te Iti o Waikato, te pīruru kaikōrero ko Wihere. Ō Reretewhioi herenga korero ki a Taupiri maunga, me te awa o Waikato. Nō te waka o Tainui whānui, ko te kawa o Reretēwhioi marae he tū atu, tū mai.

description.en:
Whātāpaka marae is located along a private road at the end of Whātāpaka Road in Waiuku. The principal hapu associated with Whātāpaka are Ngai Tai, Ngāti Koheriki and Ngāti Tamaoho. The marae complex hosts the wharenui Tamaoho, the wharekai Te Kupenga and the wharemoe Te Ohaki o nga Tupuna. 
Whātāpaka marae sits upon a reservation, Parish of Karaka Lot 64D, which was set aside for the purpose of establishing a community plaza for the affiliated hapu. Whātāpaka marae, through the primary hapu of Ngāti Tamaoho, has occupied this area for close to 1000 years.
description.mi:
Ko Whātāpaka marae kei tētehi huarahi motuhake, i te pito whakamutunga o Whātāpaka Huarahi kei Waiuku. Ōna ake hapū tuturu o Whātāpaka ko Ngai Tai, Ngāti Koheriki me Ngāti Tamaoho. Kei te marae ko te tupuna whare nei ko Tamaoho, te wharekai Te Kupenga me te Te Ohaki o ngā Tupuna wharemoe.
E tu ana a Whātāpaka i tētehi whenua, arā te Pārihi o Karaka, Wehenga 64D, i whakawāteahia hei whakatū papakāinga-a-hapū. Kua tata te 1000 tau o Whātāpaka marae, mai tōna taha ki a Ngāti Tamaoho hapū e tū ana i konei.

description.en:
Umupuia marae is on the shores of Magazine Bay on Maraetai Coast Road. It is principally associated with Ngai Tai, who trace descent from the Tainui waka.
The wharenui is Ngeungeu and the wharekai is Raukohekohe. Umupuia is further defined by the maunga Kohukohunui, the Wairoa River and the moana Tikapa.
description.mi:
Kei te ākau o Magazine Bay, kei Maraetai te marae o Umupuia. Nō Ngāi Tai iwi, i heke mai ngā uri i te waka o Tainui.
Ko Ngeungeu te wharenui, ko Raukohekohe te wharekai.
Ko Kohukohunui te maunga, ko Te Wairoa te awa, ā, ko Tīkapa te moana.

description.en:
Piritahi marae is located in Te Huruhi Bay, a few minutes walk from the main village of Oneroa on Waiheke Island. The marae connects ancestrally to the tribal collective of Ngāti Paoa. 
The whare is also named Piritahi. ‘Piritahi’, meaning ‘coming together as one’, commemorates the union of two previously warring tribes from Ngāpuhi and Ngāti Paoa. The marae is a continued testament to that union. The marae now sits on the village location, where the local Ngāti Paoa lived.
description.mi:
Ko Piritahi marae e tu mai ana i Te Huruhi Whanga, tata noa te hīkoi mai te papakāinga o Oneroa kei te moutere o Waiheke. Ōna herenga korero ki te iwi whānui o Ngāti Paoa.
Koira anō hoki te ingoa o te tupuna whare ko Piritahi. ‘E noho tahi ana’ te tikanga o tēnei ingoa, he maumaharatanga mo te piringa tahitanga o ngā iwi e whawhai ana i mua, ara o Ngāpuhi me Ngāti Paoa. E tu ana te marae i te papakāinga i reira te iwi o Ngāti Paoa e noho ana, na he tohu te marae o tērā hononga o enei iwi e rua

wikipedia.en: Rangitoto Island is a volcanic island in the Hauraki Gulf near Auckland, New Zealand. The 5.5 km (3.4 mi) wide island is a symmetrical shield volcano cone, reaching a height of 260 m (850 ft). Rangitoto is the youngest and largest of the approximately 50 volcanoes of the Auckland volcanic field, having formed in an eruption about 600 years ago, and covering an area of 2,311 ha. It is separated from the mainland of Auckland's North Shore by the Rangitoto Channel. Since World War II, it has been linked by a causeway to the much older, non-volcanic Motutapu Island.
wikipedia.mi: Ko Rangitoto he moutere ahi tipua e tata ana ki Tāmaki-makau-rau. Kei te taha o Motutapu e takoto ana.

description.en:
Motairehe marae is located in Katherine Bay, on the northwestern coast of Aotea (Great Barrier Island), north of Kawa marae. The hapū Ngāti Rēhua, Ngāti Wai ki Aotea, Te Uri Papa and Te Uri Whakapiko belong to the iwi Ngāti Wai.
The wharenui is named Whakaruruhau, which adjoined by a wharekai and the associated kaumatua building is called Wharekowhai.
description.mi:
Kei Katherine Bay ki te ākau māuru-mā-raki o te motu Aotea, kei raro mai i te marae o Kawa, te marae o Motairehe.

Nō Ngāti Wai ki Aotea, Te Uri Papa me Te Uri Whakapiko hapū o Ngāti Wai tēnei marae.

Ko Whakaruruhau te wharenui e hono ana ki te wharekai, ā, ko Wharekōwhai te whare kaumātua.

description.en:
Kawa (Ngāti Wai o Aotea) marae is located in Katherine Bay, on the northwestern coast of Aotea (Great Barrier Island), south of Motairehe marae. It belongs to Ngāti Wai. 
Currently Kawa marae is under reconstruction. It connects ancestrally to the maunga Hirakimata and to the coastal region called Te Moananui o Toitehuatahi.
description.mi:
Kei Katherine Bay ki te ākau māuru-mā-raki o te motu Aotea, kei runga ake i te marae o Mōtairehe, te marae o Kawa. Nō Ngāti Rēhua hapū o Ngāti Wai tēnei marae.
E hanga houtia ana te wharenui i tēnei wā. Ko Hirakīmaka te maunga, ko Te Moana-nui-ā-Toi te takiwā.

wikipedia.en: Little Barrier Island, or Hauturu in Māori language, lies off the northeastern coast of New Zealand's North Island. Located 80 kilometres (50 mi) to the north of Auckland, the island is separated from the mainland to the west by Jellicoe Channel, and from the larger Great Barrier Island to the east by Cradock Channel. The two aptly named islands shelter the Hauraki Gulf from many of the storms of the Pacific Ocean.
wikipedia.mi: Ko Hauturu he nohanga o te rohe whenua o Waikato. E ai ki Toitū Te Whenua, he nohanga he wāhi nohoia e te tangata, engari kāore anō kia tae te nui o te taupori ki te nui e taea ai te kī he tāone tonu taua wāhi rā. Ko te rohe whenua o Waikato he rohe whenua nui; ko ngā takiwā o roto ko Waikato, ko Hauraki. He takiwā ēnei o Aotearoa; kei Te Ika-a-Māui aua takiwā.

wikipedia.en: Great Barrier Island lies in the outer Hauraki Gulf, New Zealand, 100 kilometres (62 mi) north-east of central Auckland. With an area of 285 square kilometres (110 sq mi) it is the sixth-largest island of New Zealand and fourth-largest in the main chain. Its highest point, Mount Hobson, is 627 metres (2,057 ft) above sea level. The local authority is the Auckland Council.
wikipedia.mi: Ko Aotea he moutere ki te rāwhiti o Tīkapa Moana. Ko Ngāti Rehua te iwi o reira.

description.en:
Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is located on the northern outskirts of Pukekohe. The hapū is Ngāti Tamaoho of the Waikato-Tainui confederation. The wharenui is named Nga Hau e Wha and the wharekai is Te Tari O Te Ora.
There are also a workshop, sports fields, kaumatua flats, a training centre and a kohanga reo. Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River.
description.mi:
Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is located on the northern outskirts of Pukekohe. The hapū is Ngāti Tamaoho of the Waikato-Tainui confederation. The wharenui is named Nga Hau e Wha and the wharekai is Te Tari O Te Ora.
There are also a workshop, sports fields, kaumatua flats, a training centre and a kohanga reo. Nga Hau E Wha O Pukekohe marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Taupiri and to the Waikato River.

description.en:
Orakei marae is centrally located in Auckland on Kitemoana St, Orakei, above Okahu Bay off Tamaki Drive. The three hapū named Nga Oho, Te Taou and Te Uringutu affiliate to the Ngāti Whātua confederation.
In 1991 Orakei marae was returned to Ngāti Whātua after its Okahu Bay predecessor had been confiscated in the 1950s. The wharenui is named Tumutumuwhenua and Mahuhu-ki-te-rangi is the associated waka. Orakei marae is ancestrally linked to the maunga Maungakiekie and Maungawhau, as well as to Tamaki River and Waitemata Harbour.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Kitemoana kei runga o Ōkahu tua i te huarahi Tāmaki Drive, te marae o Ōrākei. Nō Ngā Oho, Te Tāou, me te Uringutu hapū o Ngāti Whātua iwi tēnei marae.
I te tau 1991 i hakahokia te marae o Ōrākei ki Ngāti Whātua i muri mai i te raupatunga o ngā whenua o Ōkahu i waenganui o tērā rau tau.
Ko Tumutumuwhenua te wharenui, ko Māhuhukiterangi te waka, ko Maungakiekie me Maungawhau ngā maunga, ko Tāmaki te awa, ko Te Waitematā te moana.

description.en:
Waipapa marae is located just to the north of Kawhia township, on the west coast. Waipapa marae belong to the Ngāti Hikairo hapū of Ngāti Te Mihinga, Ngāti Rāhui and Ngāti Pōkaia. The whare tupuna is called Ngā Tai Whakarongorua and the wharenui is named Takuhiahia.
Ngā Tai Whakarongorua is over 100 years old. The original names for the whare were Te Whānau  Pani and then Te Mihinga. Takuhiahia wharenui can sleep up to 300 and is used for wānanga, hui and tribal gatherings.
description.mi:
Ko Waipapa marae e tū mai ana i te raki o Kawhia taone-iti, ara i te taha moana hauāuru. Ko nga hapū  o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Te Mihinga, Ngāti Rāhui and Ngāti Pōkaia no Ngāti Hikairo. Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Ngā Tai Whakarongorua, he wharenui anō ko Takuhiahia.
Neke atu i te 100 tau te kaumātua o Ngā Tai Whakarongorua. Ko ngā ingoa tuatahi mo te whare ko Te Whānau Pani, ka huri ki a Te Mihinga. Ka taea te 300 tangata te moe i roto i a Takuhiahia, e whakamahia ana hoki mō ngā wānanga me ngā hui-a-iwi.

wikipedia.en: The Auckland War Memorial Museum Tāmaki Paenga Hira is one of New Zealand's most important museums and war memorials. Its collections concentrate on New Zealand history, natural history, and military history.

description.en:
Kākāriki marae is located about 9 km northeast of Ruatōria on Waiomatatini Road. Its principal hapū is Te Whānau a Rākaihoea of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Rākaihoea. The marae connects ancestrally to Horouta waka, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi o Waiomatatini te marae o Kākāriki, e 9 kiromita whakateraki-mā-rāwhiti o Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko te hapū matua ko Te Whānau a Rākaihoea o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rākaihoea. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko HIkurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Haranui marae is located at the base of the South Head of the Kaipara Harbour, in the area of Otakanini. The wharenui is named Ngā Tai i Turia ki te Maro Whara.
Te Taou is the principal hapū of Haranui marae and belongs to the Ngāti Whātua confederation.
description.mi:
Kei te pito o South Head i te takiwā o Ōtakānini i Te Kaipara te marae o Haranui.
Ko Ngā Tai i Tūria ki te Mārō Whara te wharenui. Nō te Tāou hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.

description.en:
Kakanui marae is located on the Kaipara Coast Highway 16 in Kakanui. The wharenui is named Te Kia Ora.
Ngāti Rango is the principal hapū of Kakanui marae and belongs to the Ngāti Whātua confederation. Kakanui marae is connected to the maunga named Tuhirangi and to the Kakanui River.
description.mi:
Kei te ākau o Te Kaipara, kei te ara matua 16 te marae o Kākānui. Nō Ngāti Rango hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.
Ko Tuhirangi te maunga, ko Kākānui te awa.

description.en:
Reweti marae is located on State Highway 16 at Reweti, five minutes drive north of Waimauku. The wharenui is named Whiti Te Ra. A principal hapu of Reweti is Te Taoū, which belongs to the Ngāti Whātua confederation.
Reweti marae ancestrally identifies to the waka of Mahuhukiterangi and is connected to the nearby maunga Tauwhare and to Kaipara Harbour.
description.mi:
Kei te ara matua 16 ki Rēweti te marae o Rēweti, e rima mīneti te tawhiti atu raro mai i Waimauku.

Ko Whiti Te Rā te wharenui. Nō Te Tāou hapū matua o Rēweti, hapu o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.
Ko Māhuhukiterangi te waka, ko Tauwhare te maunga, ko Te Kaipara te moana.

description.en:
Puatahi Marae is located at the northern end of the Kaipara Coast Highway (16) close to the settlement of Glorit, and the town of Warkworth. 
 
It belongs to the Ngati Whatua confederation.
description.mi:
Puatahi Marae is located at the northern end of the Kaipara Coast Highway (16) close to the settlement of Glorit, and the town of Warkworth. 
 
It belongs to the Ngati Whatua confederation.

description.en:
Te Pounga marae is situated in Kaiwaka in the eastern reaches of the Kaipara Harbour. It was built at the rear of an old homestead that housed many bishops of Aotearoa, including Bishop Bennett. 
 
The marae belongs to the Te Uri o Hau hapu of Ngāti Whātua. The marae connects with the maunga Puke Karoro and the wider Kaipara Harbour.
description.mi:
Kei Kaiwaka haka-te-marangai o Te Kaipara te marae o Te Pounga. I hangaia i muri tata i tētahi whare mō te tini o ngā Pīhopa o Aotearoa, ko Pīhopa Peneti tētahi.

Nō Te Uri o Hau hapū o Ngāti Whātua iwi tēnei marae. Ko Puke Karoro te maunga, ko Te Kaipara te moana.

description.en:
Taita marae is located in Mamaranui, Dargaville. It belongs to Ngāti Whātua of northern Wairoa.
The name of the wharenui is Kia Mahara Koutou.
description.mi:
Kei Mamaranui, Tākiwira te marae o Taita. Nō Ngāti Whatua o Te Wairoa ki te raki tēnei marae.
Ko Kia Mahara Koutou te wharenui.

description.en: Rīpia marae is located in Rīpia, Te Kopuru. It belongs to the iwi named Te Uri o Hau within the wider Ngati Whatua confederation.
description.mi: Rīpia marae is located in Rīpia, Te Kopuru. It belongs to the iwi named Te Uri o Hau within the wider Ngati Whatua confederation.

description.en:
Ōtūrei marae is located south of the northern Kaipara township of Dargaville. The wharenui is named Rangimārie Te Aroha, and the whare kai is called Atarangi.
The marae belongs to the iwi named Te Uri o Hau within the Ngāti Whatua confederation.
description.mi: Kei runga mai i te tāone o Tākiwīra, Kaipara ki te raki te marae o Ōtūrei. Ko Rangimārie Te Aroha te wharenui, ko Atarangi te wharekai. Nō Te Uri o Hau, hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.

description.en:
Te Houhanga a Rongo marae is located on the northern outskirts of Dargaville and belongs to the Ngāti Whātua confederation. Significant ancestors of Te Houhanga a Rongo marae are Tirarau, Parore Te Awha and Waata Te Ahu. 
 
The wharenui is called Rahiri and was built in 1914 while the wharekai is named Pouwaata.
description.mi:
Kei waho tata, raro mai o Tākiwīra te marae o Te Houhanga-ā-Rongo (Rāhiri). Nō Ngāti Whātua iwi tēnei marae.

Ko ngā tino tūpuna o te marae nei ko Tirarau, rātou ko Parore Te Āwhā, ko Waata Te Ahu.
Ko Rāhiri te whare, i hangaia i te tau 1914. Ko Pouwaata te wharekai.

description.en:
Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae is located in Te Kopuru. The primary hapū for the marae is Te Uri o Hau, of the Ngāti Whātua confederation. The descendants of Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae identify Hakiputatomuri as their key tupuna.
The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Muarangi, to the Kaipara Harbour and to the Wairoa River.
description.mi:
Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae is located in Te Kopuru. The primary hapū for the marae is Te Uri o Hau, of the Ngati Whatua confederation. The descendants of Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae identify Hakiputatomuri as their key tupuna.
The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Muarangi, to the Kaipara Harbour and to the Wairoa River.
Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae is located in Te Kopuru. The primary hapū for the marae is Te Uri o Hau, of the Ngāti Whātua confederation. The descendants of Waikāretu (Pōuto) marae identify Hakiputatomuri as their key tupuna.
The marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Muarangi, to the Kaipara Harbour and to the Wairoa River.

description.en:
Waihaua marae is located in Tinopai, Matakohe. It belongs to the iwi of Te Uri o Hau of the Ngāti Whātua confederation.
The wharenui is named Kirihipi. Waihaua marae connects to the Kaipara Harbour.
description.mi:
Kei Tinopai, Matakohe te marae o Waihaua. Nō te Uri o Hau hapū o Ngāti Whātua iwi tēnei marae.
 
Ko Kirihipi te wharenui, ko Te Kaipara te moana.

description.en:
Ngā Tai Whakarongorua (Tinopai) marae is located at the northern Kaipara settlement of Tinopai. It belongs to the iwi of Te Uri o Hau within the wider confederation of Ngāti Whatua.
Its descendants link directly back to the waka Mahuhukiterangi. The wharenui is known by the same name; Ngā Tai Whakarongorua.
description.mi:
Ngā Tai Whakarongorua (Tinopai) marae is located at the northern Kaipara settlement of Tinopai. It belongs to the iwi of Te Uri o Hau within the wider confederation of Ngāti Whatua.
	Its descendants link directly back to the waka Mahuhukiterangi. The wharenui is known by the same name; Ngā Tai Whakarongorua.

description.en:
Toetoe marae is located in Otaika, Whangarei. The principal hapū are Te Urioroi of the Ngāpuhi confederation, and Te Parawhau and Te Uri o Hau of Ngāti Whātua. 
 
The wharenui is also named Toetoe.
description.mi:
Kei Ōtaika, Whangarei te marae o Toetoe. Nō Te Uriroroi hapū o Ngāpuhi me Te Parawhau, Te Uri o Hau hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.
Ko Toetoe anō te wharenui.

description.en:
Waikaraka marae is located in the small settlement of Kaihu, half an hour north of Dargaville on State Highway 12. 
It belongs to Te Roroa iwi. The wharenui is named Whakarongo.
description.mi:
Kei te kāinga iti o Kaihū te marae o Waikaraka, toru ngahuru mīneti te tawhiti raro mai i Tākiwīra mā motokā, kei te ara matua 12.
 
Nō Te Roroa iwi tēnei marae. Ko Whakarongo te wharenui.

description.en: Waikarā marae is located in Aranga, near Waipoua. This marae belongs to the iwi Te Roroa. The wharenui is named Te Uaua.
description.mi: Kei Aranga tata atu ki Waipoua te marae o Waikarā. Nō Te Roroa hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae. Ko Te Uaua te wharenui.

description.en:
Matatina Marae is located in the midst of the Waipoua Forest and very difficult to locate without local assistance. 
It is accessible via two entry points off State Highway 12, one being near to the Waipoua River. The primary tribal affiliation of Matatina is with Te Roroa.
description.mi: Kei waenganui i te waokū o Waipoua te marae o Matatina. He pakeke te tae atu, me āta whai āwhina mai i te hunga kāinga. E rua nahe ngā kuhunga mai i te ara matua 12, ko tētahi kei te awa o Waipoua. Nō Te Roroa, hapū o Ngāti Whātua tēnei marae.

description.en:
Ahikiwi marae is located in the Kaihu Valley. This marae belongs to the Ngāti Hinga hapu of Ngāti Whātua from Northern Wairoa.
The wharenui is Te Aranga Mai o te Whakapono. Ahikiwi marae connects to the maunga named Tutamoe, to the Kaihu River, and its moana is called Ripiro.
description.mi:
Kei te Riu o Kaihu te marae o Ahikiwi. Nō Ngāti Hinga, he hapū nā Ngāti Whātua nō Te Wairoa tēnei marae. Ko Te Arangamai o Te Whakapono te wharenui. 
 
Ko te maunga hakahī ko Tūtamoe, Ko Kaihu te awa, ko Ripiro te moana.

description.en:
Mataitaua marae is located in Hōreke in the Hokianga, off Rangiahua Road. It represents the Ngāti Toro hapu of Ngāpuhi, who are descended from the waka named Ngātokimatawhaorua, and its navigational leader, Nukutawhiti. 
The wharenui is called Ngāti Toro. Mataitaua marae is also linked to the maunga named Whakarongorua, to the Utakura River and to the Hokianga Harbour (Te Hokianga nui a Kupe).
description.mi:
Kei Hōreke kei Te Hokianga te marae o Mātaitaua puta atu i te Huarahi Rangiāhua.
Nō Ngāti Toro, Te Honihoni, Te Ngahengahe, Te Popoto tēnei marae, hapū nō Ngāpuhi.
He uri ēnei nō te waka Ngātokimatawhāorua me te ariki o runga ko Nukutawhiti. Ko Ngāti Toro te wharenui. Ko Whakarongorua te maunga, ko Utakura te awa, ko Te Hokianga-nui-ā-Kupe te moana.

description.en:
Tauteihiihi marae (Tokimatahorua) is located in Kohukohu in the Far North. The primary hapū for the marae is Te Ihutai of Ngāpuhi.
The wharenui is named Tokimatahourua.
description.mi: Tauteihiihi marae (also known as Tokimatawhaorua) is located in Kohukohu in the Far North. The marae belongs to Te Ihutai hapū, of Ngāpuhi. The wharenui is called Tokimatahourua.

description.en:
Located off State Highway 12, in the rural papakainga of Tāheke, this marae belongs to Ngāti Pākau, Ngāti Te Rauwawe and Te Māhurehure hapū of the wider iwi called Ngā Ngaru o Hokianga of the Ngāpuhi confederation.
The wharenui is named Tāhekeroa and is interchangably used as the name of the marae.
description.mi:
Kei te papakāinga i te tuawhenua kei te ara matua 12, te marae o Tāheke (Tāhekeroa). Nō Ngāti Pākau, Ngāti Te Rauwawe and Te Māhurehure hapū o Ngā Ngaru o Hokianga Takiwā, Ngāpuhi iwi, tēnei marae.

Ko Tāhekeroa te wharenui, ā, he ingoa anō tēnei mō te marae.

description.en:
Kohewhata marae is located just outside the Northland township of Kaikohe along Mangakāhia Road.
The principal hapū are Ngātikura, Takotokē and Te Uri O Hua of the iwi Ngāpuhi. The wharenui is named Puhimoanaariki.
description.mi:
Kei runga i te Huarahi o Mangakāhia māuru-mā-tonga i te tāone o Kaikohekohe te marae o Kohewhata.
Ko Puhimoanaariki te wharenui. Ko ngā hapū matua ko Te Uri O Hua ko te Takotokē me Ngātikura o Ngāpuhi.

description.en:
Moehau marae is located in the Waima Valley up a concealed driveway off Mission Oak Road.
The wharenui is also called Moehau. It is associated with the independent local iwi of Waimā, known as Te Māhurehure.
description.mi: Kei te riu o Waimā te marae o Moehau, kei te kuhunga Mission Oak Road. Ko Moehau te wharenui. Nō te Māhurehure hapū o Ngāpuhi iwi tēnei marae.

description.en:
Motukiore marae is located on Motukiore Road in Hōreke. It aligns with the Ngāpuhi confederation, tracing descent from the waka called Ngatokimatawhaorua.
Motukiore marae connects to the maunga named Maramarua and to the Perenui River.
description.mi: Kei runga te marae o Motukīore i te Huarahi Motukīore. He marae tēnei nō Ngāpuhi. Ko Ngātokimatawhāorua, te waka, ko Maramarua te maunga, ko Perenui te awa.

description.en:
Mataitaua marae is located in Hōreke in the Hokianga, off Rangiahua Road. It represents the Ngāti Toro hapu of Ngāpuhi, who are descended from the waka named Ngātokimatawhaorua, and its navigational leader, Nukutawhiti. 
The wharenui is called Ngāti Toro. Mataitaua marae is also linked to the maunga named Whakarongorua, to the Utakura River and to the Hokianga Harbour (Te Hokianga nui a Kupe).
description.mi:
Kei Hōreke kei Te Hokianga te marae o Mātaitaua puta atu i te Huarahi Rangiāhua.
Nō Ngāti Toro, Te Honihoni, Te Ngahengahe, Te Popoto tēnei marae, hapū nō Ngāpuhi.
He uri ēnei nō te waka Ngātokimatawhāorua me te ariki o runga ko Nukutawhiti. Ko Ngāti Toro te wharenui. Ko Whakarongorua te maunga, ko Utakura te awa, ko Te Hokianga-nui-ā-Kupe te moana.

description.en:
Mokonuiārangi marae is located in Maraeroa, on the western end of Horeke Road in the Hokianga. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tawake ki te Moana, Te Ngahengahe and Ngāti Toro, linking Mokonuiarangi marae to the wider confederation of Ngāpuhi. 
The wharenui is also called Mokonuiārangi.
description.mi:
Mokonuiārangi marae is located in Maraeroa, on the western end of Horeke Road in the Hokianga. The primary hapu are Ngāi Tawake ki te Moana, Te Ngahengahe and Ngāti Toro, linking Mokonuiarangi marae to the wider confederation of Ngāpuhi. 
The wharenui is also called Mokonuiārangi.

description.en:
Te Kotahitanga marae is on Rangihamama Road on the western outskirts of Kaikohe. 
Its wharenui, also named Te Kotahitanga (literally ‘The Unity’) was established in 1883. 
The marae links to the hapū of Ngāti Whakaeke within the Ngāpuhi confederation.
description.mi:
Ko Te Kotahitanga marae kei tētehi 1 kirometa noa ki te tonga o Ōtorohanga. Ōna ake hapū ko Pourahi, Te Kanawa me Urunumia.
Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kotahitanga, te wharekia ko Te Rourouiti Haere. Ō Te Kotahitanga herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Rangitoto, Waipa awa me ngā iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

locale.en: Te Herenga o te Aroha meeting house
locale.mi: Te Herenga o te Aroha whare rūnanga

mi.ascii: Te Herenga o te Aroha whare runanga
mi.double: Te Herenga o te Aroha whare ruunanga

description.en:
Waiwhatawhata marae is located 5 minutes drive south on State Highway 12 from Omapere, on the southern side of the Hokianga Harbour entrance. 
The marae belongs to the Ngāti Korokoro and Ngāti Wharara hapu of Ngāpuhi. The wharenui is Te Kaiwaha.
description.mi:
E rima mīneti te tawhiti atu runga ake i Ōmāpere ki te ara matua 12, i te kuhunga haka-te-tonga o te whanga o Hokianga, te marae o Waiwhatawhata.

Nō Ngāti Korokoro me Ngāti Wharara hapū o Ngāpuhi tenei marae.
Ko Te Kaiwaha te wharenui.

description.en: Paremata marae is found at the end of Paremata Road, near the Utakura River on the upper reaches of the Hokianga Harbour near Horeke. The wharenui is also called Paremata.
description.mi: Kei te pito o te Huarahi Parematā, koni atu i te awa o Utakura kei runga ake i te whanga o Hokianga tata atu ki Hōreke te marae o Parematā. Ko Parematā te wharenui.

description.en:
Te Whakamaharatanga marae (also known as Waimamaku) is on Waimamaku Beach Rd in the South Hokianga, off State Highway 12 between Waimamaku and Omapere. 
The iwi is Te Roroa and the principal hapū are Ngāti Pou, Ngāti Korokoro and Te Pouka.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Waimamaku Beach i Hokianga ki te tonga tua atu i te ara matua 12 kei waenganui o Ōmāpere me Waimamaku te marae o Whakamaharatanga (Waimamaku).

Nō Ngāti Pou, Ngāti Korokoro me Te Pouka hapū o Te Roroa tēnei marae.

description.en:
Ōmanaia (Te Piiti) marae is located in the town of Ōmanaia. The wharenui is named Te Piiti and the whare kai is named Toukahawai.
The marae is located within the rohe of Ngāpuhi.
description.mi:
Ōmanaia (Te Piiti) marae is located in the town of Ōmanaia. The wharenui is named Te Piiti and the whare kai is named Toukahawai.
The marae is located within the rohe of Ngāpuhi.

description.en:
Te Iringa marae is located south of Kaikohe off State Highway 12, on Mataraua Rd. Its hapū of Ngāti Hinemutu and Ngāti Tautahi affiliate to the Ngāpuhi confederation. 
Te Iringa is connected to the nearby Punakitere River.
description.mi:
Kei runga ake o Kaikohekohe tua atu i te ara matua 12, kei runga i te Huarahi Matarāua, te marae o Te Iringa.
Nō Ngāti Hinemutu me Ngāti Tautahi hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. Ko Punakitere te awa.

description.en:
Painoaiho marae is located in Galatea, 3 km east of Murupara on the edge of Te Urewera National Park. Its primary hapu is Ngāti Koro of Ngāti Manawa. 
The wharenui is Ruatapu. Painoaiho marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Tawhiuau and the awa Rangitaiki and Whirinaki.

Te Kotahitanga marae is on Rangihamama Road on the western outskirts of Kaikohe. 
Its wharenui, also named Te Kotahitanga (literally ‘The Unity’) was established in 1883. 
The marae links to the hapū of Ngāti Whakaeke within the Ngāpuhi confederation.
description.mi:
Ko Te Kotahitanga marae kei tētehi 1 kirometa noa ki te tonga o Ōtorohanga. Ōna ake hapū ko Pourahi, Te Kanawa me Urunumia.
Tō te tupuna whare ingoa ko Te Kotahitanga, te wharekia ko Te Rourouiti Haere. Ō Te Kotahitanga herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka, te maunga o Rangitoto, Waipa awa me ngā iwi whānui o Ngāti Maniapoto.

description.en:
Parakao marae (also known as Te Aroha) is located in Parakao. It belongs to the hapū Ngāti Te Rino of the Ngapuhi iwi. Parakao marae also shares genealogical links with futher hapū Ngati Horahia, Ngati Moe, Ngati Toki and Te Parawhau.
The wharenui is named Te Aroha.
description.mi:
Kei Parakao te marae o Parakao (Te Aroha). Nō te hapū Ngāti Te Rino o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. He whanaungatanga ano tenei marae ki nga hapū o Ngāti Horahia, Ngāti Moe, Ngāti Toki me Te Parawhau
Ko Te Aroha te wharenui.

description.en:
Te Huruhi marae is located on Otaenga Road, Awarua, 15 minutes drive south of Kaikohe. The wharenui is Ngāti Māhia and the wharekai is Raumati.
Te Huruhi marae has links to the iwi of Ngāti Hine and to Ngāti Māhia of the Ngāpuhi confederation.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Ōtaenga ki Awarua, kotahi ngahuru mā rima mīneti runga ake i Kaikohekohe te marae o Te Huruhi.

Ko Ngāti Māhia te wharenui, ko Raumati te wharekai. Nō Ngāti Māhia hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.

description.en:
Pukerata (Ōtaua) marae is located in the settlement of Ōtaua in the southern Hokianga. It belongs to Ngaituteauru, Ngati Tipa, Ngati Waihangehange, Ngati Te Ra and Ngati Ue hapū of the Ngāpuhi confederation. 
The name of the wharenui is Te Rau Tawainui and the whare waka is Te Whakaruruhau.
description.mi: Kei te kāinga o Ōtaua te marae o Pukerata (Ōtaua). Nō Ngaituteauru, Ngati Tipa, Ngati Waihangehange, Ngati Te Ra, Ngati Ue hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. Ko Te Rautawainui te wharenui, ā, ko Te Whakaruruhau te whare waka.

description.en:
Te Riingi marae (also known as Mahuhu ki te Rangi) is within the Tautoro Valley, south of Kaikohe. It is one of two standing marae in Tautoro Valley that belong to Ngāti Rangi and Ngāti Moerewa hapū of Ngāpuhi (the other being Te Maata).
Mahuhu ki te Rangi marae embodies the maunga Tautoro and Kereru River. Its wharenui, also called Mahuhu ki te Rangi,  is hall style, typical of marae throughout Te Tai Tokerau. The wharekai is Puhikairarunga.
description.mi: Kei te riu o Tautoro runga mai o Kaikohe te marae o Te Riingi (Māhuhu ki te Rangi). Koia tēnei ko tētahi o ngā marae e rua e tū tonu ana kei te riu o Tautoro nō ngā hapū o Ngāti Rangi, Ngāti Moerewa, Ngāti Kiriahi me Ngare Hauata. Ko Tautoro te maunga, ko Kererū te roto, ko Punakitere te awa. He hōro te āhua o te wharenui, e pērā katoa ana i ngā wharenui o Te Tai Tokerau.

description.en:
Waiparera marae is located on Rangi Point Road, about 13 km from Panguru in the northern Hokianga. It's primary hapū are Patutoka, Te Tawhiu, Tahāwai, Te Hokokeha, Te Whānau Pani and Horohuhaare of Te Rarawa. 
The wharenui is Nukutawhiti, the wharekai is Ruamamao and the whare karakia is Ripeka Tapu. This marae connects with the maunga Tauwhare and Pukerangatira, and the awa Hokianga.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Rangi Point i Te Tai Tokerau te marae o Waipārera.
Nō Patutoka, Te Tāwhiu, Tahaawai me Horohūhāre o Te Rarawa iwi tēnei marae.
Ko Nukutawhiti te wharenui, ko Te Rua Mamao te wharekai, ko Rīpeka Tapu te whare karakia.
Ko Tauwhare te maunga, ko Pukerangatira te awa raro mai i te whanga o Hokianga.

description.en: Korokota marae is located in Titoki. This marae belongs to the Te Parawhau hapu of Ngāpuhi. The wharenui is named Tikitiki o Rangi and the wharekai is Te Rau Awhina.
description.mi: Kei Tītoki te marae o Korokota. Nō Te Parawhau, hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. Ko Tikitiki-o-rangi te wharenui, ko Rau Āwhina te wharekai.

description.en:
Terenga Paraoa marae is located in the heart of Whangarei city. It is connected to the iwi of Ngāti Wai and Ngāti Hine, and also links to the Ngāti Whatua and Ngāpuhi confederations.
The wharenui is Kaka Porowini. Terenga Paraoa marae is named in reference to the Whangarei Harbour, referring to the ‘water in which the whales run’.
description.mi:
Kei waenganui o te tāone nui o Whangarei Terenga Parāoa te marae o Terenga Parāoa. Ko te hunga e whai pānga ana kua hua ake ki roto i te Trust Deed o te marae.
Ko te nuinga o te hunga e whai pānga ana nō ngā hapū o Ngāpuhi me ngā mea kua hua ake nō Ngāti Wai me Ngāti Whātua te hunga i whai whanaungatanga ki a Kākā Porowini.

Ko Kākā Porowini te wharenui. I huaina te marae ki te whanga o Whangarei Terenga Parāoa, ngā wai terenga o ngā tohorā.

description.en:
Takahiwai marae is situated in Ruakaka, Northland. This marae belongs to the Patuharekeke hapu of the Ngāti Whatua confederation; Ngāpuhi and Ngāti Wai.
The wharenui is named Rangiora and there is a kohanga reo onsite. The marae connects to the maunga called Manaia and to the major harbor named Whangarei te Rerenga Paraoa.
Link to further information on Te Wehi NuiLink to further information on Te Wehi Nui
description.mi: Kei Ruakākā runga mai i Whangarei te marae o Takahiwai. Nō Te Patuharakeke hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. Ko Rangiora te wharenui, ā, he kohanga reo kei kona. Ko Manaia te maunga ko Whangarei Te Terenga Parāoa te moana.

description.en:
Pā te Aroha marae is located in Kaikohe. Its primary hapū are Ngāti Te Pou and Te Hikutu of Ngāpuhi.
The wharenui was also named Pā te Aroha, there is current no built complex. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Ngātokimatawharoa.

Pehiaweri marae is on the north-eastern outskirts of Whangarei. The local hapu, Ngati Hau, Te Parawhau and Ngati Hao, descend from the waka called Ngatokimatawhaorua. It also has connections to Ngati Whatua. 
 
The wharenui is Te Reo o te Iwi and the wharekai is Te Re o te Ora. Pehiaweri marae is associated with the maunga named Parihaka and to the Hatea River.
description.mi:
Kei te raki haka-te-marangai o te tāone nui o Whangarei te marae o Pehiāweri. Nō Ngāti Hau, Te Parawhau, me Ngāti Hao hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. He pānga anō tōna ki Ngāti Whātua.

Ko te Reo o te Iwi te wharenui, ā, ko Te Reo o te Ora te wharekai. Ko Parihaka te maunga, ko Hātea te awa.

description.en:
Maungārongo marae is located in Ōhakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tui-o-Nuku of Ngāti Rangi iwi.
The whare are called Ko Te Kingi o Te Maungarongo and Tikaraina Ringapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru.
description.mi:
Maungārongo marae is located in Ōhakune. Its principal hapū is Ngāti Tui-o-Nuku of Te Ātihaunui a Pāpārangi iwi.

	The whare are called Ko Te Kingi o Te Maungarongo and Tikaraina Ringapoto. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Hāuauru.

description.en: Korokota marae is located in Titoki. This marae belongs to the Te Parawhau hapu of Ngāpuhi. The wharenui is named Tikitiki o Rangi and the wharekai is Te Rau Awhina.
description.mi: Kei Tītoki te marae o Korokota. Nō Te Parawhau, hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae. Ko Tikitiki-o-rangi te wharenui, ko Rau Āwhina te wharekai.

description.en:
Ngāraratunua marae is located on the corner of Pipiwai and Church roads in Ngāraratunua, Whangarei. It affiliates to the Ngāpuhi confederation and its primary hapu is Te Kahu o Torongare. It is sometimes referred to as Te Paea.
The wharenui is named Te Paea Soldiers' Memorial; it was originally a hall, and was named by Canon Wiremu Keretene after his wife, Te Paea. Ngāraratunua marae takes its name from the nearby maunga, Ngāraraitunua, and it also connects ancestrally to the maunga Hurupaki, Kaihau, Parihaka, Parikiore and Te Rawhitiroa. Ngāraratunua connects to the waka Ngātokimatawhaorua and the awa Hatea-Hoteo, Te Maruarua, Te Wairua and Umukaraka.
description.mi:
Ngāraratunua marae is located on the corner of Pipiwai and Church roads in Ngāraratunua, Whangarei. It affiliates to the Ngāpuhi confederation and its primary hapu is Te Kahu o Torongare. It is sometimes referred to as Te Paea.
The wharenui is named Te Paea Soldiers' Memorial; it was originally a hall, and was named by Canon Wiremu Keretene after his wife, Te Paea. Ngāraratunua marae takes its name from the nearby maunga, Ngāraraitunua, and it also connects ancestrally to the maunga Hurupaki, Kaihau, Parihaka, Parikiore and Te Rawhitiroa. Ngāraratunua connects to the waka Ngātokimatawhaorua and the awa Hatea-Hoteo, Te Maruarua, Te Wairua and Umukaraka.

description.en:
Te Horo marae is located south of the Waiapu River in Te Horo, Ruatōria. Its principal hapū are Ngāti Horowai, Te Whānau a Mahaki and Te Whānau a Uruhonea of Ngāti Porou iwi.
The wharenui is called Rākaitemania. The marae connects ancestrally to the waka Horouta, the maunga Hikurangi and the awa Waiapu.
description.mi:
Kei Te Horo te marae o Te Horo, kei te tonga o te awa o Waiapu i Ruatōria (Ruatōrea). Ko ngā hapū matua o tēnei marae ko Ngāti Horowai, ko Te Whānau a Māhaki me Te Whānau a Uruhonea o te iwi o Ngāti Porou.
Ko te ingoa o te wharenui ko Rākaitemania. Ko ōna herenga kōrero, ko Horouta te waka, ko Hikurangi te maunga, ko Waiapu te awa.

description.en:
Ngunguru marae is located on Waiotoi Road in the settlement of Ngunguru, along the east coast north of Whangarei. 
The wharenui is named Paratene Te Manu and the wharekai is Manaakitia te Iwi.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Waiotoi i te kāinga o Ngunguru kei te tai marangai o Whangarei te marae o Ngunguru.
 Ko Paratene Te Manu te wharenui, ko Manaakitia Te Iwi te wharekai.

wikipedia.en: The Poor Knights Islands are a group of islands off the east coast of the Northland Region of the North Island of New Zealand. They lie 50 kilometres (31 mi) to the north-east of Whangarei, and 22 kilometres (14 mi) offshore halfway between Bream Head and Cape Brett. Uninhabited since the 1820s, they are a nature reserve and popular underwater diving spot, with boat tours typically departing from Tutukaka. The Poor Knights Islands Marine Reserve surrounds the island. Beaglehole (1955) comments that the origin of the island name is not clear, and speculates that the name could be related to the Poor Knights of Windsor, or, that the islands were named for their resemblance to Poor Knight's Pudding, a bread-based dish topped with egg and fried, popular at the time of discovery by Europeans.

The Hen and Chicken Islands lie to the east of the North Auckland Peninsula off the coast of northern New Zealand. They lie 12 kilometres (7.5 mi) east of Bream Head and 40 kilometres (25 mi) south-east of Whangarei.

The Hen and Chicken Islands lie to the east of the North Auckland Peninsula off the coast of northern New Zealand. They lie 12 kilometres (7.5 mi) east of Bream Head and 40 kilometres (25 mi) south-east of Whangarei.

description.en:
Kaikou marae is in the area known as Matawaia, on the corner of Pipiwai and Lovett Road. On the marae is the wharenui named Eparaima Makapi, which was built in 1938 and named after an American missionary Ephraim Magelby; the wharekai is Te Kauta. The land and buildings were donated by the landowner Hone Peepe.
The primary hapu of Kaikou marae is Te Orewai of Ngāti Hine. Kaikou marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Hikurangi, and the awa Kaikou.
description.mi: Kei te takiwā o Pipīwai te marae o Kaikou, kei te kokonga o ngā huarahi Pipīwai me Lovett e tū ana. Ko Eparaima Mākapi te wharenui, i hua ki a Ephraim Mackleby he mihingare nō te Hāhi Moromona, nana i tākohatia ki te iwi i te hanganga i te tau 1938, ko te wharekai ko Te Kāuta. Nō Te Orewai hapū o Ngāti Hine tēnei marae.

description.en:
Mōtatau marae is in the heart of Mōtatau, off State Highway One south of Kawakawa. The principal hapu is Ngāti Te Tarawa of the iwi of Ngāti Hine. 
Mōtatau marae was built in the 1920s. The wharenui is named Manu Koroki and the wharekai is Mihiwira.
description.mi:
Mōtatau marae is in the heart of Mōtatau, off State Highway One south of Kawakawa. The principal hapu is Ngāti Te Tarawa of the iwi of Ngāti Hine. 
Mōtatau marae was built in the 1920s. The wharenui is named Manu Koroki and the wharekai is Mihiwira.

description.en:
This marae is located outside the settlement of Towai, north of Whangarei. The marae belongs to Ngāti Hau.
The wharenui is named Huiarau, and the second whare is named Ruapekapeka after a former fighting pa located south of Kawakawa.
description.mi:
Kei waho tata o te kāinga o Te Touwai tēnei marae, raro mai i Whangarei. Nō Ngāti Hau hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.
Ko Huiarau te wharenui, ko Ruapekapeka te whare tuarua, i hua ki a Ruapekapeka he Pāmaioro o mua kei runga ake i Te Kawakawa.

description.en:
Matawaia Marae is situated in the area known as Matawaia roughly 40 km inland from Moerewa, south of Kaikohe in Northland. Its main association is with Ngāti Hine.
The wharenui is named Rangimarie, which originally faced eastward toward the wharekai, Miria. Also featured on site are kaumatua flats and a kohanga reo. Matawaia Marae connects ancestrally to the maunga Hikurangi.
description.mi:
E whā ngahuru kirometa te tawhiti mai ki te tuawhenua i Moerewa te marae o Matawaia, kei runga ake i Kaikohekohe. Ko Tekau-i-mua te hapū ririki o Ngāti Hine, hapū o Ngāpuhi.

Ko Rangimārie te wharenui e anganui ana ki te marangai, ki te wharekai o Mīria i mua. Kei te marae e tū ana ngā whare kaumātua/kuikuia me te kohanga reo. Ona herenga korero, ko Hikurangi te maunga.

description.en:
Whakapara marae is located on Puhipuhi Rd beside the Wairua River, 10 minutes drive north of Hikurangi on State Highway 1. 
 
The wharenui is Te Ihi o Nehua. Whakapara marae affiliates to the Ngāti Hao and Ngāti Hau hapu, who affiliate to the Ngapuhi confederation.
description.mi:
Kei te Huarahi Puhipuhi i te taha o te awa o Wairua, kotahi ngahuru mīneti raro mai i Hikurangi tua tata i te ara matua 1, te marae o Whakapara.

Ko Te Ihi o Nehua te wharenui. Nō Ngāti Hau hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.

description.en:
Tauwhara marae is in the heart of Waimate North near the Mission House. The main hapū associated with Tauwhara are Ngāti Hineira, Ngāti Rēhia, Whanautara and Ngāi Tawake ki te Tuawhenua of the Ngāpuhi confederation; descendants trace their ancestry to the ancient waka named Mataatua. 
The wharenui is Te Rangiawhiowhio, and there is a kohanga reo on site. Tauwhara marae connects to the maunga named Whakataha and to the Waitangi River.
description.mi:
Kei te manawa o Te Waimate tata atu ki te Whare Mīhana te marae o Tauwhara. Nō Ngāti Rēhia me Ngāi Tawake ki te Tuawhenua hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.
I heke mai ngā uri i te waka tawhito a Mataatua. Ko Te Rangiāwhiowhio te wharenui, ā, he kohanga reo kei kona. Ko Whakataha te maunga, ko Waitangi te awa.

description.en:
Kāretu marae rests in the Kāretu valley, Taumarere (Bay of Islands), near the sacred river of Taumarere, which flows from Kāretu out to Opua, Paihia and Kororāreka (Russell) in the Bay of Islands. The primary hapu are Ngā Uri o Pomare II, Ngāti Manu, Te Uri Karaka and Te Uri o Raewera.

The tupuna whare also carries the name Ngāti Manu and the wharekai is Memorial Hall. Kāretu marae is connected to the maunga named Puketohunoa (opposite the marae) and to the ancestral waka Ngātokimatawhaorua, Mataatua, Kurahaupo and Māmari.
description.mi: Kei te Pēowhairangi te marae o Kāretu, ko te papakāinga ko Kāretu, koni atu i te awa o Kāretū, e tere ana ki Kororāreka. Ko te hapū matua ko Ngāti Manu o Ngāpuhi. Ko Ngāti Manu anō te wharenui. Ko Puketohunoa te maunga, ko Ngātokimatawhāorua, ko Māmari, ko Mataatua ngā waka tūpuna.

description.en:
Kawa (Ngāti Wai o Aotea) marae is located in Katherine Bay, on the northwestern coast of Aotea (Great Barrier Island), south of Motairehe marae. It belongs to Ngāti Wai. 
Currently Kawa marae is under reconstruction. It connects ancestrally to the maunga Hirakimata and to the coastal region called Te Moananui o Toitehuatahi.
description.mi:
Kei Katherine Bay ki te ākau māuru-mā-raki o te motu Aotea, kei runga ake i te marae o Mōtairehe, te marae o Kawa. Nō Ngāti Rēhua hapū o Ngāti Wai tēnei marae.
E hanga houtia ana te wharenui i tēnei wā. Ko Hirakīmaka te maunga, ko Te Moana-nui-ā-Toi te takiwā.

description.en:
Maurea marae is located in Rangiriri West, north of Huntly. The principal hapū that affiliate with this marae include Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Naho and Ngāti Pou.
The wharenui is named Ngā Tumutumu o Rauwhitu. Maureamarae links to the waka collective of Tainui and the maunga Taupiri.
description.mi:
Kei Rangiriri ki te Uru, kei te raki o Rāhuipōkeka a Maurea marae e tu mai ana. Ōna hapū matua ko Ngāti Hine, Ngāti Mahuta, Ngāti Naho me Ngāti Pou.
Ko Ngā Tumutumu o Rauwhitu te tupuna whare. Ō Maurea marae herenga kōrero ki a Tainui waka me Taupiri maunga.

description.en:
Whitiora (Te Tii) marae is located in the papakainga of Te Tii Mangonui, east of Waipapa. Along with neighbouring Huriharama marae, it affiliates to the Ngāpuhi confederation. 
The wharenui on Whitiora marae is named Te Rangatiratanga. Te Tii Mangonui is also the name of the surrounding moana, which forms part of the wider Te Puna outlet of the Bay of Islands.
description.mi:
Kei te papakāinga o Te Tii Mangonui, raro mai i Waipapa te marae o Whitiora. Pērā katoa i te marae o Hiruhārama Hou, nō Ngāti Rēhia hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.
Ko Te Rangatiratanga te wharenui.

Ko Te Tii Mangonui anō te moana kei roto i te putanga o Te Puna i te Pēwhairangi.

description.en:
Miria marae, also known as Waiomio, is located on State Highway 1 in Waiomio (approximately 5 minutes drive south of Kawakawa). It is associated with Ngati Hine. 
The wharenui is Te Rapunga and the wharekai is Te Hahaunga. Waiomio marae has ancestral links to the mountain Tokerau and to the Taumarere River.
As of 2017, Miria marae trustees wish to relay that the marae is currently under development and is not accepting bookings until further notice. Please connect to Miria marae facebook page for updates.
description.mi:
Kei te ara matua 1 ki Waiomio (e rima mīneti pū te tawhiti runga ake o Te Kawakawa) te marae o Miria. Nō Ngāti Hine hapū o Ngāpuhi tēnei marae.
Ko Te Rapunga te wharenui, ko Te Hauhanga te wharekai. Ko Tokerau te maunga, ko Taumārere te awa.

description.en:
Terenga Paraoa marae is located in the heart of Whangarei city. It is connected to the iwi of Ngāti Wai and Ngāti Hine, and also links to the Ngāti Whatua and Ngāpuhi confederations.
The wharenui is Kaka Porowini. Terenga Paraoa marae is named in reference to the Whangarei Harbour, referring to the ‘water in which the whales run’.
description.mi:
Kei waenganui o te tāone nui o Whangarei Terenga Parāoa te marae o Terenga Parāoa. Ko te hunga e whai pānga ana kua hua ake ki roto i te Trust Deed o te marae.
Ko te nuinga o te hunga e whai pānga ana nō ngā hapū o Ngāpuhi me ngā mea kua hua ake nō Ngāti Wai me Ngāti Whātua te hunga i whai whanaungatanga ki a Kākā Porowini.

Ko Kākā Porowini te wharenui. I huaina te marae ki te whanga o Whangarei Terenga Parāoa, ngā wai terenga o ngā tohorā.

description.en:
Te Rāwhiti marae, also known as Omakiwi, is off the eastern Bay of Island shores of Kaingahoa Bay. The principal hapū are Ngāti Kuta and Patukeha of the iwi Ngāpuhi. 
The wharenui, also called Te Rāwhiti, was built in 1910, and has been repeatedly renovated. Te Rāwhiti marae connects to the maunga Rakaumangamanga, the awa Taumarere and the moana Ipipiri.
description.mi:
Te Rāwhiti marae, also known as Omakiwi, is off the eastern Bay of Island shores of Kaingahoa Bay. The principal hapū are Ngāti Kuta and Patukeha of the Ngāpuhi confederation. 
The wharenui, also called Te Rāwhiti, was built in 1910, and has been repeatedly renovated. Te Rāwhiti marae connects to the maunga Rakaumangamanga and the moana Ipipiri.

description.en:
Oromāhoe marae is located roughly 15 km inland of Waitangi on Porotu Road off State Highway 10. The principal hapu are Ngāti Kawa, Ngāti Rāhiri, Whānaurara, Ngāre Hauata and Matarahurahu of Ngāpuhi. Its identity is associated with the maunga  Pouerua, with Lake Owhareiti and the Waiaruhe River.
Ngāti Kawa is the name of the wharenui and the wharekai is Kuiapo. Adjacent to Oromāhoe marae is the whare karakia named Matiu.
description.mi:
